{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"SharePoint Roadmap Pitstop: July 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-july-2020/ba-p/1557850","description":"<P>July brought a multitude of innovation across Microsoft 365. Our engineering teams have been hard at work on both new experience and refinements to help improve your productivity and give you more ways to disseminate your work, your voice and consume information from your colleagues.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This month brought: A New Employee Onboarding Hub, Hub permissions for visitors, SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) support for SharePoint Server 2019 (GA), Microsoft Lists, Quick Edit improvements, Add to OneDrive, and more. Details &amp; screenshots below, including our audible companion: <STRONG>The</STRONG> <STRONG>Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop: July 2020</STRONG> podcast episode – all to help answer, \"What's rolling out now for SharePoint and related technologies into Microsoft 365?\"</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15417839/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In the podcast episode, I chat with <STRONG>John Sanders </STRONG>(<A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/johnsanders/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">LinkedIn</A> | <A href=\"https://twitter.com/johnsanders\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A>), principal program manager at Microsoft who works on all SharePoint pages and web parts innovation. We talked about all things pages and web parts - most recently aligning with and adopting improvements for page navigation using your keyboard and the broader notion of pervasive accessibility throughout your intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"JohnSanders-plus-pup.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209482i0D44809690F18D51/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"JohnSanders-plus-pup.jpg\" alt=\"John Sanders, principal program manager, and pup - Cooper (SharePoint/Microsoft/Pup's Pops) [Intrazone guest]\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">John Sanders, principal program manager, and pup - Cooper (SharePoint/Microsoft/Pup's Pops) [Intrazone guest]</span></span></P>\n<P>All features listed below began rolling out to Targeted Release customers in Microsoft 365 as of July 2020 (possibly early August 2020).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Inform and engage with dynamic employee experiences</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Build your intelligent intranet on SharePoint in Microsoft 365 and get the benefits of investing in business outcomes – reducing IT and development costs, increasing business speed and agility, and up-leveling the dynamic, personalized, and welcoming nature of your intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New Employee Onboarding Hub</STRONG> (NEO for short, Agent Smith. I took the red pill long ago).</P>\n<P>The NEO hub helps organizations guide new employees from the onset of their first day on the job. The hub provides new employees with the resources, support, and general information they need. It also helps connect them to important people, communities, and culture awareness. It also helps stakeholders contribute to the successes of new employee onboarding.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_002_NEO-hub-solution.jpg\" style=\"width: 800px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209222i05DDF1D68ED64BEA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_002_NEO-hub-solution.jpg\" alt=\"The New Employee Onboarding (NEO) hub, based on SharePoint, helps customers improve their new hire onboarding experience.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The New Employee Onboarding (NEO) hub, based on SharePoint, helps customers improve their new hire onboarding experience.</span></span></P>\n<P>To get it, simply head over to the <STRONG>Look Book site</STRONG>: <A href=\"https://lookbook.microsoft.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">lookbook.microsoft.com</A> – View the designs &gt; Solutions &gt; “<A href=\"https://lookbook.microsoft.com/details/75e60a32-9849-4ed4-b83e-b2b08983ad19\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">New Employee Onboarding Hub</A>.”</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/the-new-employee-onboarding-hub-improving-the-new-hire/ba-p/1530083\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Centralized management for hub visitor permissions</STRONG></P>\n<P>This is an optional feature for both hubs and associated sites which allows for greater viewer access to content and improved discoverability across sites. After enabling a hub to sync to associated sites, hub owners can specify access by individuals, security groups, or Microsoft 365 groups. The new visitor permissions will become activated the next time the viewer accesses the hub.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_003_Hub-permissions-viewers.jpg\" style=\"width: 226px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209223i49639DDA387D67A5/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_003_Hub-permissions-viewers.jpg\" alt=\"Sync hub permissions to associated sites from the hub Permissions pane.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Sync hub permissions to associated sites from the hub Permissions pane.</span></span></P>\n<P>Associated site hub owners can disable the sync for sites that need to remain private from the rest of the hub.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=65641\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">65641</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Learn more:\n<UL>\n<LI>For hub owners&nbsp;-&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/office/set-up-your-sharepoint-hub-site-e2daed64-658c-4462-aeaf-7d1a92eba098\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Setup your hub site</A></LI>\n<LI>For associated site owners–&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/associate-a-sharepoint-site-with-a-hub-site-ae0009fd-af04-4d3d-917d-88edb43efc05\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Associate a SharePoint site with a hub</A></LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) supports migrating content from SharePoint Server 2016 (GA) </STRONG></P>\n<P>SPMT is designed for migrations ranging from the smallest set of files to a large scale enterprise migration. Bring your information to the cloud to take advantage of the latest collaboration, intelligence, and security solutions with Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This past month, we moved beyond public preview and made migrating from SharePoint Server 2016 generally available (GA).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_004_SPMT-SPS2016.jpg\" style=\"width: 885px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209224i9211FB4EFC313C49/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_004_SPMT-SPS2016.jpg\" alt=\"Use the SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) to migrate file shares or Sharepoint Server sites to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams – all in Microsoft 365.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Use the SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) to migrate file shares or Sharepoint Server sites to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams – all in Microsoft 365.</span></span></P>\n<P>In review, SPMT lets you migrate content to SharePoint, OneDrive and Teams from the following locations:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>SharePoint Server 2016</LI>\n<LI>SharePoint Server 2013</LI>\n<LI>SharePoint Foundation 2013</LI>\n<LI>SharePoint Server 2010</LI>\n<LI>SharePoint Foundation 2010</LI>\n<LI>Network and local file shares</LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/SPMT\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: 63258.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>FYI | For all “intelligent intranet” materials – a <STRONG>new intranet resource center</STRONG></P>\n<P>This is a place that makes it easy to harness the power of your *intelligent intranet* -- filled with training videos, templates, demos, customer interviews, and more to help you get started - just head over to <A href=\"https://aka.ms/IntelligentIntranet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://aka.ms/IntelligentIntranet</A> | Explore. Align. Implement. Engage.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_005_intelligent-intranet-resource-center.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209225i869C00D830E00264/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_005_intelligent-intranet-resource-center.jpg\" alt=\"Screenshot of the intelligent intranet resource center (aka.ms/IntelligentIntranet)\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Screenshot of the intelligent intranet resource center (aka.ms/IntelligentIntranet)</span></span></P>\n<P>Once there, you’ll find help articles like:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/plan-intranet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Plan an intelligent SharePoint intranet</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/information-architecture-modern-experience\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Information architecture in modern SharePoint</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/plan-navigation-modern-experience\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Plan navigation for the modern SharePoint experience</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/publishing-sites-classic-to-modern-experience\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Moving from publishing sites to communication sites</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>… and many more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Teamwork updates across SharePoint team sites, OneDrive and Microsoft Teams</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 is designed to be a universal toolkit for teamwork – to give you the right tools for the right task, along with common services to help you seamlessly work across applications. SharePoint is the intelligent content service that powers teamwork – to better collaborate on proposals, projects, and campaigns throughout your organization – with integration across Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Yammer, Stream, Planner and much more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Lists app in Microsoft 365 and eight ready-made templates</STRONG></P>\n<P>We are pleased to <A href=\"https://aka.ms/MSLists/GA/blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">begin roll out of Microsoft Lists</A> – starting this month with the Lists app in Microsoft 365 and eight ready-made templates. The Lists app is the central place for all the lists you access across different sites, with the ability to create new lists using the <STRONG>+ New list</STRONG> button.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_006_MSLists-home.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209226iE5050CAA426CDF79/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_006_MSLists-home.jpg\" alt=\"The Microsoft Lists app in Microsoft 365 - a home for all your lists.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The Microsoft Lists app in Microsoft 365 - a home for all your lists.</span></span></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_007_MSLists-create-Event-itinerary.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209227i9A9D3FBA5E21570A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_007_MSLists-create-Event-itinerary.jpg\" alt=\"Use ready-made templates as you create new lists - above shows the preview when using the Event itinerary template.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Use ready-made templates as you create new lists - above shows the preview when using the Event itinerary template.</span></span></P>\n<P>Microsoft Lists is a Microsoft 365 app that helps you track information and organize work. Lists are simple, smart, and flexible, so you can stay on top of what matters most to your team. Track issues, assets, routines, contacts, inventory and more using customizable views and smart rules to keep everyone notified and in sync. With ready-made templates, you can quickly start lists online, on our coming mobile app, or with Microsoft Teams. And because it’s part of Microsoft 365, you can rely on enterprise-ready security and compliance.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64160\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">64160</A> &amp; <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64166\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">64166</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MSLists\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Improvements to the Quick Edit experience:</STRONG></P>\n<P><EM>Fixed row height </EM>| When in Quick Edit, you will see a new layout option “Fixed Height” within the view drop-down menu. This layout will adjust the height of all rows to the same height to optimize vertical spacing.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64867\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">64867</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><EM>&nbsp;</EM></P>\n<P><EM>Improved Row Selection | </EM>You will see an updated way for selecting single or multiple items. This, too, supports existing copy/paste and drag-to-fill, applicable to multiple rows when using shift+selection. And when navigating and interacting via keyboard key strokes - like what we talked to John Sanders about - a consistent keyboard navigation approach.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64868\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">64868</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><EM>&nbsp;</EM></P>\n<P><EM>There were also a number of visual updates | </EM>You'll see new grid lines, an improved on-hover experience when using your mouse around the grid, themed color bars on the side of list items - including error messaging, a “Create New Item” button at the bottom of quick edit for creating new items inline, and updated column header drop-down menus.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64871\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">64871</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Sticky first column appears while in Quick Edit mode | As users scroll horizontally across a list or documentary library in Quick Edit, the far-left column remains in place.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64866\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">64866 </A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_008_lists-Quick-Edit.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209228i1839D31F97A0BD73/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_008_lists-Quick-Edit.jpg\" alt=\"The new Quick Edit experience showing some of the innovation: updated grid lines, multiselect, Add new button, visual cues and more.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The new Quick Edit experience showing some of the innovation: updated grid lines, multiselect, Add new button, visual cues and more.</span></span></P>\n<P>Learn more about <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/office/edit-list-items-in-sharepoint-dac1a1c3-a80b-4082-ba57-715cf613d0f7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">editing list items</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Improved Image columns for both lists and libraries</STRONG></P>\n<P>We've improved the image upload experience – including mobile camera support. You simply add a new Image column and upload images for that list item of file. This is a default column when using the new Asset manager template, and is a column type that can be added to any list or library.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_009_image-columns.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209229iFBE08C9D59A30A02/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_009_image-columns.jpg\" alt=\"The new image upload experience for lists items - shown above adding a device photo to an inventory list.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The new image upload experience for lists items - shown above adding a device photo to an inventory list.</span></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64872\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">64872</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Rename the Title column</STRONG></P>\n<P>\"Title\" is a good column title title, and now you're en'Title'd and empowered to rename it to whatever you want. Now you can rename the default Title column title and the change will be reflected everywhere - in quick edit, on the associated view, and in the list form.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_010_rename-title.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209230i66C821D13815F935/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_010_rename-title.jpg\" alt=\"Rename the Title column to your preferred name.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Rename the Title column to your preferred name.</span></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=65146\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">65146</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SharePoint pages keyboard shortcuts</STRONG><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P>Much of Windows and Microsoft 365 is navigable via keyboard, and this month, SharePoint pages joined in. This month we released a way to see all the pages keyboard shortcuts you can take advantage of when authoring text, navigating the page or performing undo/redo. Just click <STRONG>Shift + ?</STRONG> when in page edit mode to bring up a list of available keyboard shortcuts. I’m particularly fond of <STRONG>Ctrl + K</STRONG> and <STRONG>Tab</STRONG> – huge time savers.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_011_SP-pages-keyboard-shortcuts.jpg\" style=\"width: 797px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209231i7C29E565D51C81CD/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_011_SP-pages-keyboard-shortcuts.jpg\" alt=\"When in page edit mode, click Shift + ? to bring up the page keyboard shortcuts.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">When in page edit mode, click Shift + ? to bring up the page keyboard shortcuts.</span></span></P>\n<P>Learn more about <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/office/create-and-use-modern-pages-on-a-sharepoint-site-b3d46deb-27a6-4b1e-87b8-df851e503dec\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">working with SharePoint pages</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Automatically block guest access to new files until after security scans are complete</STRONG></P>\n<P>You can enable Data Loss Prevention (DLP) to automatically block external access to new OneDrive and SharePoint files until they have been fully scanned by the service for sensitive information - including search freshness and indexing.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_012_DLP-guest-file-scanning.jpg\" style=\"width: 650px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209232iE31C0C802357EDCB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_012_DLP-guest-file-scanning.jpg\" alt=\"Create and manage DLP policies on the Data loss prevention page in the Microsoft 365 Security &amp; Compliance Center.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Create and manage DLP policies on the Data loss prevention page in the Microsoft 365 Security &amp; Compliance Center.</span></span></P>\n<P>If the file has no sensitive content based on the DLP policy, then guests can access the file. If the policy identifies a file with sensitive content, then guests continue to be prohibited from accessing the file.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Note: There is no change to existing restrictions on guest user access to sensitive files.&nbsp;To <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/sensitive-by-default\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">mark new files sensitive by default</A>, you will need to change a tenant property using PowerShell and a cmdlet. You need to enable least one DLP policy covering all SharePoint and OneDrive content.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=34247\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">34247</A>.&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/compliance/data-loss-prevention-policies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about DLP</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Related technology</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Tasks in Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>It’s time for a coherent task management experience in your hub for teamwork – Microsoft Teams. The new Tasks experience brings together Microsoft Planner and Microsoft To Do into Teams, giving you one place to manage your team plans and individual tasks.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_013_Tasks-in-Teams.jpg\" style=\"width: 794px;\"><img Teams, show on mobile on the left, web on the right.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Tasks in Teams, show on mobile on the left, web on the right.</span></span></P>\n<P>We produced an episode with our Tasks peers, <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/tasks-in-microsoft-teams-the-intrazone-podcast/ba-p/1546074\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">“Tasks in Microsoft Teams” The Intrazone podcast</A>&nbsp;– A discussion with <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/howard-crow-52046a8/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Howard Crow</A>, Partner GPM and <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/shin-yi-lim-97b8a826/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Shin-Yi Lim</A>, PMM – both focused on Planner and Tasks in Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15346253/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=57213\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">57213</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Add to OneDrive</STRONG></P>\n<P>This enables you to add shared folder shortcuts directly to your OneDrive. Shared folders include content that others shared with you through their OneDrive or content that is a part of your shared library in Microsoft Teams or SharePoint.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_014_Add-to-OneDrive.gif\" style=\"width: 900px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209235i928422C9A51FD070/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_014_Add-to-OneDrive.gif\" alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_014_Add-to-OneDrive.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>With Add to OneDrive, not only can you bring all your shared content into one place, but you can also work with the shared content with the same power and flexibility as if they are files you own. This means that the added content can be synced, shared, and collaborated on—and that it retains all existing security and compliance policies. Once added, the \"Add to OneDrive\" shortcuts show up in OneDrive on the web, within Windows File Explorer or Mac Finder, in Teams, and in the OneDrive mobile apps.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This month, the <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SyncUp\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sync Up</A> podcast co-hosts <A href=\"http://linkedin.com/in/ankita-kirti-2101253a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Ankita Kirti</A> and <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jas-mo/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Jason Moore</A> talk with <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/olga-dalecka-5877ab20/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Olga Dalecka</A>, who works on making it easier for you to find your files and successfully managed developing the feature . She takes us behind the scenes sharing leanings, inspirations, hitting roadblocks and usage scenarios for the feature.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15305930/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/f99400/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/office/add-shortcuts-to-shared-folders-in-onedrive-for-work-or-school-d66b1347-99b7-4470-9360-ffc048d35a33\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=56384\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">56384</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Stream - remove unwanted background noise from videos</STRONG></P>\n<P>It’s a noisy world and not every video is produced in a nice studio – often onsite and unable to get everything quiet. Noise suppression, when turned on by video owners, allows viewers to isolate speech from other sounds and music during playback. Noise suppression can be switched on or off for each newly uploaded video.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_015_Stream-background-noise-suppression.jpg\" style=\"width: 294px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209236i896276002A8E41B6/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_015_Stream-background-noise-suppression.jpg\" alt=\"Turn noise suppression on for a video.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Turn noise suppression on for a video.</span></span></P>\n<P>The outcome is the ability to focus on the person speaking, not what’s happening around them. This makes things like remote workplaces and virtual classroom content much more effective. This, too, is the same technology you’ve been hearing about from a Microsoft Teams meetings perspective.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-stream-blog/now-available-remove-unwanted-background-noise-from-videos/ba-p/1506734\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=57301\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">57301</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>On-demand training for OneDrive, SharePoint, Microsoft Lists, Project Cortex, Yammer, Stream and more </STRONG></P>\n<P>Train your mind and the tech will follow.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This series of 14 training videos covers the value and recent updates across SharePoint, OneDrive, Microsoft Lists, Microsoft Teams, Project Cortex, Yammer, and Stream&nbsp; - including information for employees, admins, and developers - all in the context of scenarios supported within Microsoft 365 across teamwork and employee engagement - <STRONG>all</STRONG>&nbsp;in one blog post for you to consume at your leisure.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_016_ODSP-training-videos.jpg\" style=\"width: 721px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209237iA4791950294A7D6F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_016_ODSP-training-videos.jpg\" alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_016_ODSP-training-videos.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/on-demand-training-sessions-for-sharepoint-onedrive-teams-yammer/ba-p/1502851\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Time for a little fun if you made it this far…</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>I’m sure you’ve seen the \"<STRONG>I had a joke</STRONG>\" meme out there on Twitter… well, there were some fun ones leaning in on the SharePoint and OneDrive roasting. Below are a few I’d like to share.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>OK, I'll start with my attempt to join the meme:</P>\n<P>\"I'm working on a @OneDrive joke and syncing about a good punchline... :thinking_face:</img>\" (@MKashman <A href=\"https://twitter.com/mkashman/status/1287402400165138444\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">tweet</A>)</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_017_Tweet-I-had-a-joke_MKashman.jpg\" style=\"width: 492px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209238i71BA4BE7E87A3F4A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_017_Tweet-I-had-a-joke_MKashman.jpg\" alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_017_Tweet-I-had-a-joke_MKashman.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>Here's one from Microsoft MVP, <STRONG>Paul Bullock</STRONG> - Paul tweeted: \"You have to hear my modern SharePoint joke, it’s absolutely classic\" (@PKBullock <A href=\"https://twitter.com/pkbullock/status/1287318024819740672\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">tweet</A>)</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_018_Tweet-I-had-a-joke_PBullock.jpg\" style=\"width: 526px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209239i2D160CFA298A6B7C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_018_Tweet-I-had-a-joke_PBullock.jpg\" alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_018_Tweet-I-had-a-joke_PBullock.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>And a last one from our friend &amp; CVP, <STRONG>Jeff Teper</STRONG> - Jeff tweeted: \"I have a SharePoint joke and you can customize it.\" (@JeffTeper <A href=\"https://twitter.com/jeffteper/status/1287257989242433536\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">tweet</A>)</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_019_Tweet-I-had-a-joke_JeffTeper.jpg\" style=\"width: 534px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209240iFEBEF7E94A44A885/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_019_Tweet-I-had-a-joke_JeffTeper.jpg\" alt=\"IZ-RP-21_July2020_019_Tweet-I-had-a-joke_JeffTeper.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>There's a lot of them out there, just type in your favorite \"product name\" and the word \"joke\" in Twitter’s search and start a'scrollin' and a'LOL'in'!</P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>July 2020 teasers</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Psst, still here? d670a5401f0bd.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209240iFEBEF7E94A44A885/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn25@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-37-628_76118d1919676fc6.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209241i7DD6D1ED3CA9043C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn93@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-42-799_68de6d892500da5b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688824},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"“Tasks in Microsoft Teams” 🎙 – The Intrazone podcast","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/tasks-in-microsoft-teams-the-intrazone-podcast/ba-p/1546074","description":"<P>\n Your task, should you choose to accept it: listen to the new “Tasks in Teams” Intrazone episode. \n <BR />I’ll wait… just let me know when you’re done.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In this episode, Chris and I talk with \n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/shin-yi-lim-97b8a826/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Shin-Yi Lim\n  </A>\n </STRONG> (Senior PMM) and \n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/howard-crow-52046a8/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Howard Crow\n  </A> \n </STRONG>(Partner GPM) about Tasks in Teams. The new Tasks app brings a cohesive task management experience to Microsoft Teams, integrating personal tasks powered by Microsoft To Do and team tasks powered by Planner - all in one place. We dive into Microsoft tasks’ journey, task coherence, app integration, the use of AI, and the overall user experience.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Listen to podcast below\n now\n  </A>\n </STRONG> + show links and more below.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>2020 is officially here and we are ready to help you understand and master all the possibilities that are available in the new modern SharePoint. No matter where you are in the world, we will be close by to help you discover the art of the possible with Microsoft and SharePoint technologies. You will enjoy a plethora of keynotes, breakout sessions and one-on-one networking opportunities. This free event provides technical training led by Microsoft experts and your community. You’ll learn new ways to build solutions, migrate and manage infrastructure, and connect with local industry leaders and peers.</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/events/intelligent-intranet-accelerator-workshop/washington-dc/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Register Today!</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>February 11 -&nbsp;</STRONG>The Intelligent Intranet Accelerator Workshop- Featured as part of <STRONG>Microsoft Ignite The Tour, Dubai</STRONG></P>\n<P>The Microsoft Intelligent Intranet Accelerator Workshop is a hands-on session within Microsoft Ignite The Tour in this location. 21, 2020!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Pack your bags for Vegas to connect face to face with Microsoft SharePoint engineers, Product and Program Managers and the incredible MVP’s of the SharePoint community. It’s not just about mastering the systems and processes that help keep your business running smoothly, it’s also about connecting with the community and seeing what other possibilities are out there to grow your business.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>With sessions, hands-on workshops, the expansive expo hall, not to mention real life deployment and customer examples; you’ll find everything you need to help learn how to optimize the systems and discover the best solution for your business needs.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Since the very first SharePoint Conference in 2006, the goal has been to bring you the most comprehensive and transformative event for SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer, Microsoft Stream, Microsoft Teams, and Microsoft 365. Year over year, we are so excited to share what we have been working on with the community and to hear how you utilize the technologies in your daily buisness. The 2020 SharePoint Conference promises to be no different!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://sharepointna.com/#!/register\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Register before December 31<SUP>st</SUP> 2019</A> to take advantage of the best early bird discounts!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SPC-MS365_vert_RGB.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162239i8B5ABCB37A97C183/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"SPC-MS365_vert_RGB.png\" alt=\"SPC-MS365_vert_RGB.png\" /></span></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 27 Dec 2019 18:59:56 +0000","feedId":13333,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162239i8B5ABCB37A97C183/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400","linkMd5":"0b44637149a20a1c4dcd32074e8b7549","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn93@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-30-558_8312398e38174b0c.webp","destWidth":387,"destHeight":400,"sourceBytes":88204,"destBytes":47974,"author":"Brad McCabe","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162239i8B5ABCB37A97C183/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn93@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-30-558_8312398e38174b0c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688841},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"SharePoint Roadmap Pitstop: March 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-march-2020/ba-p/1268245","description":"<P>I hope everyone is staying safe and connected amid the change of work and life. We know there is new uncertainty and wish to continue the conversation to keep you informed. We want to let you know that the SharePoint team continues to balance service uptime and release updates to maintain reliability and improve your intelligent intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This past month brought multi-lingual publishing, wiki-linking for pages, custom theming for the SharePoint mobile app, updated “add a tab” experience in Microsoft Teams, conditional formatting for lists and more. Details &amp; screenshots below, including the audible companion: <STRONG><A href=\"http://intrazone.mpsn.libsynpro.com/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-march-2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop: March 2020</A></STRONG> podcast episode – all to help answer, \"What's rolling out now for SharePoint and related technologies into Microsoft 365?\"</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/13772195/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In the podcast episode, I interview <STRONG>Matt Mooty </STRONG>(<A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/mathew-mooty-0494a129/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">LinkedIn</A>), senior software engineer who works on multi-lingual&nbsp;support within the SharePoint-powered, intelligent intranet. Matt and I talk about designs of the past - SharePoint variations - and how the team moved forward with a modern design that solved past problems and opened up new opportunities globally distributed companies face today.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_001_MattMooty-profile-new.jpg\" style=\"width: 300px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181009i499FE335A8E5F01B/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_001_MattMooty-profile-new.jpg\" alt=\"Matt Mooty, senior software engineer (SharePoint/Microsoft) [Intrazone guest]\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Matt Mooty, senior software engineer (SharePoint/Microsoft) [Intrazone guest]</span></span></P>\n<P>All features listed below began rolling out to Targeted Release customers in Office 365 as of March 2020 (possibly early April 2020).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Inform and engage with dynamic employee experiences</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Build your modern intranet on SharePoint in Office 365 and get the benefits of investing in business outcomes – reducing IT and development costs, increasing business speed and agility, and up-leveling the dynamic and welcoming nature of your intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Multi-lingual publishing for pages and news in communication sites</STRONG></P>\n<P>Organizations with diverse users benefit by having content throughout their intranet sites available in multiple languages. With this new feature, site owners can extend inclusive experiences within SharePoint communication sites for their globally diverse workforce.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_002_Multi-lingual_pt1.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180903iBAAF792FFE7A7BD4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_002_Multi-lingual_pt1.jpg\" alt=\"Site and page visitors choose their preferred language when you make content in your intranet available in multiple languages.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Site and page visitors choose their preferred language when you make content in your intranet available in multiple languages.</span></span></P>\n<P>Site owners will see new language settings under site settings, that once set enable translation of pages and news. They will also be able to assign individuals as translators per language. Translators get notified via email when there is a new default language page created or when an existing one is updated by the original content author. Translators are responsible for adding their language’s content. People visiting the site will automatically see pages and news in their preferred user language when available.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_003_Multi-lingual_pt2.jpg\" style=\"width: 952px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180905i7519702EEB068DB8/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_003_Multi-lingual_pt2.jpg\" alt=\"Translators manually translate copies of the default language page into the language(s) specified. When the copies of the page(s) are created, translators are notified in email that a translation is requested.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Translators manually translate copies of the default language page into the language(s) specified. When the copies of the page(s) are created, translators are notified in email that a translation is requested.</span></span></P>\n<P>NOTE: This feature is shipped OFF by default. Site owners are the ones that need to take action to enable this feature.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=50217\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">50217</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2119229\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New publishing commands have been added to SharePoint Pages library</STRONG></P>\n<P>You'll see them show up in the command bar at the top of the library or within the file card that appears when you hover over a page's title. There will be visual cues that a file has changed (either content or metadata) and any related messaging - with the call to action to publish or republish the page. This makes things more visual and possible to take multiple actions across numerous pages.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_004_Publish-from-Pages-library.jpg\" style=\"width: 802px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180908i01920716435E5BDE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_004_Publish-from-Pages-library.jpg\" alt=\"You can select a page or news post and publish directly from the Pages library command bar (shown above) and from the file card that appears when you hover over a file.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">You can select a page or news post and publish directly from the Pages library command bar (shown above) and from the file card that appears when you hover over a file.</span></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/management-and-lifecycle-of-a-sharepoint-modern-page-3410a04c-3ca4-4a4c-b867-33ab5c8bdcf3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n<LI>When editors hover over a page or news post with unpublished changes ,&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/management-and-lifecycle-of-a-sharepoint-modern-page-3410a04c-3ca4-4a4c-b867-33ab5c8bdcf3#bkmk_publishfromlibrary\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">they will see a file card with additional details</A>, including a call to action to publish or republish.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=61191\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">61191</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>The SharePoint mobile app will adhere to customized tenant themes and branding</STRONG></P>\n<P>Admins configure the various options from within the Microsoft365 admin center. From here, they can assert a logo image, navigation bar color, text and icon color and accent color. Once set, the SharePoint mobile app per each of your users within that tenant will be closer adherence to your company theme and brand.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_005_SP-mobile-tenant-themes.jpg\" style=\"width: 765px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180909i7DF2089648F3D964/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_005_SP-mobile-tenant-themes.jpg\" alt=\"Customize your theme in the Microsoft 365 admin center and have it reflected in the SharePoint mobile app for iOS and Android.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Customize your theme in the Microsoft 365 admin center and have it reflected in the SharePoint mobile app for iOS and Android.</span></span></P>\n<P>This soon applies to both the iOS and Android versions of the SharePoint mobile app.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=61374\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 61374</A></LI>\n<LI>Learn more:\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/admin/setup/customize-your-organization-theme?view=o365-worldwide#customize-your-theme-in-the-admin-center\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Customize the Office 365 theme for your organization</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/d875654b-fb0a-4dbe-a17a-a676cf936284\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint mobile app for Android</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/339402ce-16bb-4c97-9475-0c5375ccef7a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint mobile app for iOS</A></LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SharePoint root site swap no longer restricted to customers with 10k users or more</STRONG></P>\n<P>AKA, it's now available to all.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We have enabled the ability to swap the location of a SharePoint root site with another site - most often a communication site - using the PowerShell cmdlet, <STRONG>Invoke-SPOSiteSwap</STRONG>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>So swap away! Do it. Do it today. Invoke-SPOSiteSwap and do not delay.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;featureid=51259\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 51259</A></LI>\n<LI>Learn more:\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/module/sharepoint-online/invoke-spositeswap?view=sharepoint-ps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Invoke SPO-SiteSwap</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/modern-root-site\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Modernize your root site</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=35588\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Online Management Shell</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/office365/enterprise/page-diagnostics-for-spo\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Page Diagnostic Tool</A></LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Wiki notation for page links</STRONG></P>\n<P>Add links even faster within the text web part of your pages and news. Type [[ where you want a link to appear, and you'll be able to select from a list of pages on your site. Or, you can enter a link by typing [[your link name | URL]].</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_006_Wiki-links-notation.jpg\" style=\"width: 906px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180911iC655189BD84EA27A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_006_Wiki-links-notation.jpg\" alt=\"Once you type &quot;[[&quot; you'll begin to see the pages to select to add to your new page or news post as a link.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Once you type \"[[\" you'll begin to see the pages to select to add to your new page or news post as a link.</span></span></P>\n<P>We know this is one <A href=\"https://twitter.com/susanhanley/status/1231997835647836162\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">people have been looking forward to</A>. I say what's all that bracket?!? Now there are multiple ways to add a hyperlink to your pages and news posts.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Learn more about <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/add-text-and-tables-to-your-page-with-the-text-web-part-729c0aa1-bc0d-41e3-9cde-c60533f2c801\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">working with the Text web part</A>, including linking to other SharePoint content - like pages.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>[<FONT color=\"#FF0000\">Update from previous roadmap pitstop</FONT>]<STRONG> Pausing and reverting roll out of the updated SharePoint start page experience</STRONG></P>\n<P>As announced via Message Center post #192001, we are pausing the roll out of the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fmicrosoft-365%2Froadmap%3Ffilters%3D%26searchterms%3D54821&amp;data=02%7C01%7CMark.Kashman%40microsoft.com%7C01be7feaf99d446c645c08d7d59ae48a%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637212733610244431&amp;sdata=uPcj%2BFxK7jGgBVogkF9ZKk4BMrTj9oQPWNg4iQUV88E%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\">updated SharePoint start page experience</A>. After April 1, 2020 all users who may have received the updated experience will revert back to the current experience as documented here:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.office.com%2Farticle%2FDiscover-content-with-the-SharePoint-start-page-6b85097a-87e0-4611-a29a-dfd49b1a1220&amp;data=02%7C01%7CMark.Kashman%40microsoft.com%7C01be7feaf99d446c645c08d7d59ae48a%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637212733610254425&amp;sdata=osqMJ3%2B5kVICHxYPBORX%2Bkg8iEhWG6L%2BLiV4I91jBBo%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\">Discover content with SharePoint start page.</A>&nbsp;Our internal metrics data indicated that users were not finding all their sites as easily with the updated experience as they were in the previous design of the page, hence the roll back. We are actively exploring bringing the home site shared branding/navigation experience with the previous start page design. We don’t have am expected timeline to share at this point but please look for updates in our&nbsp;<A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fmicrosoft-365%2Froadmap%3Ffilters%3D%26searchterms%3Dstart%252Cpage&amp;data=02%7C01%7CMark.Kashman%40microsoft.com%7C01be7feaf99d446c645c08d7d59ae48a%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637212733610254425&amp;sdata=KkagBXs1mvyZvXzfmN9yfvKZWg9g2l33oYg%2Fb78c1j4%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\">Microsoft 365 roadmap</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Teamwork updates across SharePoint team sites, OneDrive and Microsoft Teams</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 is designed to be a universal toolkit for teamwork – to give you the right tools for the right task, along with common services to help you seamlessly work across applications. SharePoint is the intelligent content service that powers teamwork – to better collaborate on proposals, projects, and campaigns throughout your organization – and is integrated with Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Yammer, Stream, Planner and much more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Redesigned SharePoint Pages and Lists app for teams, plus a new standalone SharePoint pages app</STRONG></P>\n<P>You'll see both app choices when you click the \"+\" button in a Teams channel to add new content. Using the original SharePoint app, your members and owners can now create a tab in their Teams channels that makes a page or list from any SharePoint Team site visible and useable within Teams. In addition, your end users can use the SharePoint Pages app to easily find pages and news posts. They can also use this app to tab pages or news posts from any SharePoint Team site by pasting a link URL.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_007_SP-tab-Teams_pt1.jpg\" style=\"width: 503px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180912iD00D87034A9DB2D2/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_007_SP-tab-Teams_pt1.jpg\" alt=\"From within Microsoft Teams, click the “+” button in a channel, and select the SharePoint tab, or select the SharePoint Pages tab.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">From within Microsoft Teams, click the “+” button in a channel, and select the SharePoint tab, or select the SharePoint Pages tab.</span></span></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_008_SP-tab-Teams_pt2.jpg\" style=\"width: 430px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180913i9F0DF8B8BD67B077/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_008_SP-tab-Teams_pt2.jpg\" alt=\"Select Pages to see a list of existing SharePoint pages and news posts available from your team site.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Select Pages to see a list of existing SharePoint pages and news posts available from your team site.</span></span></P>\n<P>Note: this feature has no impact on page or list permissions. Users who did not have access to a page before it was added as a tab will continue to be unable to access the page in Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>And a reminder: when you add content like this in Teams, it's a reference to the content where it lives - it's not a copy, and our focus is to make it appear in full fidelity and be feature rich.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=60614\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 60614</A></LI>\n<LI>Learn more:\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/add-a-sharepoint-page-or-list-to-a-channel-in-teams-131edef1-455f-4c67-a8ce-efa2ebf25f0b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Add a SharePoint page or list to a channel in Teams</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoftteams/platform/overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">What are Microsoft Teams apps?</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoftteams/platform/tabs/what-are-tabs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">What are Microsoft Teams custom tabs?</A></LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n<LI>Public documentation is <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/add-a-sharepoint-page-or-list-to-a-channel-in-teams-131edef1-455f-4c67-a8ce-efa2ebf25f0b?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US&amp;cc365plan=O365WW&amp;storagetype=stage\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>&nbsp;and is in&nbsp;process of being updated with more details. &nbsp;</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Edit metadata from within the SharePoint Document Library and List View web parts</STRONG></P>\n<P>People will soon be able to open and edit file or list item properties directly from the document or list view web parts. They no longer need to navigate to the actual List or Document Library to update things. Just click the Info or “More” under item properties wherever that web part has been added.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_009_edit-metadata-in-web-parts.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180914iA24E757886CEA1E9/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_009_edit-metadata-in-web-parts.jpg\" alt=\"From within the web part, select the Information icon to open the details pane and edit item metadata in context on the page.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">From within the web part, select the Information icon to open the details pane and edit item metadata in context on the page.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=61030\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 61030 </A></LI>\n<LI>Learn more:\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/Customize-permissions-for-a-SharePoint-list-or-library-02d770f3-59eb-4910-a608-5f84cc297782\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Customize permissions for a SharePoint list or library</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/use-the-document-library-web-part-a9dfecc3-2050-4528-9f00-2c5afc5731b0#ID0EAABAAA=Online\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Use the Document Library list part</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/use-the-list-web-part-ef0a1b80-f8b3-443d-b04a-1e76c70b5537\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Use the List web part</A></LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SharePoint lists - conditional formatting rule builder with new rich-text capabilities</STRONG></P>\n<P>People can use If/then logic to format rows and columns based on attributes like numerical, date, etc. to apply color formatting across SharePoint lists and libraries. You can add several variable conditions, so the data does or does not get formatted based on the rules you've defined. The result is an experience that calls attention to specific data, missing data or recent changes to the data. You, too, will have greater flexibility for how your text appears within your items by using the enhanced rich text editor – to bold, color, underline, etc. more closely to how you wish your text to appear.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_010_SP-lists-conditional-formatting-rules.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180915iBA0618C2DC9586F3/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_010_SP-lists-conditional-formatting-rules.jpg\" alt=\"When programming the conditional formatting for list columns rows or columns, you can now build simple if/then rules to effect item formatting.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">When programming the conditional formatting for list columns rows or columns, you can now build simple if/then rules to effect item formatting.</span></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=57305\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">57305</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-SharePoint-Blog/Content-collaboration-throughout-Microsoft-365-Ignite-2019/ba-p/960868\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Related technology</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>\"Happy Birthday\" to Microsoft teams who recently turned three</STRONG></P>\n<P>The Teams team published a huge 3rd anniversary *what’s new* in Microsoft Teams blog.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_011_Teams-raise-hand.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180916iE4F338E23DE29297/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_011_Teams-raise-hand.jpg\" alt=\"Raise hands (yellow hand icon above in the upper-left person’s feed) in Microsoft Teams meetings when you have something to say.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Raise hands (yellow hand icon above in the upper-left person’s feed) in Microsoft Teams meetings when you have something to say.</span></span></P>\n<P>A few of the feature highlights are:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>You can virtually raise your hand in meetings when you have something to say;</LI>\n<LI>Pop out chats for ease of keeping focus on one thing as you navigate to another.</LI>\n<LI>Easily conduct interviews, virtual healthcare visits, and more with the Bookings App in Teams</LI>\n<LI>Reduce background noise in Teams meetings in real-time with noise suppression</LI>\n<LI>Certified @Bose #NC700</LI>\n<LI>&amp; @RealWearInc headset handsfree</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Lots more in the \"<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-3rd-anniversary-edition/ba-p/1234871\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">What’s New in Microsoft Teams: 3rd Anniversary Edition</A>\" blog post by my peer, Marissa Salazar.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Put Stream Videos in PowerApps &amp; Microsoft Forms</STRONG></P>\n<P>Your company’s favorite Power Apps for travel, training and more now support Stream videos; bring all your company videos into custom productivity apps to improve engagement and knowledge retention.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_012_Stream-in-PowerApps.jpg\" style=\"width: 464px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180918i1FA5753B06868924/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_012_Stream-in-PowerApps.jpg\" alt=\"Bring company videos into custom productivity apps – mobile app example above.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Bring company videos into custom productivity apps – mobile app example above.</span></span></P>\n<P>This is another great Maker feature to expand the art of the possible, the art of engaging, multi-media experiences.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/controls/control-stream-video\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn how</A>&nbsp;to get started today.</LI>\n<LI>Related <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-stream-blog/new-and-coming-soon-background-noise-suppression-mobile-video/ba-p/1221048\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">release blog</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Producing Live Events in Yammer just got easier </STRONG></P>\n<P>Now Yammer community admins can schedule, produce, and broadcast a live event in just a few clicks. Attendees can access the event page in Yammer and participate in open discussion before, during, and after the event.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_013_Yammer-Live-Events_pt1.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180919i181204DB8FA6AF71/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_013_Yammer-Live-Events_pt1.jpg\" alt=\"Yammer community admins can schedule, produce, and broadcast a live event in just a few clicks.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Yammer community admins can schedule, produce, and broadcast a live event in just a few clicks.</span></span></P>\n<P>Presenters can monitor the conversations happening in Yammer without having to leave Microsoft Teams. There are a number of Yammer integrations with Teams, like adding a Yammer community as a tab in Teams; And the real design value is how the technology is taking a scenario-first approach - to keep you from bouncing through various apps and experiences - opting rather to keep you where you started with intuitive options to accomplish numerous tasks.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_014_Yammer-Live-Events_pt2.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180921iA185FF1D0A6D2DD0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Mar-2020_014_Yammer-Live-Events_pt2.jpg\" alt=\"Presenters can monitor conversations happening in Yammer without having to leave Microsoft Teams.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Presenters can monitor conversations happening in Yammer without having to leave Microsoft Teams.</span></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=59993\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">59993</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/yammer/manage-yammer-groups/yammer-produce-live-events-from-your-device-coming-soon\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>April 2020 teasers</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Psst, still here? 40-004_3d6445f0e2386769.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180915iBA0618C2DC9586F3/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn69@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-31-40-162_b4db414532a4dbb8.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180916iE4F338E23DE29297/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn53@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-31-44-131_9f9193bfb991203a.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180918i1FA5753B06868924/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn29@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-39-079_991ce6f16b4191c0.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180919i181204DB8FA6AF71/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn26@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-37-488_5224d14048b5ae2a.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180921iA185FF1D0A6D2DD0/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn25@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-40-775_5d9f47be55c59341.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/180922i7F5C6766A3086F36/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn50@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-31-37-510_a366bd81bf0ad356.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688845},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 63","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-dev-weekly-episode-63/ba-p/1057729","description":"<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper
