0_a459fb638d01142a.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/195743i15CB52D0089F31E4/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn58@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-31-44-680_c8288de7c2350ee4.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/195744iFB709932FA3E3C78/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn5@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-42-851_112eb6454c4d3a23.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/195745i57A316EA14772DFB/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn89@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-31-38-942_49ea6866719c7666.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/195746iE0B240EFC5CB4E71/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn14@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-31-38-708_d98b956feb1709c7.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/195747iDE31A03B2486DEEF/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-41-901_411f0e1925c47466.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/195750iA070229E55BD2B71/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-42-347_8227edbf3f8ae8a7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688824},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"SharePoint Roadmap Pitstop: April 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-april-2020/ba-p/1350523","description":"<P>March winds brought April showers, and features – raining up into the Cloud. Cast your umbrella aside for a moment and soak in the seasonal innovation and updates that landed this month.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>April 2020 brought modernized MMS, file card “conversations”, stock images, audience targeting in navigation, SharePoint spaces preview, Yammer app for Teams, and more. Details &amp; screenshots below, including the audible companion: <STRONG>Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop: April 2020</STRONG> podcast episode – all to help answer, \"What's rolling out now for SharePoint and related technologies into Microsoft 365?\"</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/14211428/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247ad3/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In the podcast episode, I interview <STRONG>Graham Kent </STRONG>(<A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/grahamkent/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">LinkedIn</A> | <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/GrahamIsMyName\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A>), senior program manager at Microsoft who works on intelligent file card experiences across Microsoft 365. Graham and I talk broader design strategy for how the on-hover experience works and the breadth of content and information that is dynamically pulled into view where you are working.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_001_GrahamKent.jpg\" style=\"width: 553px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187959iF63B3E8DB7ACD486/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_001_GrahamKent.jpg\" alt=\"Graham Kent, senior program manager (SharePoint/Microsoft) [Intrazone guest]\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Graham Kent, senior program manager (SharePoint/Microsoft) [Intrazone guest]</span></span></P>\n<P>All features listed below began rolling out to Targeted Release customers in Office 365 as of April 2020 (possibly early May 2020).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Inform and engage with dynamic employee experiences</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Build your intelligent intranet on SharePoint in Microsoft 365 and get the benefits of investing in business outcomes – reducing IT and development costs, increasing business speed and agility, and up-leveling the dynamic, personalized and welcoming nature of your intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Stock Images in SharePoint</STRONG></P>\n<P>These are free-to-use stock images available in the SharePoint image file picker experience, alongside recent, web search, your organization, OneDrive, site, upload and from a link - a plethora of methods and locations – managed and ad hoc – to add imagery to your intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_002_StockImages.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187960i6190D3E9B07F383B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_002_StockImages.jpg\" alt=\"Enhance your internal communications with stock images for SharePoint pages and news.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Enhance your internal communications with stock images for SharePoint pages and news.</span></span></P>\n<P>When you click on <STRONG>Stock images</STRONG> in the SharePoint image picker experience, you'll have access to thousands of high-resolution stock images to use while authoring pages and news. And FYI, we'll continue to add more images over time so you can continue to publish unique and professional experiences.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=59834\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">59834</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/Use-the-Image-web-part-A63B335B-AD0A-4954-A65D-33C6AF68BEB2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Managed Metadata Service (MMS) has new modernized filtering and tagging experience</STRONG></P>\n<P>The new&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/open-term-store-management-tool\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">term store experience</A>&nbsp;enables intuitive management to import or create the global term sets for formal taxonomies. Note: this update does not impact existing term customizations nor does it affect the classic term store management experience; local term set management is unchanged.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_003_MMS-pt1-TermStore.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187961iF0FE6F5DB5B8B786/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_003_MMS-pt1-TermStore.jpg\" alt=\"Managed Metadata Service (MMS) - modernized Term store\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Managed Metadata Service (MMS) - modernized Term store</span></span></P>\n<P>In addition, there is a new <EM>content type gallery</EM> to create and manage custom content types from the SharePoint admin center. These content types continue to be stored in the content type hub. Again, this change does not affect the classic experience for managing content types should you still require it.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_004_MMS-pt2-ContentTypeGallery.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187963iFD8324AC0EE8DF1F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_004_MMS-pt2-ContentTypeGallery.jpg\" alt=\"Managed Metadata Service (MMS) - modernized Content type gallery\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Managed Metadata Service (MMS) - modernized Content type gallery</span></span></P>\n<P>Beyond IT, benefits flow to employees with new filtering and tagging options for managed metadata columns. When filtering, this new tree control is available within ‘See all’ in the filter panel – to help select the desired term.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_005_MMS-pt3-Tagging-Filtering.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187966i23FB156FB53B12FC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_005_MMS-pt3-Tagging-Filtering.jpg\" alt=\"Managed Metadata Service (MMS) - modernized tagging and filtering\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Managed Metadata Service (MMS) - modernized tagging and filtering</span></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?rtc=1&amp;filters=&amp;searchterms=57315\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">57315</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/modernizing-sharepoint-managed-metadata-services-mms/ba-p/1277450\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Audience targeting in site navigation and footer</STRONG></P>\n<P>SharePoint site owners are able to filter navigational links to specific audiences by using audience targeting - in the same fashion that you can target news and pages.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Site owners will see the toggle setting to enable audience targeting when editing the site, including hub site navigation, or footer navigation. Once <STRONG>ON</STRONG>, site owners and editors target the specific navigation links to be filtered to specific audiences.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_006_AudienceTargeting-navigation.jpg\" style=\"width: 300px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187970iF7E72CCCD22EE8D6/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_006_AudienceTargeting-navigation.jpg\" alt=\"When enabled, audience targeting will apply to all menus on the site including hub and footer menus.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">When enabled, audience targeting will apply to all menus on the site including hub and footer menus.</span></span></P>\n<P>You can now create engaging experiences in a targeted fashion; focus your audience’s attention by removing distractions from less relevant content.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Note: Only site owners can turn audience targeting on and off. Once on, any site editor can target menu links to specific audiences using Microsoft 365 Groups or security groups.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=34251\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">34251</A>. &nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>Learn more:\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/Customize-the-navigation-on-your-SharePoint-site-3cd61ae7-a9ed-4e1e-bf6d-4655f0bf25ca\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Customize the navigation on your SharePoint site</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/overview-of-audience-targeting-in-modern-sharepoint-sites-68113d1b-be99-4d4c-a61c-73b087f48a81\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Overview of audience targeting in modern SharePoint sites</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/target-files-news-and-pages-to-specific-audiences-33d84cb6-14ed-4e53-a426-74c38ea32293\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Target navigation items, files, news and pages</A></LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Shy header - save space when scrolling SharePoint sites, including hub sites </STRONG></P>\n<P>As you scroll a modern SharePoint site, you will see the site header shrink to maximize reading space on the page, giving viewers easier access to content. This has often been described as a <EM>shy header</EM> and this applies both to desktop and mobile versions.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_007_ShyHeader.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187972i339B53147351411B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_007_ShyHeader.jpg\" alt=\"Left-to-right: As you begin to scroll the page, note how the site header (where you see logo, site name and navigation) shrinks dynamically.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Left-to-right: As you begin to scroll the page, note how the site header (where you see logo, site name and navigation) shrinks dynamically.</span></span></P>\n<P>And as you can imagine, when you scroll back up, the site header returns to full size. <BR />Not so shy now, eh?</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=62754\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">62754</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SharePoint Spaces has moved into preview</STRONG></P>\n<P>SharePoint spaces is a web-based, immersive mixed reality platform which allows people to create and share mixed reality experiences. The creation experience is the same as building a modern site or page.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_008_SharePoint-spaces-preview_pt1.jpg\" style=\"width: 936px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187974iEC6976969819BE52/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_008_SharePoint-spaces-preview_pt1.jpg\" alt=\"A SharePoint space showcasing interactive 3D objects, video and text.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">A SharePoint space showcasing interactive 3D objects, video and text.</span></span></P>\n<P>First, a person creates the space and chooses options such as structure, background, and theme. Next,&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/add-and-use-web-parts-in-a-sharepoint-space-fa73244f-0512-488e-962e-4c3de32bcf2a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">add web parts</A>&nbsp;for 3D objects, 360° images and videos, and 2D images and text. The resulting immersive 3D experience can be viewed in a web browser or with a mixed reality headset.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_009_SharePoint-spaces-preview_pt2.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187976iC79F13E595D9DBFD/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_009_SharePoint-spaces-preview_pt2.jpg\" alt=\"From within the SharePoint site, click New &gt; Space (Preview) to start building your space.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">From within the SharePoint site, click New &gt; Space (Preview) to start building your space.</span></span></P>\n<P>To get started, site owners must enable the SharePoint spaces (preview) on the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/activate-features-for-sites-787f3ba1-9df6-480a-ab4c-9f4525490cb9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Manage site features pag</A>e. Once enabled, people will see a new option in the site’s New menu to create a <STRONG>Space (Preview)</STRONG>.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/sharepoint-spaces-7b65edfb-7cc9-42e3-af37-178d79364a5e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=62752\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">62752</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Teamwork updates across SharePoint team sites, OneDrive and Microsoft Teams</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 is designed to be a universal toolkit for teamwork – to give you the right tools for the right task, along with common services to help you seamlessly work across applications. SharePoint is the intelligent content service that powers teamwork – to better collaborate on proposals, projects, and campaigns throughout your organization – with integration across Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Yammer, Stream, Planner and much more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Review mode in Word for the web</STRONG></P>\n<P>When people share documents with <STRONG>Open in review mode only</STRONG> selected, recipients who open the document in Word for the web will be limited to adding comments or leaving tracked changes. This can help prevent unintended edits to the document.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_010_Word-review-mode.jpg\" style=\"width: 323px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187978iB2EDF5DBA4770DDE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_010_Word-review-mode.jpg\" alt=\"Share a Word document where the recipient open's the document in review-only mode.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Share a Word document where the recipient open's the document in review-only mode.</span></span></P>\n<P>With this feature, file owners have more control over new edits, and only file owners can accept or reject changes made by other people. If someone else leaves suggestions in the document, they’ll be able to reject their own changes but can’t accept or reject someone else’s changes.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=27017\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">27017</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>File card - \"Conversations\"</STRONG></P>\n<P>This new file hover card feature, alongside file details and actions like ‘Inside Look’ and ‘Activity,’ will show relevant emails, meetings and Teams conversations to the individual reviewing the file hover card information. So, when someone sends an email, a Teams chat, or a meeting invitation that references a file from SharePoint or OneDrive, that conversation is displayed in the file hover card with a link to the conversation(s).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_011_File-card-conversations.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187979i22687E8AF2C06EE1/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_011_File-card-conversations.jpg\" alt=\"Learn about your files at a glace with Inside look, file views and conversations.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Learn about your files at a glace with Inside look, file views and conversations.</span></span></P>\n<P>Note: The conversations displayed on the file card will only be visible to those users who took part in them. This means that you won’t see another person’s conversations that are not related to the file in question, and they won’t see yours.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=56183\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">56183</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/files-in-onedrive-c6ecef2f-c5cc-4415-b677-e2d2151c3c29\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SharePoint Integrations with Power Automate and Power Apps to GCC-High Tenants</STRONG></P>\n<P>For government customers that fall into the \"maker\" persona, this update enables you to create and manage custom workflows with Power Automate and custom forms with Power Apps combined with both SharePoint lists and libraries.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_012_SP-plus-PowerPlatform_GCC-High.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187980i3F4C6B18DF902F96/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_012_SP-plus-PowerPlatform_GCC-High.jpg\" alt=\"Customize a SharePoint list form by using Power Apps – now in GCC-High.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Customize a SharePoint list form by using Power Apps – now in GCC-High.</span></span></P>\n<P>We're excited to continue rolling out from commercial and into the Government Cloud Community (GCC) environment, now inclusive of GCC-high.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=62437\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">62437</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/business-applications-process/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Power Automate now supports the ability to Get files and items from folders and subfolders</STRONG></P>\n<P>For all the Makers out there, this SharePoint list and library update allow people to build Microsoft Power Automate flows that can run on individual items contained within a document library or list.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Power Automate users will see the “Get items” and “Get files (properties only)” actions to include two new fields: “Limit Entries to Folder” and “Include Nested Items”. If a folder is specified, then the action will only return the entries located inside of that folder. If “Include Nested Items” is set to true, entries located inside of subfolders will also be returned; otherwise, they will be excluded.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>When users select a folder, they will see their instant flows appear under the Automate command bar button. Note: Existing flows that include “Get items” or “Get files (properties only)” will continue to work like before if the two new fields are left unchanged.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=62856\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">62856</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-SharePoint-Blog/Content-collaboration-throughout-Microsoft-365-Ignite-2019/ba-p/960868\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Related technology</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>The new Yammer app in Microsoft&nbsp;Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>Stay connected to what’s happening across your organization. You'll have the full experience of Yammer right in your hub for teamwork. You can participate in conversations, watch live and on-demand events, and browse your communities, helping you broadly stay up to date alongside access to your projects, chats, and meetings.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_013_Yammer-app-in-Teams.jpg\" style=\"width: 744px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187987i242789E8CD48D4C9/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_013_Yammer-app-in-Teams.jpg\" alt=\"The new Yammer experience is available in the Yammer app for Microsoft Teams.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The new Yammer experience is available in the Yammer app for Microsoft Teams.</span></span></P>\n<P>The new Yammer App in Teams can be pinned directly into the Teams left-hand navigation for quick access near Calendar, Teams, Chats etc..</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=63163\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">63163</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/yammer-blog/the-yammer-app-for-microsoft-teams-is-now-available/ba-p/1320286\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Office 365 Groups will become Microsoft 365 Groups</STRONG></P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 offers an integrated set of apps and services that puts artificial intelligence and other cutting-edge innovations. And to do this with consistent, manageable access, Microsoft 365 Groups power collaboration experiences in more than 22 apps across the suite, and partners can build custom solutions for their customers leveraging Microsoft Graph APIs and the Power Apps framework.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Whether it’s a team in Microsoft Teams, a Community in Yammer, or a group-connected SharePoint team site, the Microsoft 365 Groups platform enables people to create, share and discover knowledge and information with governance and permissions intact.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-365-blog/office-365-groups-will-become-microsoft-365-groups/ba-p/1303601\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>The Planner mobile experience is getting a serious boost</STRONG></P>\n<P>The Planner app for Android improvements include: landscape mode for Android and the ability to attach files to tasks – just select a task card and then tap the paperclip icon to attach a file that’s stored locally on your device or in the cloud through OneDrive or SharePoint.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_014_Planner-mobile_pt1.jpg\" style=\"width: 998px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187988i91A6C0BA0F513DD2/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_014_Planner-mobile_pt1.jpg\" alt=\"The Planner widget (left) and landscape mode (right) bring flexibility to the way you manage your tasks.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The Planner widget (left) and landscape mode (right) bring flexibility to the way you manage your tasks.</span></span></P>\n<P>For Planner app for iOS comes <EM>Offline read-only mode</EM> and an improved <EM>Share to Planner</EM> where from any app or mobile web browser, you choose which plan and bucket to add your new task.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_015_Planner-mobile_pt2.jpg\" style=\"width: 998px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187992i5371A5206F8D3CD8/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_015_Planner-mobile_pt2.jpg\" alt=\"Creating a new task from external content is easy: find your content—in this case, an image—select the Action icon, determine the right plan and bucket, and tap “Add task.” The new task will appear in your plan with the associated content linked in the task’s attachments.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Creating a new task from external content is easy: find your content—in this case, an image—select the Action icon, determine the right plan and bucket, and tap “Add task.” The new task will appear in your plan with the associated content linked in the task’s attachments.</span></span></P>\n<P>So I say, <EM>add a task</EM> for yourself to download:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Planner mobile app for&nbsp;Android through&nbsp;<A href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.planner\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Google Play</A>&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>Planner mobile app iOS through the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://apps.apple.com/app/microsoft-planner/id1219301037\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">App Store</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New and updated usage reports in Microsoft 365 admin center</STRONG></P>\n<P>Many people are being asked to work in new and different ways as they are now working remotely. This has been driving a renewed interest in understanding how people are using Microsoft 365.&nbsp; We hear that you want to learn if people are saving content to SharePoint and OneDrive, if more are using Microsoft Teams for chat and online meetings, and how email usage is trending.&nbsp; The baseline question being: are people taking full advantage of the services for which you've enabled?</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_016_M365-admin-usage-reports.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187994iF981F5C7B76EFF19/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-Apr.2020_016_M365-admin-usage-reports.jpg\" alt=\"Example usage reports in the Microsoft 365 Admin Center with the new remote work elements card.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Example usage reports in the Microsoft 365 Admin Center with the new remote work elements card.</span></span></P>\n<P>The usage reports in the Microsoft 365 Admin Center can help answer these questions and many others.&nbsp; There are usage reports Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, SharePoint, Exchange, Yammer, and more with standard views across 7, 30, 90, and 180 day periods.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=58080\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">58080</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-365-blog/understand-usage-wherever-people-are-working-with-new-and/ba-p/1325286\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>May 2020 teasers</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Psst, still here? Still scrolling the page looking for the rolled out goodness? If so, here’s a few teasers of what’s to come to production next month…</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Teaser #1: <STRONG>Conditionally show or hide columns in a SharePoint list or library form </STRONG>[Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=63518\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">63518</A>]&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>Teaser #2: <STRONG>New Yammer Conversations web part for SharePoint </STRONG>[Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=63385\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">63385</A>]</LI>\n<UL>\n<LI>Note: We talked to the Yammer team recently on all things #YearOfYammer; aka, a new Intrazone episode all about Yammer coming soon…</LI>\n</UL>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>… shhh, tell everyone.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Helpful, ongoing change management resources </STRONG></FONT></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>\"<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/office365/admin/manage/stay-on-top-of-updates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Stay on top of Office 365 changes</A>\"</LI>\n<LI>\"<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/office365/admin/manage/message-center\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Message center in Office 365</A>\"</LI>\n<UL>\n<LI>Install the <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=627216\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 admin app</A>; view Message Center posts and stay current with push notifications.</LI>\n</UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365 public roadmap</A> <SPAN>+ pre-filtered URL for </SPAN><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?ms.url=roadmap&amp;rtc=1&amp;filters=Rolling%20Out%2CLaunched%2CIn%20Development%2CYammer%2CSharePoint%2CMicrosoft%20Stream%2COneDrive%20for%20Business\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer and Stream roadmap items</A><SPAN>.</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>SharePoint</STRONG> <A href=\"https://www.facebook.com/MSSharePoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facebook</A> | <A href=\"https://twitter.com/SharePoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A> | <A href=\"http://office.com/sharepoint/community\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Community Blog</A> | <A href=\"https://sharepoint.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>OneDrive</STRONG> <A href=\"https://www.facebook.com/OneDrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facebook</A> | <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/onedrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A> | <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SharePoint/blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">OneDrive Community Blog</A> | <A href=\"https://onedrive.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI>Follow me to catch <STRONG>news and interesting SharePoint things</STRONG>: <A href=\"https://twitter.com/mkashman\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@mkashman</A>; -420_07361467854afbd6.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187978iB2EDF5DBA4770DDE/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn69@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-31-43-668_3a9d799071fa5bc7.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187979i22687E8AF2C06EE1/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn17@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-43-041_f842f1bd2a1b7b42.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187980i3F4C6B18DF902F96/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn57@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-31-37-697_e2ee37eff4cc4800.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187987i242789E8CD48D4C9/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn6@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-42-954_4de682d77621994d.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187988i91A6C0BA0F513DD2/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn41@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-31-38-890_34c06348caf02152.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187992i5371A5206F8D3CD8/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn9@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-31-39-096_a4594366b465da29.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187994iF981F5C7B76EFF19/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn69@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-31-45-013_87723d93a4521590.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187997i5863FA6420B7C3EE/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn62@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-31-43-619_531d6c5093599f11.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688848},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 podcast","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/all-aboard-the-power-platform-the-intrazone-podcast/ba-p/1017855","description":"<P>\n The Power Platform is designed for the dynamic needs of your business. Plan for apps big and small across the businesses of your organization and deliver on time. Even if the train has left the station, you can adjust without loss of productivity. Both planning and change management benefit from value plus speed.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n The content collaboration side of the Power Platform (Power Apps &amp; Power Automate) takes this approach, meaning you use the tools to design and deliver low-to-no-code apps in hours/days side-by-side discussions in Microsoft teams. The outcome being productivity apps where and when you need them in the flow of your hub for teamwork. And it all integrates with the content service powered by SharePoint.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n OK, time to choo, choo, choose to listen to the show…:bullet_train:\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/12089837/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In this episode of The Intrazone, we speak to our experts behind the Power Platform + Microsoft Teams: \n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/karannigam/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Karan Nigam\n  </A>\n </STRONG>, group product marketing manager (Microsoft Teams), \n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ssiciliano/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Stephen Siciliano\n  </A>\n </STRONG>, principal program manager director (Power Automate), and \n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/rycu/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Ryan Cunningham\n  </A>\n </STRONG>, partner program manager director (Power Apps). We discuss numerous Ignite 2019 announcements (UI flows, Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and more, plus dig into the inherent integration from design to delivery to you.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> Kashman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157930i28727809ECFF910A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn73@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-30-013_4e4d237996f5951f.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157931iCBBE4097BA7BD08A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn26@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-31-42-388_76ebbbafb4228d30.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157929i63A50CFE94EDC72A/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn21@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-31-39-854_1751fb8067b7b98d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688844},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"Migrate your content into Microsoft 365","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/migrate-your-content-into-microsoft-365/ba-p/1604587","description":"<P>The latest productivity experiences await you and your content. Once in Microsoft 365 – you will see improved collaboration, increased security, and compliance. Our goal is to help all customers to easily migrate their content to Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The infographic and information below, will help you learn about the numerous content migration tools and services from Microsoft and our 3<SUP>rd</SUP>-party migration partners. This is collectively the broadest set of offerings to assist your migration into Microsoft 365 – from assessment, to planning and onboarding.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Migration Manager</STRONG> – simplify file share migrations</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Mover</STRONG> – migrate from 3rd-party cloud providers</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>SharePoint Migration Tool</STRONG> (SPMT) – accelerate on-premises migrations of SharePoint</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Microsoft 365 FastTrack</STRONG> – helping organizations plan, migrate, and adopt</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Diverse migration partner ecosystem</STRONG> – offering a wide variety of migration tools and services</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Migrate-your-content-into-Microsoft-365_infographic.jpg\" style=\"width: 662px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213780i7BC518AEF9298AFC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Migrate-your-content-into-Microsoft-365_infographic.jpg\" alt=\"Microsoft 365 content migration tools and services [infographic].\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft 365 content migration tools and services [infographic].</span></span></P>\n<P>[Download the above <A href=\"https://aka.ms/MigrateToM365/infographic\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365 migration infographic</A>]</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Microsoft focuses on providing a seamless move to Microsoft 365 with as much expertise and tooling we and our ecosystem can offer – across the globe. Our goal is to help move to the cloud with confidence.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1><STRONG>Migration Manager – simplify file share migrations</STRONG></H1>\n<P>Migration Manager is now generally available. It is a key part of the SharePoint admin center, to help orchestrate and simplify management of file share migrations. Admins can add and manage multiple migration agents to centrally orchestrate all migration activities.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Migration-Manager_SP-admin-center.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/214548i22D473DB8ECCC781/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Migration-Manager_SP-admin-center.png\" alt=\"SharePoint admin center - Migration manager, showing multiple agents to scale migration.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">SharePoint admin center - Migration manager, showing multiple agents to scale migration.</span></span></P>\n<P>Migration Manager lets you migrate your on-premises file share content to Microsoft 365. Through a simple interface within the SharePoint admin center, admins can manage thousands of migration tasks across multiple machines.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Simplify file share migrations –&nbsp;<A href=\"https://aka.ms/MigrationManager\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">learn more about Migration Manager</A>&nbsp;(improved documentation and troubleshooting guide).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1><STRONG>Mover – migrate from 3<SUP>rd</SUP>-party cloud providers</STRONG></H1>\n<P>Mover supports migration from Amazon, Box, Dropbox, Egnyte, and Google– into OneDrive, SharePoint, and Teams. This enables seamless file collaboration across Microsoft 365 apps and services, including the Office apps and Microsoft Teams. The Mover team also brings deep expertise and migration technology, which advances Microsoft’s commitment to providing organizations of all sizes with the right tools, people, and partners to successfully migrate to the Microsoft Cloud.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Mover_migration-manager.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213782i7416AE438D2CB29E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Mover_migration-manager.png\" alt=\"The Mover migration manager is the dashboard which gives you a summary of your overall migration; here showing an active migration of content from Google Drive into OneDrive.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The Mover migration manager is the dashboard which gives you a summary of your overall migration; here showing an active migration of content from Google Drive into OneDrive.</span></span></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://aka.ms/mover\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mover</A>&nbsp;helps make it easier than ever for customers to migrate files to Microsoft 365 – for free.&nbsp;Start your cloud-to-M365 migrations today. <A href=\"https://twitter.com/Mover_io\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mover</A> on Twitter.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1><STRONG>SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) – accelerate on-premises migrations of SharePoint</STRONG></H1>\n<P>The SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) is a simple and fast solution to help you migrate content from on-premises SharePoint Server sites and file shares to SharePoint, OneDrive, and now Microsoft Teams in Microsoft 365. It is designed to help you bring your information to the cloud and take advantage of the latest collaboration, intelligence, and security solutions within Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SPMT.jpg\" style=\"width: 885px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213783i85A9A3379044F25D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"SPMT.jpg\" alt=\"Use the SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) to migrate Sharepoint Server sites or file shares to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams – all in Microsoft 365.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Use the SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) to migrate Sharepoint Server sites or file shares to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams – all in Microsoft 365.</span></span></P>\n<P>Using the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://aka.ms/spmt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Migration Tool</A>, you can quickly bring your most important content to Microsoft Teams to create a more open, digital environment.&nbsp;The tool makes it easy to select Teams that you are an owner of, to then set them as the destination(s) for the migration. The tool will also let you select what specific channel you want the content to go into. Parallel to SPMT is the <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SMAT\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Migration Assessment Tool</A> (SMAT), a simple command line executable that scans the contents of your SharePoint farm to help identify the impact of migrating your server to SharePoint with Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Learn more about&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepointmigration/what-is-supported-spmt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">what features the SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) supports</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Microsoft 365 FastTrack</H1>\n<P>FastTrack for Microsoft 365 helps organizations accelerate deployment, migration, and adoption of their Microsoft 365 subscriptions at no additional cost.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>FastTrack provides guidance to enable OneDrive, SharePoint, and the source environment for migration. Depending on the source, we may perform various <EM>Enable</EM> steps. We help you with some activities by using a combination of tools, documentation, and guidance, and by performing configuration tasks where applicable and feasible.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"FastTrack.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213784iEFA9450C08F6F90C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"FastTrack.jpg\" alt=\"The FastTrack process for Microsoft 365.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The FastTrack process for Microsoft 365.</span></span></P>\n<P>Learn more <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/fasttrack/microsoft-365\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">about FastTrack for Microsoft 365</A> and their <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/fasttrack/o365-data-migration\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">data migration services</A> to get the most from your Microsoft 365 investment. <A href=\"https://twitter.com/fasttrack\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">FastTrack</A> on Twitter.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Diverse migration partner ecosystem</H1>\n<P>Our diverse migration partner ecosystem provides a wide variety of tools and services to help plan and migrate your content to Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<TABLE>\n<TBODY>\n<TR>\n<TD target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A></P>\n</TD>\n<TD width=\"208\">\n<P><STRONG>AvePoint<BR /></STRONG><A href=\"https://www.avepoint.com/services/migration-services\" target=\"_blank\" Partners</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1><STRONG>Related migration resources</STRONG></H1>\n<P>Regardless of your organization's size, data scale or information complexity, you can migrate documents and sites into OneDrive, SharePoint, and Teams in Microsoft 365 successfully. And we are here to help. Below are a the most top-level resources to all Microsoft migration tools and services:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P data-unlink=\"true\">On-demand webinar | “<STRONG>Free and easy migration to Microsoft 365</STRONG>” presented by Microsoft migration experts, Hani Loza and Eric Warnke:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/Tf3Yp2megmA\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Tf3Yp2megmA/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Additional resources:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MigrationManager\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Migration Manager</A>&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://mover.io/guides/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mover migration planning guides</A></LI>\n<UL>\n<LI>\"<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-SharePoint-Blog/Move-with-Mover-Migration-a-bonus-Microsoft-Ignite-2019-episode/ba-p/988040\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Move with Mover migration</A>\" – The Intrazone podcast episode discussion with the migration engineering leads, Hani Loza and Eric Warnke</LI>\n</UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/SPMT\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Migration Tool</A>&nbsp;(SPMT) &amp; <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SMAT\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Migration Assessment Tool</A> (SMAT)</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/fasttrack/microsoft-365\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">FastTrack for Microsoft 365</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Our goal is to empower you and every person on your team to achieve, and move, more. Let us know what you need next. We are always open to feedback via&nbsp;<A href=\"https://sharepoint.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A>&nbsp;and continued dialog in the&nbsp;<A href=\"http://office.com/sharepoint/community\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint community</A>&nbsp;within the Microsoft Tech Community —and we always have an eye on tweets to&nbsp;<A href=\"http://twitter.com/sharepoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@SharePoint</A>. Let us know.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Thanks, Mark Kashman, senior product manager (SharePoint/Microsoft)</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 23:40:05 leaving room for some growth of your prefrontal Project Cortex?\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n This \n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/ProjectCortex\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Project Cortex\n </A> update episode will feed your mind, automate the topics, and prepare you for how Project Cortex in Microsoft 365 will empower you with knowledge and expertise within the apps you use every day.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In this episode, we dive into an update on Project Cortex development and design – digging into on the managed metadata service (MMS), classification and knowledge curation – to learn how you and your company will further the union between people, content, and work processes. Chris and I talk with \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/c-j-tan/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  <STRONG>\n   CJ Tan\n  </STRONG>\n </A> and \n <A Cortex at Microsoft.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n OK, time for the episode, aka \n <EM>\n  Cortex audible course: part 2\n </EM>…\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <A And we will do this, together, one ‘topic card’ at a time.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<H1>\n The Intrazone links\n</H1> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  Show Page: \n  <A href=\"https://intrazone.libsyn.com/\" 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"Evolve your intelligent intranet to transform employee communications and digital experiences","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/evolve-your-intelligent-intranet-to-transform-employee/ba-p/1506407","description":"<P>Remote work has become a necessity for many employees and companies. And of course, with this comes the issue of communication between those working from home, those working out in the field, and their managers and colleagues.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If you have been operating on a legacy intranet, it is time to evolve! Modern work deserves a modern intranet. Legacy intranets with outdated features and overwhelming information will only hinder your team. It’s time to respond to the rise in remote work and the desire for personalized experiences. Harness the power of the intelligent intranet to communicate effectively across the organization, engage employees, and connect with relevant information and knowledge.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"1intelligent intranet.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/203896i173B32D877CFA45F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"1intelligent intranet.png\" alt=\"1intelligent intranet.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To make upgrading and setting up your new intranet as easy as possible (easier than it already is) we have launched the intelligent intranet site, to transform employee communications and digital experiences with Microsoft 365. The 4-stage, self-paced approach designed to guide you from exploring the possibilities, aligning your company's priorities, implementing your new intranet and finally, engaging with your team to ensure adoption.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We’ve put together videos, templates, demos, customer interviews, and more. Get started today! 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"SharePoint mobile app will now allow admins to customize their tenant theme with branding","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-mobile-app-will-now-allow-admins-to-customize-their/ba-p/1243066","description":"<P>More of your employees are working remotely and depending on their mobile device for important company information. The current world climate and the concerns surrounding the COVID-19 virus have only amplified this need.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For many organizations their intranet is the hub for knowledge and information, and the SharePoint mobile app is the best way for employees to access this from any mobile device. A request we have heard from you is to allow the SharePoint mobile app to be more customizable and enable you brand it with your company’s guidelines easily. We are happy to announce that the SharePoint mobile app will now allow admins to customize their tenant theme in the Microsoft 365 admin center. The SharePoint Mobile App will allow users to view their tenant theme on the app if admins have configured that option in the Microsoft 365 admin center.<SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">&nbsp;This ability is available today for both </SPAN><A style=\"font-family: inherit; background-color: #ffffff;\" href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-sharepoint/id1091505266\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">iOS</A><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\"> and </SPAN><A style=\"font-family: inherit; background-color: #ffffff;\" href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.sharepoint&amp;hl=en\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Android</A><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\"> devices.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SP mobile.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178776iCF9DF6D46A1E3F2B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"SP mobile.png\" alt=\"Company branding with the SharePoint mobile app\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Company branding with the SharePoint mobile app</span></span></P>\n<P>For more information on how to customize your tenant them see&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/admin/setup/customize-your-organization-theme?view=o365-worldwide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Customize the Office 365 theme for your organization</A>.</P>\n<P><BR />Administrators can configure the following for the SharePoint mobile app:</P>\n<OL>\n<LI><STRONG>Logo Image:</STRONG> Logo of SVG format (Images uploaded in any other format will not display in the app)</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Nav Bar Color:</STRONG> This is background color that appears in the background of the nav bar for all 3 tabs. (Please note sites will not be impacted by this nav bar color input).</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Text and Icon Color:</STRONG> This section input affects text and icons color on the navigation bar</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Accent Color:</STRONG> This input will affect buttons, links and other elements defined on the app for branding.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>If you have already configured this information employee will automatically start seeing the branded app after they update the mobile app to latest version.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Customize for your organization.png\" style=\"width: 402px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178598i50F7C41EAA81B4CA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Customize for your organization.png\" alt=\"Customize for your organization\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Customize for your organization</span></span></P>\n<P>Download or update the SharePoint mobile app from <A href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-sharepoint/id1091505266\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">iOS</A> and <A href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.sharepoint&amp;hl=en\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Android</A> app store today to experience company 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/updates-on-the-microsoft-365-community-docs-june-2020/ba-p/1488693","description":"<P><SPAN>The <A href=\"http://aka.ms/M365-Community-Docs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365 Community Docs</A> is a valuable resource for \"makers\": site owners, citizen developers, power users, and more. Really, anyone who would like to understand the platform better to support their organization. Articles provide many different types of content, from simple definitions of terms, to explanation of common concepts using everyday examples, to scenario-based decision-making tools, to in-depth discussion of specific apps and services.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>Community-generated content has tremendous value because it is written by people in the trenches – the people who work with the platform every day. Sometimes people in the community devise solutions Microsoft couldn't have imagined or ways to combine different services uniquely to solve business problems. As a community, we can talk about what works well and what doesn't.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>If you are interested in becoming a contributor, you have several options:</SPAN></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><SPAN>Make an <A href=\"https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/microsoft-365-community/issues/new?assignees=&amp;labels=&amp;template=ArticleSuggestion.md&amp;title=\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">article suggestion</A> by adding an Issue in Github</SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN>Suggest those fixes or changes in an <A href=\"https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/microsoft-365-community/issues/new?assignees=&amp;labels=&amp;template=ArticleIssue.md&amp;title=\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">article issue</A></SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN>Make edits or improvements to existing articles yourself based on your experience</SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN>Review the <A href=\"https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/microsoft-365-community/issues\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">open issues</A>, most of which are articles suggestions. See if there are any suggestions you would like to write about. If you see something you would like to tackle, add a comment requesting to be assigned to the issue.</SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN>Write a new article describing aspects of the platform you are passionate about. If you're not sure if your idea is \"fully baked\", add an <A href=\"https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/microsoft-365-community/issues/new?assignees=&amp;labels=&amp;template=ArticleSuggestion.md&amp;title=\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">article suggestion</A> with a request for it to be assigned to you and we can help you refine your idea.</SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN>As an open source effort, we can partner you with other authors and contributors if you feel you could use some support. Simply ask a <A href=\"https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/microsoft-365-community/issues/new?assignees=&amp;labels=&amp;template=Question.md&amp;title=\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">question</A> in the repo and we'll get back to you as quickly as we can.</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>We've got some interesting content ideas in the pipeline. One of them will be based on the excellent work <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/sadalit/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sadie Van Buren</A> did back in the 2010-2012 timeframe around the SharePoint Maturity Model. (<A href=\"https://web.archive.org/web/20170515104847/http:/www.sharepointmaturity.com/home.aspx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Old Web site</A> at the Wayback Machine.) Sadie's framework was invaluable for SharePoint shops to gauge and evaluate their level of maturity in using the platform. We plan to expand and update the model to cover more of Microsoft 365 over the coming months. Sound interesting? Think you might like to be involved? Drop a comment on the issue <U><A href=\"https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/microsoft-365-community/issues/187\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Update and Modernize Sadie Van Buren's SharePoint Maturity Model</A></U>.<SPAN>The repo continues to expand and evolve. Since the last post, we have new articles in the repo as well as new contributors</SPAN></P>\n<H2><SPAN>New Articles</SPAN></H2>\n<P><SPAN>These articles have been added since we last posted.</SPAN></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><SPAN><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/community/large-lists-large-libraries-in-sharepoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Living Large with Large Lists and Large Libraries</A></SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/community/sharepoint-naming-guidelines\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Naming Guidelines</A></SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/community/should-i-store-my-files-in-teams-or-sharepoint-an-understanding-of-behind-the-scenes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Should I store my files in Microsoft Teams or in SharePoint?
