Sharing is caring!</EM></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 25 Jun 2020 11:22:40 +0000","feedId":13333,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"2770d7af8ce3c6e8defedc8260865dff","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Vesa Juvonen","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688844},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"SharePoint Roadmap Pitstop: December 2019","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-december-2019/ba-p/1084500","description":"<P>It’s the ho ho holidays and the SharePoint team has been in the giving spirit throughout the entire month of December (2019)….</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\">Now Audience targeting! Now Files in Forms! Now Root site swap and alternate rows!</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\">On SharePoint admin center! On people cards! On, column totals and a list RTE that glows!</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\">To the top of the customizable navigation, to the launch of the OWA PWA app,</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\">Now dash away, dash away, dash away and take a year-end tech nap.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>OK, sleigh bells have rung and the new year ringing is about to commence. So, consider this the all-inclusive recap of all recent releases and updates, plus the embedded <STRONG>Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop: December 2019</STRONG> podcast episode – the bonus monthly audible companion – all to help answer, \"What's rolling out now for SharePoint and related technologies into Microsoft 365?\"</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To answer that festive question, <A href=\"http://intrazone.mpsn.libsynpro.com/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-december-2019\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">listen</A> and scroll below (info, links and screenshots galore) to stay informed on what features and updates arrived this past month - plus a few <EM>predictions</EM> of what's to come:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/12569468/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In the podcast episode, I interview <STRONG>Kaarin Shumate</STRONG> (<A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/kaarin-shumate/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">LinkedIn</A>), senior content developer who focuses on the strategy and management of SharePoint help documentation, UX writing to ensure accessibility for the global IT SharePoint admin community – on-premises and in Microsoft 365. You see much of her work within the SharePoint admin center - all the words to help guide and define all the button and clicks as you manage your intelligent intranet. Kaarin has a wealth to share about behind-the-scenes working closely with engineering and continuously reviewing customer feedback.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_0.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163451i3C1ED70A5DEA8F4C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_0.png\" alt=\"Kaarin Shumate, senior content developer (SharePoint/Microsoft); LinkedIn profile picture on the left, at Microsoft Studios on the right; Intrazone guest.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Kaarin Shumate, senior content developer (SharePoint/Microsoft); LinkedIn profile picture on the left, at Microsoft Studios on the right; Intrazone guest.</span></span></P>\n<P>We also have a festive audible treat baked into this episode – a holiday parody rendition of “<STRONG>Up on the Cloud Top</STRONG>” with special musical guests: The KashKids – Sophie on lead vocals and Eli on cello – with me nearly a’tuned keeping up with both of them for a lil end-of-year holiday musical fun; full song embedded within the Roadmap Pitstop: December 2019 edition with lyrics at the end of this blog post + in-studio pics.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>OK, onto the tech; all features listed below began rolling out to Targeted Release customers in Office 365 as of December 2019 (possibly early January 2020).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Inform and engage with dynamic employee experiences</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Build your modern intranet on SharePoint in Office 365 and get the benefits of investing in business outcomes – reducing IT and development costs, increasing business speed and agility, and up-leveling the dynamic and welcoming nature of your intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Audience targeting in SharePoint organizational news in Microsoft 365</STRONG></P>\n<P>You can show content to specific groups of people. This allows page authors and site owners to tag pages and news posts with Azure Active Directory (AAD) groups, and filter content within these web parts to people within those groups - to target them with relevant content.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" style=\"width: 650px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163449i9DD6D6334B0B10A3/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" alt=\"After enabling the audience targeting feature, target news posts to specific audiences from within the Site Pages library.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">After enabling the audience targeting feature, target news posts to specific audiences from within the Site Pages library.</span></span></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-14_Dec.2019_003_Audience-targeting_pt2.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163953iC9065737805EA97F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-14_Dec.2019_003_Audience-targeting_pt2.jpg\" alt=\"From within the News web part, Megan (on the left), who works in HR, sees the two news posts targeted for the HR Members group, where Nestor (on the right), who works in marketing, sees the two posts targeted for the Marketing Members group. They both see not targeted content - the &quot;Travel Updates Coming Soon!&quot; news article.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">From within the News web part, Megan (on the left), who works in HR, sees the two news posts targeted for the HR Members group, where Nestor (on the right), who works in marketing, sees the two posts targeted for the Marketing Members group. They both see not targeted content - the \"Travel Updates Coming Soon!\" news article.</span></span></P>\n<P>The SharePoint start page, news on the mobile apps, and the News web part with audience targeting enabled, now show filtered views. Note: You can set one or more groups as the audience for any file.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/target-files-news-and-pages-to-specific-audiences-33d84cb6-14ed-4e53-a426-74c38ea32293\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap ID:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?rtc=1&amp;filters=&amp;searchterms=30695\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">30695</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>File Upload for Microsoft Forms</STRONG></P>\n<P>Build a form in minutes and now include the ability for people to send content as a part of their submission. This new feature allows form designers to choose a new question type, File Upload, which enables respondents to attach files as part of their response. Files can be accessed in either SharePoint or OneDrive in Microsoft 365, depending on the form type; group forms use SharePoint, while personal forms use OneDrive. Form creators can limit the number and size of files as well as specify file types.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163452iCAE183517B7F4B9A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_3.png\" alt=\"A new question type for Microsoft Forms, File Upload. Question #2 above shows a respondent uploading a PNG image as a part of their survey submission.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">A new question type for Microsoft Forms, File Upload. Question #2 above shows a respondent uploading a PNG image as a part of their survey submission.</span></span></P>\n<P>Note: File upload is not available when the form is shared externally. Change your form setting to “Only people in my organization can respond” within the “Send and collect responses” section under the form’s <STRONG>Share</STRONG> button.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Forms-Blog/What-s-New-in-Microsoft-Forms-Oct-Nov-2019/ba-p/1035081\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=59344\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">59344</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Multiple updates to the SharePoint admin center</STRONG></P>\n<P>We’re continuously updating the experience to allow additional admin controls (like viewing and managing permissions of a site), as we align the admin experiences across the different Microsoft 365 admin centers. This month, SharePoint admins can better replace their root site without PowerShell, adjust permissions, see people cards on-hover and more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U>Replace&nbsp;root&nbsp;site</U>&nbsp;–&nbsp;You can replace your root site with another site&nbsp;from the SharePoint admin center. The&nbsp;original&nbsp;root&nbsp;site&nbsp;is moved to a different URL and can be restored, if necessary.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_4.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163454i6933F7AB0DBC87C4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_4.png\" alt=\"You can now swap the root site with the site of your choice directly from within the SharePoint admin center.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">You can now swap the root site with the site of your choice directly from within the SharePoint admin center.</span></span></P>\n<P><U>Permissions panel</U>&nbsp;–&nbsp;You can&nbsp;now&nbsp;see&nbsp;the site&nbsp;Owners, Members, and Visitors. If it’s an Office 365&nbsp;Groups-connected site, you can&nbsp;see the group owners, and add or remove&nbsp;additional&nbsp;site&nbsp;admins if needed.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_5.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163453iB3B8AE9D93F8FFE0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_5.png\" alt=\"Manage site permissions from within the site information pane – to adjust site admins, site owners, site members and site visitors.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Manage site permissions from within the site information pane – to adjust site admins, site owners, site members and site visitors.</span></span></P>\n<P><U>On-hover people&nbsp;cards</U>&nbsp;–&nbsp;Hovering over the name of a user (on the Active&nbsp;sites list or&nbsp;in the&nbsp;details&nbsp;panel) lets you see details about the user - the same pervasive people card experience you see throughout Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_6.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163455i5CF7DCAC12D95BE4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_6.png\" alt=\"View an individual's people card right from within the Active sites information pane.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">View an individual's people card right from within the Active sites information pane.</span></span></P>\n<P><U>Customizable navigation pane</U>&nbsp;–&nbsp;You can hide&nbsp;items you don’t use or collapse the navigation&nbsp;menu&nbsp;to see more content on the page.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_7.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163456i7A7F511ED7F6D195/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_7.png\" alt=\"Uncheck Sharepoint admin center left-hand navigation items so they do not appear. Easily check them again to bring them back.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Uncheck Sharepoint admin center left-hand navigation items so they do not appear. Easily check them again to bring them back.</span></span></P>\n<P><U>More features page</U>&nbsp;–&nbsp;The “Classic features” page has been renamed to “More features,” and all classic features&nbsp;are shown on the page so that you don’t need to click “More classic features” to see them.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_8.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163458i71545CC41F730D0A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_8.png\" alt=\"Access more features, like Term store, User profiles, BCS and more, right from the &quot;More features&quot; page without having to go to any other classic settings page.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Access more features, like Term store, User profiles, BCS and more, right from the \"More features\" page without having to go to any other classic settings page.</span></span></P>\n<P><U>Additional site-level sharing settings</U>&nbsp;–&nbsp;For all sites, you can&nbsp;now&nbsp;limit sharing by domain, set the default sharing&nbsp;link type,&nbsp;and&nbsp;set default sharing&nbsp;link permission,&nbsp;(Previously, you could only&nbsp;do&nbsp;these tasks for&nbsp;classic sites&nbsp;on the classic site collections page.)&nbsp;You can also&nbsp;make “Anyone” links expire.&nbsp;Additionally, the&nbsp;External&nbsp;sharing&nbsp;column is now included when&nbsp;you export&nbsp;your&nbsp;site list as a&nbsp;.csv&nbsp;file.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U>Design&nbsp;updates</U></P>\n<P>Details&nbsp;panels have been widened, to provide space for future enhancements and match the design&nbsp;of other Microsoft 365 admin centers. And the&nbsp;Settings page has been redesigned&nbsp;as&nbsp;a list&nbsp;that lets you&nbsp;see the current value for each setting.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/get-started-new-admin-center\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Get started with the new SharePoint admin center</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap&nbsp;IDs:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;featureid=57314\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">57314</A>,&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;featureid=57309\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">57309</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Teamwork updates across SharePoint team sites, OneDrive and Microsoft Teams</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 is designed to be a universal toolkit for teamwork – to give you the right tools for the right task, along with common services to help you seamlessly work across applications. SharePoint is the intelligent content service that powers teamwork – to better collaborate on proposals, projects, and campaigns throughout your organization – and is integrated with Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Yammer, Stream, Planner and much more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New modern list features released in December 2019</STRONG></P>\n<P>The SharePoint team has been ramping up investments in lists this last year. And as this month’s latest releases, they are certain to continue to deliver the value for how you best represent and track your data. Below are the three latest list innovations… SharePoint makers, are you ready?</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U>Column totals settings</U> – Show totals, or not, it is your choice – and easier than ever to accomplish. Users will be able to enable and disable column totals in the SharePoint list experience; previously this was only achievable when in classic mode. You’re able to display column totals and subtotals in the footer of a group or a list/library view. Custom views allow you to add calculated fields, such as totals or averages, to the footer of a group or the entire list. And, totals also appear in List and Library web parts.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_9.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163459i1997A6BEF65E0946/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_9.png\" alt=\"Choose to display column totals, or not, for SharePoint lists and libraries.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Choose to display column totals, or not, for SharePoint lists and libraries.</span></span></P>\n<P>To adjust Totals for a particular column of a SharePoint list, click the down-facing arrow to the right of the column header &gt; select <STRONG>Totals</STRONG> &gt; and then select your preferred Totals type.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U>Rich text formatting</U> – Beyond standard column formatting, you now have a rich palette off which to design more visually meaningful, actionable list items.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>You’ll then see all Format options available to reflect more visually the meaning of each word or status of the column(s) – including the ability to adjust Font (bold, italicize, underline), Icon, Borders (style and color) all while seeing a real-time preview of your design.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_10.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163461i3E730AAB804FBAB8/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_10.png\" alt=\"Use the built-in rich text editor (RTE) to design how you want your text and icons to appear in your SharePoint lists or libraries.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Use the built-in rich text editor (RTE) to design how you want your text and icons to appear in your SharePoint lists or libraries.</span></span></P>\n<P>To adjust how text appears for a particular column of a SharePoint list, click the down-facing arrow to the right of the column header &gt; select <STRONG>Column settings</STRONG> &gt; <STRONG>Format this column</STRONG> &gt; click <STRONG>Edit styles</STRONG> and then click the pencil icon to the right of an item choice and click <STRONG>More styles</STRONG>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U>Alternate rows</U> – Users will be able to create a document view for list data that features column formatting and/or alternating colors by row.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_11.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163460iF3BE2C6DE329AFEA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_11.png\" alt=\"Add alternating row color within your SharePoint lists and libraries. The above list shows both column formatting and alternate row formatting.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Add alternating row color within your SharePoint lists and libraries. The above list shows both column formatting and alternate row formatting.</span></span></P>\n<P>To apply alternate row formatting to a SharePoint list, click the down-facing arrow to the right of the top All Items list header option &gt; select <STRONG>Format current view</STRONG> &gt; then click <STRONG>Edit row styles</STRONG>. Here you can then adjust the row font, colors, border style – all with a real-time preview of your design.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Learn more about upcoming list innovation and how to guidance:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-SharePoint-Blog/Content-collaboration-throughout-Microsoft-365-Microsoft-Ignite/ba-p/960868\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Content collaboration throughout Microsoft 365 – Microsoft Ignite 2019 announcements</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/dev/transform/modernize-userinterface-lists-and-libraries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Maximize use of modern lists and libraries</A></LI>\n<LI>Roadmap IDs&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=46102\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">46102</A>, <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=57305\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">57305</A>and&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?rtc=1%26filters=&amp;searchterms=57306\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">57306</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Retirement of SharePoint classic and Delve blogs</STRONG></P>\n<P>This one comes as an FYI with guidance. SharePoint classic blogs and Delve blogs are being retired. Existing SharePoint classic blogs will continue to work as expected, including the ability to create new posts, but you will not be able to create new blog sites after a period of time. Delve blogs will no longer be available for creation, and existing blogs will eventually be removed, after an extended period of read only access.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We recommend creating Communication sites using News, Yammer, and Stream as a modern way of engaging with your audience.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Related resources\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/blogwithmodernsharepoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Creating a blog with communications sites and news posts</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/transformdelveblogstomodernpages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Modernize Delve blogs and classic blogs</A> [includes the community supported PnP Page transformation tool]</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Related technology</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Flow is becoming Microsoft Power Automate</STRONG></P>\n<P>As announced at Microsoft Ignite 2019, Microsoft Flow is being renamed to Microsoft Power Automate to better align with the Microsoft Power Platform.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_12.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163463i458C1A19574BEB08/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_12.png\" alt=\"Microsoft Flow is now Power Automate. In the context of a SharePoint document library, you'll now see the &quot;Automate&quot; drop-down menu to create and configure flows.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft Flow is now Power Automate. In the context of a SharePoint document library, you'll now see the \"Automate\" drop-down menu to create and configure flows.</span></span></P>\n<P>You will start to see Microsoft Flow be replaced by Microsoft Power Automate throughout the service. These changes will start to become visible in Microsoft documentation, Admin center, etc. in the near future. And for OneDrive and SharePoint, you'll see this primarily in lists and libraries.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://cloudblogs.microsoft.com/dynamics365/bdm/2019/11/04/announcing-rpa-enhanced-security-no-code-virtual-agents-and-more-for-microsoft-power-platform/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Outlook on the web as a progressive web app</STRONG></P>\n<P>With this update, your users will be able to install Outlook on the web as a progressive web app in Chromium-based browsers. PWAs are websites that that provide native app-like features on supporting platforms and browser engines. When Outlook is installed as a PWA, users can launch it from the Start menu, pin it to the Taskbar, or run it in a standalone browser window that removes standard browser interface elements. Microsoft will continue to update Outlook on the web with additional app-like capabilities.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_13.png\" style=\"width: 520px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163462iEECC42B4F5876F3C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_13.png\" alt=\"You can install the web version of Outlook—either Outlook on the web or Outlook.com—as a progressive web app in the new Microsoft Edge Edge icon and Google Chrome.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">You can install the web version of Outlook—either Outlook on the web or Outlook.com—as a progressive web app in the new Microsoft Edge Edge icon and Google Chrome.</span></span></P>\n<P>It's the best of OWA - where Outlook often ships the latest features, like the new files experience for Groups, tasks powered by To Do built in, a nice Unsubscribe button for unwanted newsletters, nicer previews of attachments - esp. images, and more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Been using it a week now to try it out, and think I'll keep it as my daily mail and calendar driver.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Learn how to&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/use-the-web-version-of-outlook-like-a-desktop-app-b360bd9a-00dc-43a4-bdf8-71cdeeb78e83\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">use the web version of Outlook like a desktop app</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Microsoft 365&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=59250\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 59250</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>January 2020 <SPAN style=\"text-decoration: line-through;\">teasers</SPAN> predictions</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Psst, still here? Still scrolling the page looking for the rolled out goodness? If so, here’s a few predictions of what’s to come to production next month…</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Prediction #1: <STRONG>Custom search results pages for SharePoint Sites </STRONG>[Roadmap <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=32738\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 32738</A>]</LI>\n<LI>Prediction #2: <STRONG>SharePoint page version history </STRONG>[Roadmap&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=57813\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 57813</A>]</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>… shhh, tell everyone.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Helpful, ongoing change management resources + the top support articles Kaarin episode/blog of the <STRONG>Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop – December 2019 </STRONG>(<A all.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_14.jpeg\" style=\"width: 752px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163464i7E98A763CFCEEED5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_14.jpeg\" alt=\"Left-to-right: Eli Kashman – Sophie.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_15.jpeg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img 24_219949426c8532a1.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163459i1997A6BEF65E0946/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn53@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-40-259_dd4796d69c41da28.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163461i3E730AAB804FBAB8/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn38@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-38-189_019e252c9bde2640.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163460iF3BE2C6DE329AFEA/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn18@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-31-45-417_6979d249e05b6e21.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163463i458C1A19574BEB08/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn86@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-40-588_5367b9b0e5344eca.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163462iEECC42B4F5876F3C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn82@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-38-619_ddfa25ad88320904.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163464i7E98A763CFCEEED5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn73@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-31-43-811_88ebdc48ef8546e2.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163465i1A9C0F368C476C6F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn6@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-45-538_33e4c1a816cfbe17.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688852},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"SharePoint Dev Weekly - Episode 70","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-dev-weekly-episode-70/ba-p/1166389","description":"<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"episode-70.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/170319i0FF26796D0F9AC8F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"episode-70.png\" alt=\"episode-70.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>In this episode, Vesa and Waldek are joined by&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://twitter.com/sebastienlevert\" target=\"_blank\">Sébastien “Seb” Levert</A><SPAN>, Product Lead and MVP managing product strategy at Valo Intranet in Montreal, Canada. The conversation focused on the convergence of portals and collaboration platforms.&nbsp; Teams is becoming the primary work environment through which LOB apps, communications, BOTs, SharePoint, etc., are being accessed.&nbsp; Valo follows a Teams First development approach.&nbsp; The challenge is creating the tailored/personalized landing page in Teams without the same controls that are available in SharePoint.&nbsp; Other trends discussed –</SPAN><WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;clickable BOT actions, Teams left nav, building personal apps using SPFx, enterprise provisioning and “proper snow.”</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This episode was recorded on Monday, February 11, 2020</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><SPAN><A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/blogs/sharepoint-dev-weekly-episode-70/\" target=\"_self\">SharePoint Dev Weekly - When you add an issue, you can choose from several templates: Question, Article Suggestion, or Article Issue.</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\" data-wac-het=\"1\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">We</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;believe the community-driven content model&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">has been a tremendous success in the past and that this new set of docs will be another success for the entire community. data-contrast=\"auto\">?</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\" data-wac-het=\"1\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Oftentimes, people wonder how they can become more active in the community. We hope this effort will become another \"on ramp\" where people can direct their energy – and this community has plenty of energy!</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\" data-wac-het=\"1\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"\" data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;consider yourself a writer, but you have ideas for articles you wish were out there, add your ideas in to the mix.</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\" data-wac-het=\"1\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"\" data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;like some help writing something, we'll find you someone to work with you to turn your thoughts into a valuable resource.</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\" data-wac-het=\"1\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"\" data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;a blogger and have a favorite article or two, consider contributing&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">them</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;to give&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">your work</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;a longer life.</SPAN><SPAN posts.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\" bring your energy and we will help you figure out how you can help.</SPAN></P>\n<HR />\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\" class=\"brand\">Microsoft 365</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>&amp; Azure teams.&nbsp; &nbsp;The role advocates for customers, creates learning plans beyond “Hello World” basics, code samples, videos…&nbsp; Dan will focus largely on<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/get-started-with-fluid-framework-preview-d05278db-b82b-4d1f-8523-cf0c9c2fb2df\" target=\"_blank\">Fluid Framework</A>.&nbsp; Do you have what it takes to be a Cloud Developer Advocate?&nbsp; If you can admit you don’t know it all and are not afraid of putting yourself out there as speaker, writer, sample developer and community participant, then you might have the right stuff.&nbsp; Additionally, in this episode, 17 recently released articles from Microsoft and the PnP Community are highlighted.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\"><SPAN>This episode was recorded on Monday, July 6, 2020.</SPAN></P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><SPAN><A 90</A></SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><SPAN>Did we miss your article? Episode 79","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/microsoft-365-amp-sharepoint-pnp-weekly-episode-79/ba-p/1321157","description":"<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"pnpweekly-episode-79.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/185352iE0F8A204E62CB231/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"pnpweekly-episode-79.png\" alt=\"pnpweekly-episode-79.png\" /></span></P>\n<P class=\"\">In this weekly discussion of latest news and topics around<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN class=\"brand\">Microsoft 365</SPAN>, hosts –<WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://twitter.com/vesajuvonen\" target=\"_blank\">Vesa Juvonen</A><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>(Microsoft),<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://twitter.com/waldekm\" target=\"_blank\">Waldek Mastykarz</A><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>(Rencore), are joined by<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://twitter.com/appieschot\" target=\"_blank\">Albert-Jan Schot</A><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>–<WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>CTO and MVP at Portiva –<WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>Utrecht, Netherlands.</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\">The group discusses differences in development for on-prem (one framework, add boxes) vs cloud (many frameworks, throttling), for business productivity stack (integrate stuff) vs Azure (expose stuff) and for open-source projects (rinse and repeat).&nbsp; Unclear?&nbsp; Watch the episode.</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\">Why develop for M365 as opposed to Azure? It’s not that you choose one or the other. Both so intertwined and converging in a cloud first world.&nbsp;&nbsp; Azure (tools/services) supports so much that we just do AI, Infrastructure, Security, Identity in the process of delivering business solutions. M365 is like an OS providing many services. &nbsp;Our focus is integrating and building on top of M365 –<WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>within feature rich environments –<WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>Teams, Outlook, SharePoint where our customers conduct their daily business.</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\"><SPAN>This episode was recorded on Tuesday, April 14, 2020.</SPAN></P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/blogs/microsoft-365-sharepoint-pnp-weekly-episode-79/\" target=\"_self\">Microsoft 365 &amp; </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">below are available </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">today at&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/sharepointadoption\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">https://aka.ms/sharepointadoption</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">.&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H3><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Get stakeholder buy-in and alignment </SPAN></H3>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">We all understand how important it is to bring stakeholders along this journey. This is table stakes in order to realize the full value of an intelligent intranet in your organization. For a corporate intranet this typically includes Corporate Communications and Human Resources, but is by no means exclusive to these departments. <STRONG>We need to inspire our stakeholders about the possibilities and deeply understand their business priorities and challenges.</STRONG></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"priority and challenges example.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/167823i6B6A14F85CC6C6B6/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"priority and challenges example.PNG\" alt=\"Priority and challenges example\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Priority and challenges example</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H3><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Identify and prioritize scenarios </SPAN></H3>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Now that we understand what our stakeholders care about, <STRONG>we get their buy-in and commitment by defining intranet related scenarios that help them move their priorities forward. </STRONG></SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\"><STRONG><BR /></STRONG>There are a lot of different ways to define a scenario or use case. I’ve used the framework below many times and have found it to be the most effective as it covers the necessary elements in the most straightforward manner.</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"identify and prioritize scenarios.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/167822i8F0119D1167A6D5F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"identify and prioritize scenarios.PNG\" alt=\"Scenario framework\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Scenario framework</span></span></SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">You’ll want to </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">go through this scenario identification exercise with</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> all intranet stakeholders</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">. Y</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">ou need everyone onboard and they need to understand the clear value they get </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">from their </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">involvement. </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Once </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">you’ve </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">brainstormed with </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">them </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">and identified several relevant scenarios, you might get a table that approximates </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">something like below. In fact, if you like how this template lists the identified scenarios under each of the business priorities your stakeholders shared with you, download the </SPAN><A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/link/sharepoint-envisioning-workshop-concept/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">envisioning workshop concept</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\"> presentation</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"scenario list example.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/167824i93409B23F35DB7D4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"scenario list example.PNG\" alt=\"Scenario list example\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Scenario list example</span></span></SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Because you can’t do everything at once, you need to prioritize the scenarios. I like a simple </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">two by two </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">matrix </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">that </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">helps </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">assess each scenario </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">across</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> two </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">axis – </SPAN><STRONG><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">level of impact</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> and </SPAN><STRONG><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">ease of implementation</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">. Based on this quick assessment you will plot </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">the scenario in the appropriate quadrant</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559685&quot;:142,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559685&quot;:142,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Prioritization example.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/167825iE2191BF2AFF1166D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Prioritization example.PNG\" alt=\"Prioritization example\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Prioritization example</span></span></SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Notice how </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">only the scenarios that rank highest in</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> terms of </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">impact and easiest in terms of implementation</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> get ranked as high priority. This is the low hanging fruit where you should start</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">. </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Medium priority scenarios should fil</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">l in the </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">rest of your roadmap </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">for the </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">next 12 – 18 months.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Roadmap example.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/167826iAFD417DBA7CFACD4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Roadmap example.PNG\" alt=\"Roadmap example\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Roadmap example</span></span></SPAN></P>\n<H3><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Define scenarios as solutions </SPAN></H3>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">With our scenarios identified, each traceable back to your stakeholders’ business priorities, we can begin designing the solutions that will enable them.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">There are different </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">scenario design approache</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">s that can be used</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">. As part of</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> the</SPAN> <A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/link/sharepoint-envisioning-workshop-concept/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">Envisioning Workshop Concept</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> presentation</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> available on the </SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/sharepointadoption\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">SharePoint Adoption Portal</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">, we have included a number of templates </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">that you can use </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">to facilitate the </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">design of your intelligent intranet scenarios. </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">T</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">he goal is to </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">have clear objectives, metrics, personas, and </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">the scenario experiences </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">defined </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">with</SPAN> <SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">the </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">SharePoint and Microsoft 365 components </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">identified </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">t</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">hat will </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">power these </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">experiences.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Solution definition.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/167827i9A0856900FDB5260/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Solution definition.PNG\" alt=\"Solution definition\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Solution definition</span></span></SPAN></P>\n<H3><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Build prototype</SPAN></H3>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">A</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> prototype will help you </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">further align with your stakeholders and get their buy-in. To ass</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">ist with your </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">prototyping</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">,</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> Microsoft recently </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">launched</SPAN> <SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">the </SPAN><A href=\"https://lookbook.microsoft.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">SharePoint look book</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">. </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">You will find all sorts of great SharePoint site templates that you can install directly </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">into your tenant as a starting point for your prototyping. </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Want to prototype an Intranet landing page</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">? T</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">here is a template for that. How about a leadership site</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">? W</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">ithin </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">f</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">ive or ten </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">minutes you can have a beautiful </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">leadership site example installed in your tenant to make your own. </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">These and many more </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">available </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">SharePoint site templates</SPAN> <SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">substantially accelerate the prototyping process.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SharePoint_lookbook_twitter-01.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/167829iEB3102D8B205F01E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"SharePoint_lookbook_twitter-01.jpg\" alt=\"SharePoint_lookbook_twitter-01.jpg\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H3><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Plan adoption</SPAN></H3>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Before you can launch your Intranet</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">,</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> you need to have an adoption plan to make sure you make employees aware </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">of the Intranet and </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">to </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">drive </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">regular engagement. </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">While there are some common adoption practices</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> for any new technology</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> to include in your </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Intranet launch </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">planning</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">, </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">make sure you add</SPAN> <SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">some </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Intranet specific </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">tac</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">tic</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">s. For example, why not use </SPAN><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/create-and-share-news-on-your-sharepoint-sites-495f8f1a-3bef-4045-b33a-55e5abe7aed7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">SharePoint News</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> to </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">kick off your Intranet awareness campaign. Be sure to </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">designate your Intranet </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">landing page </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">as </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">a </SPAN><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-home-sites-a-landing-for-your-organization-on-the/ba-p/621933\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">SharePoint </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">home site</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> so you can </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">take advantage of how it makes your Intranet much more </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">accessible to your employees</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">. This includes being featured </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">in the Office 365 suite navigation and a dedicated home button for one touch access to your Intranet </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">from</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> the SharePoint mobile app.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">V</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">isit the </SPAN><A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/resources/SharePoint-adoption/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">SharePoint adoption portal</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> and download the </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">adoption resources, including our SharePoint Adoption Playbook, project plan template, </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">awareness templates and training resources.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H3><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Measure and iterate </SPAN></H3>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Make sure you have your measurement framework in place so you can demonstrate the impact of the new intranet to leadership. Measuring key performance indicators, along with getting some qualitative feedback from your users, will also help you identify areas of your intranet that need to be refined over time. To help you define the right key performance indicators (KPI), answer these questions: </SPAN></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">What are the objectives of the solution? </SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">What metrics will be used to determine to what extent the solution is achieving its objectives? </SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">How will these metrics be measured?</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Measurement framework example.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/167831iAAAC418A064DB977/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Measurement framework example.PNG\" alt=\"Measurement framework example\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Measurement framework example</span></span></SPAN></P>\n<H3><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Best practices </SPAN></H3>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">To help you achieve success with your journey, consider the following best practices: </SPAN></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\"><STRONG>Run a pilot:</STRONG> Doing a dry run of your intranet organization-wide rollout, amongst a representative group of users, will help you prepare for the full scale launch. It will provide early insights, feedback and learnings that will help the project team bring that “WOW” factor to the full launch. </SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\"><STRONG>Identify and deliver a quick win:</STRONG> Intranet projects can have longer timelines due to the number of stakeholders involved. To help demonstrate early value, and provide confidence to your stakeholders, identify and deliver a quick win. This could be a leadership site, company news site, new hire site or a different use case that achieves your stakeholders objectives; whichever will address a critical business need, showcase what’s possible with the technology and is easy enough to implement rapidly. Leverage the <A href=\"https://lookbook.microsoft.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint look book</A> to accelerate your quick win project.</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<H3><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">IT as the success champion </SPAN></H3>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">IT has a key role to play for the value of an intelligent intranet to be realized in an organization. IT must evangelize the technology and inspire stakeholders with the art of the possible. Help your stakeholders connect their business priorities and challenges to the capabilities of the intelligent intranet. This is how the business value of the intelligent intranet gets unlocked for your organization. <BR /></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H3><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Next steps </SPAN></H3>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Microsoft has a number of resources and programs that can help you realize success throughout your intelligent intranet journey. Take advantage of all that we have to offer to help accelerate your project:</SPAN></P>\n<OL>\n<LI><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Attend one of the many <A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/events/intelligent-intranet-accelerator-workshop/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Intelligent Intranet Accelerator events</A> coming to a city near you. This half-day, interactive event will show you how to reinvent your intranet. </SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Utilize the envisioning resources and adoption materials available on our <A href=\"https://aka.ms/sharepointadoption\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint adoption portal</A>. </SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">Engage with <STRONG>Microsoft Services and the Intelligent Intranet Envisioning Workshop</STRONG> to accelerate your planning and design phase. Speak with your Microsoft account team to learn more. </SPAN></LI>\n</OL>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 05 Feb 2020 17:30:40 81","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/microsoft-365-amp-sharepoint-pnp-weekly-episode-81/ba-p/1343670","description":"<P><span /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\">In this weekly discussion of latest news and topics around<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN class=\"brand\">Microsoft 365</SPAN>, hosts –<WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://twitter.com/vesajuvonen\" target=\"_blank\">Vesa Juvonen</A><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>(Microsoft),<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://twitter.com/waldekm\" target=\"_blank\">Waldek Mastykarz</A><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>(Rencore), share their perspectives on how open-source projects and community initiatives can be successful.</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Why do some ideas get attention and others just languish?</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This discussion focuses on 5 tips for driving successful open-source programs.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Get the idea out of your own head</LI>\n<LI>Target the idea for the people who need it</LI>\n<LI>Rinse and repeat</LI>\n<LI>Building a team</LI>\n<LI class=\"\">It’s not about you, it’s about them</LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"\">Perhaps the ultimate success metric:&nbsp; A self-sustaining program.&nbsp; Successful programs include a strong community of contributors with varying talents, constant communications/reinforcement, well understood goals and objectives and a sincere Sharing is Caring mentality.</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>This episode was recorded on Monday, April 27, 2020.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blogs/microsoft-365-sharepoint-pnp-weekly-episode-81/\" target=\"_self\">Microsoft 365 &amp; SharePoint PnP Weekly – Episode 81</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><SPAN>Did we miss your article? Please use #PnPWeekly hashtag in the Twitter for letting us know the content which you have created.&nbsp;</SPAN></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 28 Apr 2020 12:31:34 +0000","feedId":13333,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187166iDBA3BD438399183D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"d89e55154c75633a71a8eec1dd367b71","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn97@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-30-442_f8ac678b78e502f7.webp","destWidth":998,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":303379,"destBytes":42006,"author":"Vesa Juvonen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187166iDBA3BD438399183D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn97@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-30-442_f8ac678b78e502f7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688824},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"“Designing your intranet” 🎙 The Intrazone podcast","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/designing-your-intranet-the-intrazone-podcast/ba-p/1153032","description":"<P>\n The intranet flattens at the speed of business. Organizations continuously pave two-way streets among well-informed, engaged employees. Agility and mobility bend and reform with change. And a site’s beauty lies in the eye of the beholder, filled with experiences unique and dynamic to each person.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In this episode, Chris and I chat with three intranet experts to unveil insights and best practices for planning, designing and implementing a new, beautiful, functional, engaging, personalized SharePoint-based intranet. We chat with \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/susanhanley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Sue Hanley\n  </STRONG>\n </A>, \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/melissa-torres-177b0814/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Melissa Torres\n  </STRONG>\n </A> and \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/matt-wolodarsky/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Matt Wolodarsky\n  </STRONG>\n </A> on subjects like information architecture and the new flat world of SharePoint sites structuring, design possibilities, how to scale roll out with both executive buy-in and end user adoption – plus insights into what’s next.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n OK, envision your future intranet, grab your favorite productivity-enhancing headphones … and … off to the show:\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/13025753/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TheIntrazone-iTunes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Subscribe to The Intrazone podcast\n  </STRONG>\n </A>\n <STRONG>\n  ! Of course, that depends.<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN class=\"brand\">Microsoft 365</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>provides many options. First understand and bridge the gap between what your staff can do (their knowledge) and what the service can do for you/them. Key focus areas for newbies?</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\">Learn how to write and secure an API, understand React and now React hooks, know your native coding tool –<WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>editor, know how to use search engines to find people and information efficiently, understand how to interact with a service you don’t own and finally, keep learning.</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\">As always, if you need help on an issue, want to share a discovery, or just want to say: “<EM>Job well done</EM>”, please reach out to Vesa, to Waldek or to your PnP Community.</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>This episode was recorded on Monday, May 11, 2020.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blogs/microsoft-365-sharepoint-pnp-weekly-episode-83/\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noreferrer\">Microsoft 365 &amp; SharePoint PnP Weekly – Episode 83</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>Did we miss your article? Please use #PnPWeekly hashtag in the Twitter for letting us know the content which you have created.&nbsp;</SPAN></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 20 May 2020 13:03:46 +0000","feedId":13333,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191321i45BE5234FBB99AEA/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"4bd7bb6f629da90b1451a9ddc10f7bfe","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn21@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-31-32-245_0ca1cef6e72f353f.webp","destWidth":998,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":318829,"destBytes":43862,"author":"Vesa Juvonen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191321i45BE5234FBB99AEA/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn21@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-31-32-245_0ca1cef6e72f353f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688820},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"Microsoft Lists – evolving the value of SharePoint lists and beyond","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/microsoft-lists-evolving-the-value-of-sharepoint-lists-and/ba-p/1400714","description":"<P>Today, we disclosed plans for <A href=\"https://aka.ms/MSLists/blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Lists</A> (blog with full details) during day one of Build 2020.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We want to share the news and highlight how the SharePoint lists you know, and love, evolve. The key takeaway… Lists are lists are Lists … Microsoft Lists is an evolutionary jolt to SharePoint lists and beyond.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Your lists just got a whole lot smarter</FONT></P>\n<P>Millions of SharePoint users have benefitted from using lists over the years. Microsoft Lists builds on this trusted information platform – bringing new user experiences and capabilities to the foundational innovation of SharePoint lists. Rest assured that all your lists, including lists that you have inside SharePoint sites today, will benefit from all the innovations described here. Lists are lists are lists. Additionally, the value of existing integrations with the Power Platform continue when you need to further customize list forms with <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/customize-list-form\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power Apps</A> and design robust workflows with <A href=\"https://preview.flow.microsoft.com/connectors/shared_sharepointonline/sharepoint/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power Automate</A>. And for developers, the power and value of the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/dev/sp-add-ins/working-with-lists-and-list-items-with-rest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Lists API</A> extends custom solutions to connect the list data as a source via <A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/graph/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Graph</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Take a <STRONG>first look at Microsoft Lists</STRONG>– product demo tour by&nbsp;<LI-USER uid=\"32817\"></LI-USER>&nbsp;– Lists program manager at Microsoft:&nbsp;</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/plshQSoe_OY\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/plshQSoe_OY/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Microsoft Lists encompasses SharePoint lists, a new Lists home page (web), lists in Microsoft Teams and the coming Lists mobile app. There is only one Lists product and we continue to move it forward.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Templates_ Event itinerary - in SP-team-site.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/193107i8E2FEBCE698A7995/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Templates_ Event itinerary - in SP-team-site.png\" alt=\"Microsoft Lists are stored in SharePoint sites and can be accessed from the new Lists home page, directly from the SharePoint team site (as shown here), or from within Microsoft Teams.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft Lists are stored in SharePoint sites and can be accessed from the new Lists home page, directly from the SharePoint team site (as shown here), or from within Microsoft Teams.</span></span></P>\n<P>Microsoft Lists is a Microsoft 365 app that helps you track information and organize work. List are simple, smart, and flexible, so you can stay on top of what matters most to your team. Track issues, assets, routines, contacts, inventory and more using customizable views and smart rules and alerts to keep everyone in sync. With ready-made templates, you can quickly start lists online, on our new mobile app, or with Microsoft Teams. And because it is part of Microsoft 365, you can rely on enterprise-ready security and compliance.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Podcast</STRONG> | Join&nbsp;<LI-USER uid=\"32817\"></LI-USER>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<LI-USER uid=\"3771\"></LI-USER>&nbsp;as they sit down with me and&nbsp;<LI-USER uid=\"98\"></LI-USER>&nbsp;on The Intrazone at Build 2020 to share their first thoughts on Microsoft Lists. Enjoy the “Make a list and check it twice” episode:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/14441228/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"MSLists_M365_008_Views_Gallery.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192875i7A8BB6F9B2FA8C1B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"MSLists_M365_008_Views_Gallery.jpg\" alt=\"A list showing &quot;Gallery&quot; view - each card represents a row of data.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">A list showing \"Gallery\" view - each card represents a row of data.</span></span></P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Note</STRONG> | If you have classic SharePoint lists in Microsoft 365 today, Microsoft continues to support them today and into the foreseeable future be that they were built for legacy applications or have custom-built extensions - they will continue to work. And when you choose to move them from classic to modern – they then not only “get modern,” – they will get all the value and innovation Microsoft Lists brings.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We cannot wait to share more details and documentation when we begin roll out later this summer, and the Lists mobile app coming later this year.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Resources to learn more about Microsoft offers much in the way of connectivity. And during crisis, when change is significant, the modern workplace supports your arrival on your digital and physical doorstep. What was once digital transformation on the horizon – is here. The adjustment is real. And it’s important to stay productive and connected.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In this episode, we talk to \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexbradley/\" target=\"_self\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Alex Bradley\n  </STRONG>\n </A> - senior product marketing manager and teamwork narrative lead focused on all things \n <A href=\"http://modernworkplace.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Modern Workplace\n </A>. From virus outbreaks like COVID-19 to unexpected weather emergencies, our focus goes to the importance of establishing open the lines of communication and information flow. In this episode, Chris and I highlight three solutions - across Microsoft Teams, SharePoint and Power Apps - that help everyone stay briefed on the situation and any business impacts. Through crisis management and good planning, technology can help business continuity in the move to more and more remote working.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n OK, grab your favorite set of headphones to not disturb others in your space, and off to the show:\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/13671824/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In this episode of The Intrazone, Chris and I dig into these three solutions:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Microsoft Teams \n  </STRONG>to \n  <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/03/10/staying-productive-while-working-remotely-with-microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   stay productive while working remotely\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   SharePoint \n  </STRONG>to \n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/build-a-crisis-management-site-to-connect-people-and-information/ba-p/1216791\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   build a crisis management site to connect people and information\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Power Apps \n  </STRONG>to \n  <A href=\"https://powerapps.microsoft.com/blog/crisis-communication-a-power-platform-template/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   promote crisis communication [a Power Platform template]\n  </A>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TheIntrazone-iTunes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Subscribe to The Intrazone podcast\n  </STRONG>\n </A>\n <STRONG>\n  ! @WHO\n    </A>.\n   </LI> \n   <LI>\n    Plus a few related&nbsp;\n    <U>\n     ‘how to build SharePoint sites’ videos\n    </U>:\n   </LI> \n   <LI>\n    <A
