And hey, that means more refinement and release of SharePoint and related tech features and updates. Within this extra time, our engineering teams have opened up Mover worldwide, pushed out a new Live Events support program, added the SharePoint admin global reader role, unblocked desktop OneNote files from moving to the cloud, brought more of the Power Platform to the government cloud, and more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Consider this the all-inclusive, end-of-month release recap, plus an embedded audible companion: <STRONG>Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop: February 2020</STRONG> podcast episode – all to help answer, \"What's rolling out now for SharePoint and related technologies into Microsoft 365?\"</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To answer that question, <A href=\"http://intrazone.mpsn.libsynpro.com/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-february-2020\" target=\"_self\">listen</A> and scroll below (info, links and screenshots galore) to stay informed on what features and updates arrived this past month - plus a few teasers of what's to come next month:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/13336685/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In the podcast episode, I interview <STRONG>Chakkaradeep (Chaks) Chinnakonda Chandran </STRONG>(<A href=\"https://twitter.com/chakkaradeep\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A> | <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/chakkaradeep/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">LinkedIn</A>), a senior program manager at Microsoft. Recently, he and team completed the additional compliance work to enable Power Apps and Power Automate for our government cloud customers; a capability our commercial customers have been using for a number of months now. We chat both about the scenarios this unlocks, plus the process of moving a feature through to the various Microsoft 365 customer offerings.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_001_Chaks.jpg\" style=\"width: 317px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/173999i828222AA02BF35D6/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_001_Chaks.jpg\" alt=\"Chakkaradeep (Chaks) Chinnakonda Chandran, senior program manager (SharePoint/Microsoft) [Intrazone guest]\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Chakkaradeep (Chaks) Chinnakonda Chandran, senior program manager (SharePoint/Microsoft) [Intrazone guest]</span></span></P>\n<P>We also want to put out a round of “Happy Birthday” to any and all Leapsters out there celebrating February 29, 2020. :birthday_cake:</img></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>All features listed below began rolling out to Targeted Release customers in Office 365 as of February 2020 (possibly early March 2020).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Inform and engage with dynamic employee experiences</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Build your modern intranet on SharePoint in Office 365 and get the benefits of investing in business outcomes – reducing IT and development costs, increasing business speed and agility, and up-leveling the dynamic and welcoming nature of your intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Mover migration now available worldwide</STRONG></P>\n<P>Since Microsoft announced the acquisition of Mover, our migration specialists have been working hard to bring the migration service, including admin-led and self-service offerings, to more customers as demand to move content to the cloud continues to grow.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_002_Mover-WW.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174000i5EED9474AF0E05A9/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_002_Mover-WW.jpg\" alt=\"Start your cloud migrations with Mover today: Mover.io.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Start your cloud migrations with Mover today: Mover.io.</span></span></P>\n<P>Mover helps make it easier than ever for customers to migrate files to Microsoft 365 – for <U>free</U>. Mover supports migration from over a dozen cloud service providers – including Box, Dropbox, Egnyte, and Google Drive – into OneDrive and SharePoint, enabling seamless file collaboration across Microsoft 365 apps and services, including the Office apps and Microsoft Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Note, this is not yet for government cloud customers.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=61190\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID: 61190</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/mover-migration-now-available-worldwide/ba-p/1185228\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft 365 Live Events Assistance Program Public Preview is now available</STRONG></P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 is launching the public preview of a&nbsp;<A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/live-events/assistance\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">new support service</A>&nbsp;for customers to help deliver&nbsp;<A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/live-events/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">live events using Teams, Stream or Yammer</A>. The new program provides assistance to help customers better understand functionality, and assist with the setup and delivery of live event broadcasts - to help you get more familiar with setting up and running a live event or even be available during your live event to help if any questions or issues come up.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_003_Live-Events-support.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174001i6681CCA91852606A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_003_Live-Events-support.jpg\" alt=\"A Microsoft Live Event during broadcast, showing the live video feed on the left, Q&amp;A on the right-hand side.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">A Microsoft Live Event during broadcast, showing the live video feed on the left, Q&amp;A on the right-hand side.</span></span></P>\n<P>During preview, the assistance program is free to customers using Teams, Stream or Yammer to deliver their events.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/live-events/assistance\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more and get started</A>!</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Global reader experience is now available in new SharePoint admin center</STRONG></P>\n<P>Users who are assigned this role will have read-only access to all info and settings in the new SharePoint admin center. This feature is related to the global admin role introduced in September 2019 about support throughout all workloads in Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Global reader is the read-only counterpart to the global admin role to help reduce the number of global admins in your organization. To use the program, Assign the global reader role instead of the global admin role to users who need to view all your organization’s settings but not edit them. For example, to plan, audit, or investigate. Use this and other role assignment to best delegate administration to who can do what and what they are able to do.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We're gradually rolling this out to commercial clouds now, and government clouds in early March 2020.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=59984\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 59984</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/users-groups-roles/directory-assign-admin-roles\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Updating the sharing page in SharePoint admin center </STRONG></P>\n<P>We’ve brought all the sharing settings from the classic sharing page, making it now apear on the modern sharing page in the SharePoint admin center. This makes it easier to set up and configure external sharing for OneDrive and SharePoint. Key settings include the ability to configure who is allowed to share externally as well as default link permissions for your organization. You can, however, further restrict sharing for each individual site and individual people's OneDrive.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_004_SP-admin-center-Sharing.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174002i67876E97D89D1985/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_004_SP-admin-center-Sharing.jpg\" alt=\"The full-featured Sharing administration page now appears within the new SharePoint admin center.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The full-featured Sharing administration page now appears within the new SharePoint admin center.</span></span></P>\n<P>The full-featured Sharing administration page now appears within the new SharePoint admin center.</P>\n<P>Note: Should you need to visit the classic sharing page, you can switch the SharePoint admin center back to classic view.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=61116\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 61116</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/turn-external-sharing-on-or-off\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Teamwork updates across SharePoint team sites, OneDrive and Microsoft Teams</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 is designed to be a universal toolkit for teamwork – to give you the right tools for the right task, along with common services to help you seamlessly work across applications. SharePoint is the intelligent content service that powers teamwork – to better collaborate on proposals, projects, and campaigns throughout your organization – and is integrated with Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Yammer, Stream, Planner and much more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Updating classic SharePoint team site home pages to the modern template</STRONG></P>\n<P>With this update, classic SharePoint team site home pages that have <U>not</U> been customized will be automatically updated to a modern home page template. If your site contains&nbsp;only out-of-the box default web parts&nbsp;such as getting started, document library, and newsfeed - it will get updated.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The new home page for your team site makes it easier to post news and to use the site on mobile devices. End users will see a&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/guide-to-sharepoint-modern-experience\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">modern home page</A>&nbsp;on their first visit after this feature rolls out. On that first visit, SharePoint will walk people through the new capabilities.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_005_Classic-to-modern_team-site-homepage.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174003i333D3977A8452246/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_005_Classic-to-modern_team-site-homepage.jpg\" alt=\"Left-to-right: a classic SharePoint team site homepage. automatically modernized with content intact and additional modern web parts appear.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Left-to-right: a classic SharePoint team site homepage. automatically modernized with content intact and additional modern web parts appear.</span></span></P>\n<P>Classic team sites that contain customized content will not be automatically updated. Note: this update does not create an Office 365 Group for the team site, which would happen with the creation of a modern team site in SharePoint.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Site collection admins or site owners can&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/new-sharepoint-team-home-page-77cbbd3c-2a23-4a76-bfd7-c5bf95afe1c6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">choose to revert to their previous classic home page</A>. If you do nothing, your classic SharePoint team site home pages that contain only out-of-the box default web parts will automatically be updated to the modern home page template. You may also choose to&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/dev/transform/modernize-userinterface-site-pages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">upgrade other home pages that weren’t part of the automatic modernization</A>. If you would like to&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/disable-auto-modernization-classic-home-pages#why-update-classic-team-site-home-pages-to-modern\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">disable this upgrade on specific sites</A>, you may do so by using a&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/sharepoint/sharepoint-pnp/sharepoint-pnp-cmdlets\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Patterns and Practices (PnP) PowerShell</A>&nbsp;cmdlet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Learn more</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/disable-auto-modernization-classic-home-pages#why-update-classic-team-site-home-pages-to-modern\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Classic home page modernization</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/create-and-use-modern-pages-on-a-sharepoint-site-b3d46deb-27a6-4b1e-87b8-df851e503dec\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Create and use modern pages on a SharePoint site</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/dev/transform/modernize-scanner\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Find the sites on your tenant that will be affected by this change&nbsp;</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/new-sharepoint-team-home-page-77cbbd3c-2a23-4a76-bfd7-c5bf95afe1c6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The new SharePoint team home page</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?rtc=3&amp;filters=&amp;searchterms=60405\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 60405</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Per-Site Sharing Links can now default to people with existing access</STRONG></P>\n<P>SharePoint administrators can set the <U>per-site sharing links default</U> to the \"<U>people with existing access</U>\" setting. Prior to this change, SharePoint Administrators could choose either \"Anyone\", \"People in my organization\", or \"Specific People\" when setting the default sharing link on a per-site basis.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_006_Per-site_link-share-default.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174005iE02ECA30B8388150/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_006_Per-site_link-share-default.jpg\" alt=\"When a person clicks on the Share button to share a document, the preferred default will first appear. In this case, “People with existing access”\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">When a person clicks on the Share button to share a document, the preferred default will first appear. In this case, “People with existing access”</span></span></P>\n<P>Once set, users who click on the Share button or Copy Link will receive an existing access link that does not change the permissions on the item. Additional link types are still available in Link Settings if needed, and this update does not change any existing default settings. This feature is initially configurable via PowerShell but will be customizable in the modern SharePoint Admin Center in the future.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=60335\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 60335</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/change-default-sharing-link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SharePoint Integrations with Power Automate and Power Apps to GCC Tenants</STRONG></P>\n<P>For government customers that fall into the \"maker\" persona, this update enables you to create and manage custom workflows with Power Automate and custom forms with Power Apps combined with both SharePoint lists and libraries.</P>\n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorMark Kashman_6\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_007_SP-lists_plus_PowerApps.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174006i3E6F34A7FA0ED0FA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_007_SP-lists_plus_PowerApps.jpg\" alt=\"Customize a SharePoint list form by using Power Apps.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Customize a SharePoint list form by using Power Apps.</span></span></P>\n<P>We're excited to push this one out beyond the commercial clouds, into more maker hands.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=33770\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID:&nbsp;33770</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/business-applications-process/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Related technology</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Office app is available for Android and iOS</STRONG></P>\n<P>If you installed the public preview of the Office app or the Office Mobile app (exclusive to Samsung mobile devices), you will receive an automatic update. The new Office app has all the capabilities of the existing Word, Excel, and PowerPoint apps and requires significantly less phone storage than installing all three apps.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/untLDcPPdsw\" align=\"center\" size=\"medium\" width=\"400\" height=\"225\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/untLDcPPdsw/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>It integrates Office Lens technology for converting images into editable Word and Excel documents and scanning whiteboards. It has an Actions pane for common mobile tasks such as creating and signing PDFs or transferring files between devices; and it adds Sticky Notes for capturing ideas on the go.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We will continue to support and invest in the standalone Word, Excel, and PowerPoint apps for customers who wish to continue to use them. Installing the Office app will not affect existing installations of Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Office app for Android: <A href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.office.officehubrow\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Google Play Store</A>&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>Office app for iPhones:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://apps.apple.com/app/microsoft-office/id541164041\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">App Store</A>&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/blog/2020/02/19/new-office-app-android-ios-available/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>OneDrive - <STRONG>Support for migrating OneNote via KFM (aka Known Folder Move)</STRONG></P>\n<P>One of the most awaited features is finally here! You now have agility to migrate local OneNote notebooks to OneDrive via PC folder backup (aka, Known Folder Move (KFM)). OneNote’s will now be automatically backed up as a part of the PC Folder Backup move.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_008_OneDrive-KFM-OneNote.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174007iAC8550C3CDDB8C8B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_008_OneDrive-KFM-OneNote.jpg\" alt=\"The Known Folder Move option, aka &quot;PC folder backup&quot; can now help migrate OneNote files from your desktop.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The Known Folder Move option, aka \"PC folder backup\" can now help migrate OneNote files from your desktop.</span></span></P>\n<P>That's it. It's that simple. No more \"OneNote cannot be moved\" errors. And a OneNote notebook off your desktop and in the cloud is like a breath of fresh air… truly.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=49421\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 49421</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Last, a bit of <STRONG><U>Microsoft Office</U> humor thanks to a recent The Verge</STRONG> article referencing a recent democratic debate…</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>At one of the Democratic debates, Sen. Elizabeth Warren described Pete Buttigieg's healthcare plan as, \"just a PowerPoint.” In reply, Buttigieg responded by saying “I’m more of a Microsoft Word guy.”</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This spawned a satirical article by the Verge, where if Pete claimed Word, then:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Elizabeth Warren = Excel</LI>\n<LI>Amy Klobuchar = PowerPoint</LI>\n<LI>Michael Bloomberg = Outlook</LI>\n<LI>Bernie Sanders = Teams</LI>\n<LI>and Joe Biden = OneDrive</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Fun to see their satirical reasoning and laugh a little, \"<A href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/19/21144949/democratic-debate-microsoft-office-word-bernie-sanders-bloomberg-elizabeth-warren-candidates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Which Microsoft Office product is each Democratic presidential candidate?</A>\" Which Office product are you? [I’m SharePoint ;)</img>]</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>March 2020 teasers</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Psst, still here? Still scrolling the page looking for the rolled out goodness? If so, here’s a few teasers of what’s to come to production next month…</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Teaser #1: <STRONG>Dark mode – OneDrive mobile app for Android </STRONG>[a top request on&nbsp;<A href=\"https://onedrive.uservoice.com/forums/913516-onedrive-on-android/suggestions/8541496-dark-theme-black-background\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A>]&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>Teaser #2: <STRONG>Multi-lingual publishing</STRONG> [Roadmap&nbsp;ID&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=50217\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">50217</A>]; pitstop exclusive: enroll right&nbsp;<A href=\"https://play.google.com/apps/testing/com.microsoft.skydrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>; an FYI from friend-of-the-show, Ryan Hoge <A href=\"https://onedrive.uservoice.com/forums/913516-onedrive-on-android/suggestions/8541496-dark-theme-black-background\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">via UserVoice</A> + <A href=\"https://twitter.com/onedrive/status/1227208006942810113\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@OneDrive tweet</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>… shhh, tell everyone.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Helpful, ongoing change management resources </STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>\"<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/office365/admin/manage/stay-on-top-of-updates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Stay on top of Office 365 changes</A>\"</LI>\n<LI>\"<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/office365/admin/manage/message-center\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Message center in Office 365</A>\"</LI>\n<UL>\n<LI>Install the <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=627216\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 admin app</A>; view Message Center posts and stay current with push notifications.</LI>\n</UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365 public roadmap</A> <SPAN>+ pre-filtered URL for </SPAN><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?ms.url=roadmap&amp;rtc=1&amp;filters=Rolling%20Out%2CLaunched%2CIn%20Development%2CYammer%2CSharePoint%2CMicrosoft%20Stream%2COneDrive%20for%20Business\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer and Stream roadmap items</A><SPAN>.</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>SharePoint</STRONG> <A href=\"https://www.facebook.com/MSSharePoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facebook</A> | <A href=\"https://twitter.com/SharePoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A> | <A href=\"http://office.com/sharepoint/community\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Community Blog</A> | <A href=\"https://sharepoint.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>OneDrive</STRONG> <A href=\"https://www.facebook.com/OneDrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facebook</A> | <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/onedrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A> | <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SharePoint/blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">OneDrive Community Blog</A> | <A href=\"https://onedrive.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI>Follow me to catch <STRONG>news and interesting SharePoint things</STRONG>: <A href=\"https://twitter.com/mkashman\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@mkashman</A>; pre-warning of occasional bad puns, too.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Thanks for tuning in and/or reading this episode/blog of the <STRONG>Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop – February 2020 </STRONG>(<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-february-2020/ba-p/1199934\" target=\"_self\">blog</A>/<A href=\"http://intrazone.mpsn.libsynpro.com/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-february-2020\" target=\"_self\">podcast</A>). We’re open to your feedback in comments below to hear how both the Roadmap Pitstop podcast episodes and blogs can be improved over time.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Engage with us. Ask questions. Push us where you want and need to get the best information and insights. We're here to put both <STRONG>our and your</STRONG> best change management foot forward.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Stay safe out there on the road’map, and thanks for listening and reading.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Cheers and thanks,</P>\n<P>Mark Kashman – senior product manager (SharePoint/OneDrive | Microsoft)</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_009_Hero-feature-timeline.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174008i903EBAC6840FE86D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_009_Hero-feature-timeline.jpg\" alt=\"The Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop - February 2020 graphic showing some of the highlighted features released in February 2020.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop - February 2020 graphic showing some of the highlighted features released in February 2020.</span></span></P>\n<P>And if you made it this far, a little historical nugget about the first project Chaks and I worked on, to highlight the value of the classic SharePoint publishing capabilities – before there was modern. Chaks and his company at the time (Intergen) helped create an awesome SharePoint Server 2010 Fabrikam portal demo that we made available to all our Microsoft field and partners to demo this capability to our customers both on-premises and online; long before Contoso was a Microsoft customer. ;)</img> Kudos to Chaks’ work then, and certainly to the work he does now to contribute to the value and flexibility of productivity apps:</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP_Feb-2020_010_Fabrikam-portal.jpg\" style=\"width: 579px;\"><img _63b8c2862dc8d0d6.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174009i53062298D36C29E2/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn33@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-31-43-572_d5f7f053d1ef1ef1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688830},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 podcast","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/an-api-for-teamwork-all-about-microsoft-teams-as-a-platform-on/ba-p/1179830","description":"<P>\n Configure and extend – that’s the productivity metaOS mantra of Microsoft Teams as a platform. And it echoes through every bot, tab and connector you can dream up and build for your team.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In this episode, Chris and I uncover the power and capabilities of Microsoft teams as a platform. We chat with two experts inside and outside of Microsoft. First, we hear about the design and strategy of how to extend Teams at the scale of the worldwide Microsoft 365 customer base from \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/williamjbliss\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Bill Bliss\n </A>, platform architect for Microsoft Teams engineering. We then turn to the real-world approach of one of our strong Microsoft MVP developers in this space, \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/wictorw\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Wictor Wilén\n </A> (Global innovation lead, Avanade). Wictor shares how he develops teamwork solutions for his company and their vast customer base. You’ll hear all about bots, tabs and connectors – the basis of the \n <EM>\n  what\n </EM> and \n <EM>\n  how\n </EM> to approach extending the Microsoft Teams platform offering.\n</P> \n<P>\n continues to spotlight \n <STRONG>\n  Microsoft partners\n </STRONG>, the people and companies who deliver solutions and services to empower our customers to achieve more.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In our second partner episode, we talk with \n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/zoe-wilson-uk/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Zoe Wilson\n  </A> \n </STRONG>(Head of Microsoft 365 Content and Collaboration),\n <STRONG> \n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ruben-hugo-349759a/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Ruben Hugo\n  </A> \n </STRONG>(Office 365 Solution Architect), and\n <STRONG> \n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/luke365/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Luke Evans\n  </A> \n </STRONG>(Office 365 / SharePoint Architect) – all from Agilisys, a UK partner focusing on the public sector’s IT and digital transformation, putting people and strategy before technology. They blend consultancy and advisory to address each customer’s strategic priorities before helping them harness the best technologies to meet their desired goals.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n We talk with them about Project Cortex, what they are hearing most from their customers, and about their favorite Microsoft Ignite 2019 announcements. Plus, we ask a few personal questions – to discover the people behind the partnership.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n OK, Partner (edition), on with the show…\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n partner episode on Agilisys now\n  </A>\n </STRONG> + show links and more below.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" title=\"clipboard_image_0.jpeg\" alt=\"Left-to-right: Ruben Hugo - Office 365 Solution Architect, Agilisys logo, Luke Evans - Office 365 / SharePoint Architect, and Zoe Wilson – Head of Microsoft 365 Content and Collaboration; all from Agilisys [The Intrazone guests]\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Left-to-right: Ruben Hugo - Office 365 Solution Architect, Agilisys logo, Luke Evans - Office 365 / SharePoint Architect, and Zoe Wilson – Head of Microsoft 365 Content and Collaboration; all from Agilisys [The Intrazone guests]</span></span>\n</P> We, too, welcome your ideas for future episodes topics and segments. Keep the discussion going in comments below; we’re hear to listen and grow.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TheIntrazone-iTunes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Subscribe to The Intrazone podcast\n  </STRONG>\n </A>\n <STRONG>\n  ! \n </STRONG>\n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"http://intrazone.mpsn.libsynpro.com/partner-edition-agilisys\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   And listen this partner episode on Agilisys now\n  </A>\n </STRONG>\n <STRONG>\n  .\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<H1>\n Thanks for listening!\n</H1> \n<P>\n The SharePoint team wants you to unleash your creativity and productivity. href=\"https://radiopublic.com/the-intrazone-by-microsoft-sharep-WwEJDa\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   RadioPublic\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://www.iheart.com/podcast/263-the-intrazone-by-microsoft-30311241/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   iHeart\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"http://intrazone.mpsn.libsynpro.com/rss\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   RSS\n  </A>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/160900i2A2652521DCDCB07/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" alt=\"The Intrazone, a show about the Microsoft 365 intelligent intranet. [aka.ms/TheIntrazone]\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The Intrazone, a show about the Microsoft 365 intelligent intranet. [aka.ms/TheIntrazone]</span></span>\n</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 10 Dec 2019 19:51:00 +0000","feedId":13333,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/160901iA9124D48DFCE532E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"07436a766340398b7dba2d9de22b646d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn33@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-30-932_b989519a055bb6c6.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":335,"sourceBytes":34429,"destBytes":21460,"author":"Mark Kashman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/160901iA9124D48DFCE532E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn33@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-30-932_b989519a055bb6c6.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/160900i2A2652521DCDCB07/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn97@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-31-37-609_2e106e012210eef6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688847},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"SharePoint Roadmap Pitstop: June 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-june-2020/ba-p/1498777","description":"<P>Hello, June. Good bye, June. Nice to know ya, June… oh, how you flew by! And what nice tech treats you left for us in SharePoint and related tech land…</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>June 2020 brought a lot - 100GB file uploads, Microsoft Search: Acronym Answers, site analytics updates, Quick Edit updates for lists and libraries, a new default teal site theme, sharing links to block downloads of PDFs, images and audio, and more. Details &amp; screenshots below, including our audible companion: <STRONG>The</STRONG> <STRONG>Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop: June 2020</STRONG> podcast episode – all to help answer, \"What's rolling out now for SharePoint and related technologies into Microsoft 365?\"</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15019373/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In the podcast episode, I chat with <STRONG>Cathy Dew </STRONG>(<A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/cathyowendew/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">LinkedIn</A> | <A href=\"https://twitter.com/catpaint1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A>), senior program manager at Microsoft who works on all things Teal and Fluent. Cathy is a design expert managing user experiences across the whole of SharePoint - most recently aligning with and adopting to the <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/design/fluent/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Fluent Design System</A>, providing consistency throughout - and this month, one main update can be categorized by the phrase \"from Blue to Teal.”</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_001_Cathy-Dew.jpg\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202171i80C5D34B92F1C4ED/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_001_Cathy-Dew.jpg\" alt=\"Cathy Dew, senior program manager (SharePoint/Microsoft) [Intrazone guest]\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Cathy Dew, senior program manager (SharePoint/Microsoft) [Intrazone guest]</span></span></P>\n<P>All features listed below began rolling out to Targeted Release customers in Microsoft 365 as of June 2020 (possibly early July 2020).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Inform and engage with dynamic employee experiences</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Build your intelligent intranet on SharePoint in Microsoft 365 and get the benefits of investing in business outcomes – reducing IT and development costs, increasing business speed and agility, and up-leveling the dynamic, personalized and welcoming nature of your intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft 365 now supports up to 100 GB file sizes, per file, into OneDrive, SharePoint and Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>The funnel into Microsoft 365 grows… We're increasing the max file Size from 15GB to 100GB for individual files. For best performance, we recommend uploading very large files using OneDrive sync – especially *differential sync* when actively working with large files. And it, too, applies to content migration scenarios.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_002_100GB.jpg\" style=\"width: 998px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202172iE9B0F674B7CDB40C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_002_100GB.jpg\" alt=\"Microsoft 365 now supports upload of files up to 100GB - applicable to OneDrive, SharePoint and Microsoft Teams.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft 365 now supports upload of files up to 100GB - applicable to OneDrive, SharePoint and Microsoft Teams.</span></span></P>\n<P>Microsoft has a continuous focus on overall performance throughout the lifecycle of a file – from upload, to download, to use and edit. The end result being productivity enhancement and protection on more files in your organization, even the big ones, by getting them into Microsoft 365 – now with fewer size limitations.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;featureid=49368\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">49368</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/office/invalid-file-names-and-file-types-in-onedrive-and-sharepoint-64883a5d-228e-48f5-b3d2-eb39e07630fa?ui#individualfilesize\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>Acronym answers are now available with Microsoft Search in SharePoint</STRONG></P>\n<P>Users often run into unfamiliar acronyms and abbreviations used by their organization or team. Terms that are specific to organizations or teams might be new to people who move from one team to another, those who work with internal partner teams, or are new to the organization.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Acronym Answers allows Search administrators and editors to create definitions for commonly used acronyms to help people discover their meaning – be them new or unfamiliar.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_003_MSSearch-acronyms.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202173iEB77B37BCBFABB5C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_003_MSSearch-acronyms.jpg\" alt=\"Search administrators can set up editorial acronyms on the Acronyms tab in the Microsoft Search admin center. You can add acronyms from any internal site or repository to the admin center.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Search administrators can set up editorial acronyms on the Acronyms tab in the Microsoft Search admin center. You can add acronyms from any internal site or repository to the admin center.</span></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Microsoft 365&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64865\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 64865</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Learn&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftsearch/manage-acronyms\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">how to manage Acronyms answers in Microsoft Search</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>You can now enable the communication site experience for classic SharePoint team sites</STRONG></P>\n<P>This optional feature allows SharePoint admins and site owners to enable the modern communication site experience on any&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/modernize-classic-team-site\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">classic team site that meets the requirements</A>, including&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/modern-root-site\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the root site</A>.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>A SharePoint communication site is a great tool for sharing information with others in your organization. And now, classic team sites can enjoy the benefits of modern communication sites - a modern home page, full-width pages with horizontal navigation, and improved capabilities to share news, reports, statuses, and other information in a more visually compelling way.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_004_PowerShell_classic-to-comm.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202174iD656445E14B453AA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_004_PowerShell_classic-to-comm.gif\" alt=\"Demo showing how to enable the communication site experience for a classic SharePoint team site.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Demo showing how to enable the communication site experience for a classic SharePoint team site.</span></span></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_004_PowerShell_classic-to-comm.jpg\" style=\"width: 320px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202175i2CB6C8BE0A643223/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_004_PowerShell_classic-to-comm.jpg\" alt=\"Sample PowerShell script using the SPOCommSite cmdlet.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Sample PowerShell script using the SPOCommSite cmdlet.</span></span></P>\n<P>SharePoint admins or site owners must run the \"<STRONG>Enable-SPOCommSite</STRONG>\" PowerShell cmdlet. And note: this action does not change any site permissions or remove any content, nor does it create a new Microsoft 365 Groups membership.&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=46338\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 46338</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/modernize-classic-team-site\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn how to run the PowerShell cmdlet</A>.&nbsp;&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Learn more:</STRONG>\n<UL>\n<LI>For admins:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/modernize-classic-team-site\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Modernize classic team site</A>&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>For end users:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/what-is-a-sharepoint-communication-site-94a33429-e580-45c3-a090-5512a8070732\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">What is a communication site?</A></LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>Site analytics - average time people spend on any given site</STRONG></P>\n<P>We are adding a new report on the SharePoint <STRONG>site usage page</STRONG>, that details the average time spent per user. Each site has this dedicated analytics page. You'll see a trend line for the time people spend on site pages and news posts for 7-day and 30-day periods. The average metric is calculated by comparing the total time spent on that page with the number of the unique visitors on that page in the given timeframe.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_005_Site-analytics_time-spent.jpg\" style=\"width: 525px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202179i3DD64FB8DEF71288/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_005_Site-analytics_time-spent.jpg\" alt=\"In this example, the report shows that the average user spent 6 minutes and 45 seconds actively engaged with the site during a 7-day period. This is a 40% decrease from the prior 7-day period.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">In this example, the report shows that the average user spent 6 minutes and 45 seconds actively engaged with the site during a 7-day period. This is a 40% decrease from the prior 7-day period.</span></span></P>\n<P>Note: the report does not yet include time on lists, in documents, site admin pages, or when pages are viewed via mobile.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=57159\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 57159</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/view-usage-data-for-your-sharepoint-site-2fa8ddc2-c4b3-4268-8d26-a772dc55779e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Review how site owners can view usage data</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>Site analytics - cumulative analytics for SharePoint hub sites</STRONG></P>\n<P>SharePoint hub sites make it easy to organize information and collaboration based on project, department, division, or region. This report provides site owners and members cumulative insights to unique viewers, total visits, top sites, and most popular content - for all sites that are part of the hub site.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_006_Site-analytics_Hub-site-cumulative.jpg\" style=\"width: 270px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202180i6A935B6954A0E9FA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_006_Site-analytics_Hub-site-cumulative.jpg\" alt=\"Choose to see the cumulative hub usage data for all sites within the hub or solely the usage data of the hub site itself.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Choose to see the cumulative hub usage data for all sites within the hub or solely the usage data of the hub site itself.</span></span></P>\n<P>To view these reports, site owners or members need to go to the hub site and select&nbsp;<EM>Site usage data</EM>. By default, you will see analytics for all sites in the hub. It is possible to view data only for the hub site itself.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=57160\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 57160</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/view-usage-data-for-your-sharepoint-site-2fa8ddc2-c4b3-4268-8d26-a772dc55779e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Review how site owners can view usage data</A>&nbsp;</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Consolidated page for Migration in the SharePoint admin center (Microsoft 365)</STRONG></P>\n<P>This is essentially a new Migration landing page within the SharePoint admin center. It has everything you need no matter where your content is coming from. It is your one-stop shop for all things files and content into SharePoint, OneDrive and Microsoft Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_007_Migration-page-in-SP-admin.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202181i082CF75039C75659/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_007_Migration-page-in-SP-admin.jpg\" alt=\"The new, consolidated page for Migration in the SharePoint admin center (Microsoft 365).\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The new, consolidated page for Migration in the SharePoint admin center (Microsoft 365).</span></span></P>\n<P>Click on \"Migration\" to see all - Migration Manager for scaling file share migrations, plus links out to SharePoint Migration Tool for migrating from on-premises SharePoint Server, and Mover for cloud-to-cloud migrations - all on one page instead of separate tabs; consider this the Migration center for all things file shares and SharePoint into Microsoft 365 – moving content into OneDrive, SharePoint and Microsoft Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Updating the default SharePoint site theme from blue to teal</STRONG></P>\n<P>Old SharePoint logo and color scheme - blue. The new SharePoint – icon and theme – is teal. We’re updating the default site theme to match the SharePoint timeline. SharePoint will automatically update new and existing communication sites and team sites with a new teal site theme. Group-connected team sites, and sites that have been customized, will not be impacted.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_008_blue-to-Teal.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202182iEC6303F968A3BB49/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_008_blue-to-Teal.jpg\" alt=\"SharePoint communication site with the new Teal site theme.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">SharePoint communication site with the new Teal site theme.</span></span></P>\n<P>The new teal theme can be changed to the former blue theme at any time in the&nbsp;<EM>Change the look</EM>&nbsp;panel. If site owners want to keep the current blue theme - or simply want to change the theme -&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/Change-the-look-of-your-SharePoint-site-06bbadc3-6b04-4a60-9d14-894f6a170818\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">they can edit the theme in the Change the look panel</A>. This change can be made at any time, and each site will require a manual change.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=60592\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 60592</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/updates-to-sharepoint-default-site-themes-coming-june-2020/ba-p/1387867\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft uses the Fluent design system to ensure a cohesive and accessible design</STRONG></P>\n<P>Beyond teal… Fluent has been applied to more of the SharePoint user interface resulting in some visual changes. You will notice larger and bolder typefaces, increased opacity for drop shadows, and rounded corners for square graphical elements.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_009_Fluent.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202183iC145419D82EC5D48/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_009_Fluent.jpg\" alt=\"The broader anatomy of Microsoft UI components.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The broader anatomy of Microsoft UI components.</span></span></P>\n<P>Fluent is about SharePoint designers and developers working better together to create best-in-class experiences that empower your productivity throughout your intelligent intranet.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=63777\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 63777</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Learn more about&nbsp;Microsoft’s&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/design/fluent/#/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Fluent design system</A> + this <A href=\"https://vimeo.com/microsoftdesign/fluentui\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">fun, visual \"Fluent UI\" video</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Teamwork updates across SharePoint team sites, OneDrive and Microsoft Teams</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 is designed to be a universal toolkit for teamwork – to give you the right tools for the right task, along with common services to help you seamlessly work across applications. SharePoint is the intelligent content service that powers teamwork – to better collaborate on proposals, projects, and campaigns throughout your organization – with integration across Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Yammer, Stream, Planner and much more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Improving the Quick Edit experience for SharePoint lists and libraries</STRONG></P>\n<P>The team has been working hard to improve the Quick Edit experience - Quick Edit being a mode you can move into to make bulk updates and add list or file items quickly within lists and document libraries.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_010_QuickEdit.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202184iB6A01BDAB715407E/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_010_QuickEdit.jpg\" alt=\"One example of the updated Quick Edit experience: the “New” button appears so you can enter information via the input form while in Quick Edit.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">One example of the updated Quick Edit experience: the “New” button appears so you can enter information via the input form while in Quick Edit.</span></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Save a view in Quick Edit</STRONG> | That's right, you can save a view in Quick Edit for any SharePoint list or document library. Note: when a user saves a view in Quick Edit, the list or document library will always render in quick edit for easy inline editing. | <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64229\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 64229</A></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Expanding the default Quick Edit view from 30 items to 100</STRONG>&nbsp;| You will now see 100 items per page on SharePoint document library or list when using Quick Edit; aka, less need page through items - noting that the majority of lists are greater than 30 items and less than 100 - a nice data-driven outcome based on real customer use. | <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64231\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 64231</A></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Create all column types directly from Quick Edit</STRONG> | You’ll be able to create all the same columns types when you need to start tracking additional information without have to leave Quick Edit. | <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=63277\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 63277</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_011_QuickEdit_Add-columns.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202185i2B350522B6150908/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_011_QuickEdit_Add-columns.jpg\" alt=\"Create all column types directly from Quick Edit.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Create all column types directly from Quick Edit.</span></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>View and edit items in forms inside of Quick edit</STRONG> | Get full visibility on the whole of information per list or file item by viewing it’s form (instead of scrolling to the right on the row). | <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64230\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 64230</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_012_QuickEdit_view-edit-forms.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202186i17A02EF7F6CE3642/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_012_QuickEdit_view-edit-forms.jpg\" alt=\"View and edit items in forms inside of Quick Edit.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">View and edit items in forms inside of Quick Edit.</span></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>“New” button on the command bar</STRONG> | Alongside adding a new row below the last, you can now click the New button to add a new item or file – the same “New” experience when not in Quick Edit. | <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64232\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 64232</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Updated list and library forms and web parts </STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Updated hyperlink and date column editors</STRONG> <BR />We are always striving to improve design consistency, user experience and performance. Now when you add a hyperlink and text to an item or add or update it’s date and time, you’ll have a much better experience doing it. These simple updates save you time, and simply look and work better.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=63275\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">63275</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_013_Fluent-list-date-picker.jpg\" style=\"width: 597px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202187i31AB9C604DCDF745/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_013_Fluent-list-date-picker.jpg\" alt=\"The new, inline Fluent Design date picker experience for a Date column in a list.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The new, inline Fluent Design date picker experience for a Date column in a list.</span></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Bulk edit your list items and file properties in the form</STRONG></P>\n<P>You can now select multiple items and edit their list items or documents properties at once in the form. Again, a big time saver.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64228\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 64228</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_014_lists-bulk-edit-in-form.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202188i380377AA165B71B3/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_014_lists-bulk-edit-in-form.jpg\" alt=\"Once you select multiple item on a list, you'll see it reflected in the form where it says “Edit 3 items” and it shows only the fields that can be bulk edited.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Once you select multiple item on a list, you'll see it reflected in the form where it says “Edit 3 items” and it shows only the fields that can be bulk edited.</span></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Connect web parts to consume dynamic data</STRONG></P>\n<P>Dynamic filtering&nbsp;allows you to filter the contents of a list or library web part on a page depending on a value selected in another list or library web part on that same page. Think of one being a source and the other being a way to visualize the item details. A nice way to build quick productivity apps in conjunction with SharePoint pages.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_015_connected-web-parts.jpg\" style=\"width: 800px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202189iDFCB9A5C8B499BFB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_015_connected-web-parts.jpg\" alt=\"The List web part on the left is connected to the Document Library web part on the right.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The List web part on the left is connected to the Document Library web part on the right.</span></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=57307\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 57307</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/dynamic-list-filtering-eed5f92e-1716-45d5-9a94-59decb930e42\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Our documentation team has been working hard to update all the help and how to materials for all things lists and libraries updates.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Learn more about recent lists and library updates:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/create-change-or-delete-a-view-of-a-list-or-library-27ae65b8-bc5b-4949-b29b-4ee87144a9c9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Create, change, or delete a view of a list or library</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/edit-list-items-in-sharepoint-online-dac1a1c3-a80b-4082-ba57-715cf613d0f7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Edit list items in SharePoint Online</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/office/create-a-column-in-a-sharepoint-list-or-library-2b0361ae-1bd3-41a3-8329-269e5f81cfa2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Create all column types directly from Quick Edit</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Updated sharing links that block downloads for PDFs, images and audio files</STRONG></P>\n<P>Today, you can create sharing links that block the download of Office files. This sharing link allows recipients to read the file, but not download it.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_016_Block-download-PDFs-images-audio.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202190iACFE3A1B1E547E5D/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_016_Block-download-PDFs-images-audio.jpg\" alt=\"Select Block download when adjusting sharing settings, now on Office files, PDFs, images and audio files.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Select Block download when adjusting sharing settings, now on Office files, PDFs, images and audio files.</span></span></P>\n<P>This month's update expands the list of supported file types to include PDF files, images, and audio files. The experience of creating a \"read-only/download-blocked\" sharing link is unchanged; you must uncheck “Allow editing” for the “Block download” toggle to appear.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Note: admins can control whether the \"block download\" setting appears only for Office files or whether it will allow additional file types by editing the BlockDownloadLinksFileType setting in the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/module/sharepoint-online/set-spotenant?view=sharepoint-ps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Set-SPOTenant</A>&nbsp;or&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/module/sharepoint-online/set-sposite?view=sharepoint-ps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Set-SPOSite</A>&nbsp;PowerShell cmdlets. The options are \"enable for only Office files\" or \"enable for all supported files\" (now the new default).</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64278\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roadmap ID 64278</A>.&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/sharing-files-and-folders-74cab0bf-39c6-4112-a63f-88ee121722d0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about sharing files and folders</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Related technology</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>PowerPoint Presenter Coach on Android</STRONG></P>\n<P>Last fall, the virtual Presenter Coach&nbsp;released to <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/rehearse-your-slide-show-with-presenter-coach-cd7fc941-5c3b-498c-a225-83ef3f64f07b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">PowerPoint for the web</A>.&nbsp;And, it is&nbsp;now generally available for Android devices - both in the PowerPoint app and in the new Office mobile app.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/AEXFHhtea7M\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/AEXFHhtea7M/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This feature uses AI to help you hone your public speaking skills by providing&nbsp;on-screen guidance on your pacing, use of inclusive language or profanity, and noting use of&nbsp;filler words and culturally insensitive phrases. At the end of each session, it also provides a&nbsp;detailed report with metrics for additional practice.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Simply open any presentation - especially those stored in OneDrive, SharePoint or teams. Tap on the \"three dots\" more actions menu, tap “rehearse with coach,” and tap “start rehearsing”. Download either the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.office.powerpoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">PowerPoint Android App</A>, or the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/microsoft-office-app-for-android-0383d031-a1c6-46c9-b734-53cd1d22765b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office Mobile App</A>,&nbsp;so you can experience coaching on-the-go! Note: Presenter Coach will be available for iOS in the coming months.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Temporary increase to 20k attendees for Live Events in Yammer<BR /></STRONG>Earlier this year, Microsoft&nbsp;<A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftechcommunity.microsoft.com%2Ft5%2Fmicrosoft-teams-blog%2Fwhat-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-april-2020%2Fba-p%2F1347929&amp;data=02%7C01%7Cchtorok%40microsoft.com%7C627f3f16d02c4958244208d813a7c40a%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637280958556061282&amp;sdata=YhJByOc5vnu9lBYNq3zp1oRc9zDyDE28Hh0Bb74dx3g%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">announced</A>&nbsp;this temporary limit increase would be enabled for Microsoft 365 live events to help better support customers, through July 1, and now will continue to support until October 1, 2020.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_017_Live-Events_20k.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202191iCF6D136BEBFD753E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZRP-20_June-2020_017_Live-Events_20k.jpg\" alt=\"Create live events and have them show up directly in Yammer where viewers can participate in live discussion while watching.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Create live events and have them show up directly in Yammer where viewers can participate in live discussion while watching.</span></span></P>\n<P>Live events hosted in Teams, Stream and Yammer can be up to 16 hours in length and 50 concurrent events. Additionally, you can reach out to the Microsoft&nbsp;<A href=\"http://aka.ms/LiveEventAssistance\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">live events assistance program</A>&nbsp;to host live events up 100,000 attendees.&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/yammer-blog/temporary-increase-to-20k-attendees-for-live-events-in-yammer/ba-p/1481839\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SharePoint Starter Kit v2 </STRONG>(for developers)</P>\n<P>This is a comprehensive solution designed for SharePoint in Microsoft and SharePoint 2019 which provides numerous SharePoint Framework (SPFx) web parts, extensions, and other components, as well as PnP PowerShell driven provisioning which you can use as an example and inspiration for your own customizations. This, too, applies to building modern portals and packaged solutions in Microsoft Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/QuBzkzC224g\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/QuBzkzC224g/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>You'll find updated samples, documentation, recent source code updates to match current version of SharePoint Framework (SPFx), a new sample layout site via the Look Book, and more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blogs/announcing-sharepoint-starter-kit-v2/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>July 2020 teasers</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Psst, still here? Still scrolling the page looking for the rolled out goodness? If so, here’s a few teasers of what’s to come to production next month…</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Teaser #1: <STRONG>Updating the list and list item sharing experience</STRONG> [Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64164\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">64164</A>]&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>Teaser #2: <STRONG>Fixed row height for lists in Quick Edit </STRONG>[Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=64867\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">64867</A>]</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>… shhh, tell everyone.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Helpful, ongoing change management resources </STRONG></FONT></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>\"<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/office365/admin/manage/stay-on-top-of-updates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Stay on top of Office 365 changes</A>\"</LI>\n<LI>\"<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/office365/admin/manage/message-center\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Message center in Office 365</A>\"</LI>\n<UL>\n<LI>Install the <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=627216\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 admin app</A>; view Message Center posts and stay current with push notifications.</LI>\n</UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365 public roadmap</A> <SPAN>+ pre-filtered URL for </SPAN><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?ms.url=roadmap&amp;rtc=1&amp;filters=Rolling%20Out%2CLaunched%2CIn%20Development%2CYammer%2CSharePoint%2CMicrosoft%20Stream%2COneDrive%20for%20Business\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer and Stream roadmap items</A><SPAN>.</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>SharePoint</STRONG> <A href=\"https://www.facebook.com/MSSharePoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facebook</A> | <A href=\"https://twitter.com/SharePoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A> | <A href=\"http://office.com/sharepoint/community\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Community Blog</A> | <A href=\"https://sharepoint.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>OneDrive</STRONG> <A href=\"https://www.facebook.com/OneDrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facebook</A> | <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/onedrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A> | <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SharePoint/blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">OneDrive Community Blog</A> | <A href=\"https://onedrive.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI>Follow me to catch <STRONG>news and interesting SharePoint things</STRONG>: <A href=\"https://twitter.com/mkashman\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@mkashman</A>; warning, occasional bad puns may fly in a tweet or two here and there.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Thanks for tuning in and/or reading this episode/blog of the <STRONG>Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop – June 2020 </STRONG>(blog/podcast). We’re open to your feedback in comments below to hear how both the Roadmap Pitstop podcast episodes and blogs can be improved over time.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Engage with us. Ask questions. Push us where you want and need to get the best information and insights. We're here to put both our and your best change management foot forward.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Stay safe out there on the road’map, and thanks for listening and reading.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Cheers and thanks,</P>\n<P>Mark “MTK” Kashman – senior product manager (SharePoint/Lists) | Microsoft)</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\"
