Jun 2020 15:00:00 +0000","feedId":13333,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/200361i2F8FF629F329D706/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400","linkMd5":"d767f8b8a139ee9bb17d52e5f812c13d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn65@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-31-32-190_40c94caee19615c7.webp","destWidth":400,"destHeight":400,"sourceBytes":26785,"destBytes":24230,"author":"Mark Kashman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/200361i2F8FF629F329D706/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn65@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-31-32-190_40c94caee19615c7.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179180i96112720B966E51C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn25@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-29-357_56c9616debbcf9dc.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179179iF0CF5BF31FBF3369/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn89@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-31-43-059_29e0a74f92cc2992.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688840},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"The New Employee Onboarding hub – Improving the new hire experience","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/the-new-employee-onboarding-hub-improving-the-new-hire/ba-p/1530083","description":"<P>Planning, implementing, and managing an onboarding experience for new employees is time consuming and challenging. For organizations, its difficult to efficiently onboard new employees into the complexity of an organization’s structure, people, processes, and culture. Only 12% of employees strongly agree their organization does a great job of onboarding new employees.[1] For new employees, the onboarding experience is often exciting, but can also be stressful, overwhelming, and inconsistent. Based on research, new employees who have a negative onboarding experience are twice as likely to look for new opportunities within the first six months of starting their new job.&nbsp;[2]</P>\n<P><BR />To help our customers improve their new hire onboarding experience, we have launched a new set of SharePoint site templates on the SharePoint look book called the <STRONG>New Employee Onboarding (NEO) hub</STRONG>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"NEO-01.jpg\" style=\"width: 800px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206460i53F7107CF0D195C7/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"NEO-01.jpg\" alt=\"NEO-01.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The NEO hub helps organizations:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Provide new employees resources, support, and general information</LI>\n<LI>Connect new employees to people, community, and culture</LI>\n<LI>Help stakeholders easily contribute to new employee onboarding</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"NEO-02.jpg\" style=\"width: 800px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206414iFB09244E6F83E174/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"NEO-02.jpg\" alt=\"NEO-02.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>An engaging and well-organized NEO process can make all the difference in helping a new hire navigate through an exciting – but stressful - career journey, and it can have major organizational benefits:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Improve new hire performance and time to productivity - Organizations with a standard onboarding process report 50% greater new-hire productivity.[3]</LI>\n<LI>Improve new employee retention - 69% of employees are more likely to stay with a company for three years if they had a great onboarding experience.[4]</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>[1]<SPAN> Gallup, State of the American Workplace, 2017</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>[2]</SPAN><SPAN> Gallup, State of the American Workplace, 2017</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>[3]</SPAN><SPAN> SHRM, Don't Underestimate the Importance of Good Onboarding, 2017</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>[4]</SPAN> SHRM, Don't Underestimate the Importance of Good Onboarding, 2017</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN>NEO hub</SPAN></STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN>New employee onboarding involves creating an end-to-end experience for new employees that begins <EM>before</EM> their first day on the job. Research has shown pre-onboarding new hires (after they sign their acceptance letter but before they officially join the company) can lead to higher performance and better retention rates. New employee onboarding also involves providing support on multiple levels within an organization, like corporate and departmental onboarding. Each onboarding level provides its own unique value, contributing to a comprehensive onboarding experience that each new employee will benefit from. To deliver a consistent and integrated new hire onboarding experience the NEO hub consists of three types of SharePoint site templates, designed to work as one cohesive and familiar experience for new hires:</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"NEO hub sites.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206129i5AC04CE8424A727B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"NEO hub sites.png\" alt=\"NEO hub sites.png\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN>What’s included</SPAN></STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN>To help accelerate your implementation of a new employee onboarding hub in your tenant the following highlights just some of the features included: </SPAN></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG><SPAN>A fully configured and customizable set of new hire sites built on SharePoint communication sites:</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN> The NEO hub brings together the sites, information architecture, design, user interface and webparts to help provide new hires with a great onboarding experience. The NEO hub can be customized to add your organization’s new hire content and to align with its look and feel. </SPAN></LI>\n<LI><STRONG><SPAN>Onboarding checklist:</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN> Onboarding can be an overwhelming experience for new hires with everything the new hire is typically expected to do and learn. Avoid overwhelming your new employees by providing them a curated onboarding journey that paces the new hire through a configurable activity list of onboarding to-do’s. </SPAN></LI>\n<LI><STRONG><SPAN>Sample new hire site pages:</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN> To inspire and provide design templates for arranging your content, the NEO hub includes sample inner site pages. Use these site pages as templates for your content.</SPAN></LI>\n<LI><STRONG><SPAN>Mobile ready:</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN> The NEO hub can be easily accessed on mobile devices so your new hires can continue their onboarding from wherever they may be working. </SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><SPAN><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/provision-neo-hub\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A> about the NEO hub. <A href=\"https://lookbook.microsoft.com/details/75e60a32-9849-4ed4-b83e-b2b08983ad19\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Provision</A> the NEO hub to your tenant today and customize it to help your new hires onboard successfully.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN>FAQ:</SPAN></STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN>Question:</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN> What are the requirements for installing the New Employee Onboarding (NEO) Hub into my tenant environment?</SPAN></P>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN>Answer:</SPAN></STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Ensure SharePoint Online is enabled in your environment.</LI>\n<LI>The individual that will provision the NEO hub must be the admin of the target tenant for install.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN>Question:</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN> How long will it take to install the site in our tenant environment?</SPAN></P>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN>Answer:</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN> Based on our testing of the installation, it should take less than 20 minutes. This does not include time required to customize the site to your requirements.</SPAN></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 23 Jul 2020 15:43:56 +0000","feedId":13333,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206460i53F7107CF0D195C7/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"b57b8108b7af24b4aee0b9855edbb711","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn97@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-31-31-400_e918eb1dcfeb2ad8.webp","destWidth":800,"destHeight":495,"sourceBytes":47156,"destBytes":34582,"author":"Matt Wolodarsky","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206460i53F7107CF0D195C7/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn97@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-31-31-400_e918eb1dcfeb2ad8.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206414iFB09244E6F83E174/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn2@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-37-871_8b568f3bb5a46f5d.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206129i5AC04CE8424A727B/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn66@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-31-37-536_60f49a496c9f5270.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688845},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"SharePoint “Next steps” 📢 moves people to the latest collaboration experiences","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-next-steps-moves-people-to-the-latest-collaboration/ba-p/1156066","description":"<P>\n SharePoint in Microsoft 365 is continuously evolving and improving, especially in areas where Microsoft can refine the first-run experience and guide people to the best use and adoption of the technology that supports their day to day.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Today, we expand the in-product help that appears at the top-right of your SharePoint team sites – to make people’s first SharePoint experiences with sites that much easier and actionable. This is especially true for those who help manage sites and train people at scale within your organization. The question is, how do you get the most out of SharePoint and other integrated apps today? How do you ensure a great first-run experience for your people? What is the \n <EM>\n  next step\n </EM>?\n</P> \n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorMark Kashman_0\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SP_Next-steps_020620_001_Next-steps-panel-pre-groupify.jpg\" style=\"width: 204px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/169438i3AEFC2A3EED6C57A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"SP_Next-steps_020620_001_Next-steps-panel-pre-groupify.jpg\" alt=\"SharePoint Next steps appear when you click on the megaphone icon in the upper-right of the site.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">SharePoint Next steps appear when you click on the megaphone icon in the upper-right of the site.</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n The answer lies in two options: one “self-service” approach and one “at-scale” method:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-next-steps-moves-people-to-the-latest-collaboration/ba-p/1156066#self\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   <STRONG>\n    Self-service\n   </STRONG>\n  </A> | people click \n  <STRONG>\n   Next steps\n  </STRONG> and choose from the suggested tips to improve teamwork collaboration.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-next-steps-moves-people-to-the-latest-collaboration/ba-p/1156066#scale\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   <STRONG>\n    At-scale\n   </STRONG>\n  </A> | SharePoint admins \n  <STRONG>\n   perform bulk operations\n  </STRONG> across multiple SharePoint sites at once\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n No matter which option you choose, your site(s) get improved list and library experiences, an updated home page, and mobile readiness. &nbsp;You, too, can the added benefit from other integrated apps such as Planner and Outlook; this process is often referred to as “groupify” as it begins with adding a new Office 365 Groups membership. Updated sites then present helpful, first-run experiences to guide people through the upload of their first set of files, posting news articles for other team members, and adding others as new members.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n And with one additional, sequential step you add a Microsoft Teams team as an additional app for your team members to bring communication alongside content; this is sometimes referred to as “teamify” as you are adding a Microsoft Teams team to your team site; yes, a mouth full, but well worth using beyond saying.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Let’s dive into the details of both options …\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <A target=\"_blank\" name=\"self\"></A>\n</P> \n<P>\n <FONT size=\"5\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Self-service “Next steps” \n  </STRONG>\n  <STRONG>\n    tips improve SharePoint site first-run experiences \n  </STRONG>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<P>\n We're expanding the in-product help that appears at the top-right of your SharePoint team sites. More and more, SharePoint in Microsoft 365 helps people get the most value from new sites by providing contextual, actionable help. And today, we’re pleased to announce the expansion and location of the \n <STRONG>\n  Next steps\n </STRONG> panel.\n</P> \n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorMark Kashman_1\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SP_Next-steps_020620_002_Next-steps-panels-side-by-side.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/169439i7F04569ABE541718/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"SP_Next-steps_020620_002_Next-steps-panels-side-by-side.jpg\" alt=\"Left-to-right: “Next steps” showing from a classic team site and “Next steps” showing from a group-connected team site. Simply click on the megaphone icon to bring up &quot;Next steps&quot; tips from the Office 365 suite header at the top of the SharePoint site.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Left-to-right: “Next steps” showing from a classic team site and “Next steps” showing from a group-connected team site. Simply click on the megaphone icon to bring up \"Next steps\" tips from the Office 365 suite header at the top of the SharePoint site.</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n The SharePoint site \"Next steps\" panel provides a great first-run experience. All to help you move forward as a team and work out-loud and with confidence and awareness on how everything works in and around your SharePoint site interaction.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Currently there are four tips (cards) site members and owners may see within the Next steps panel:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Upload files\n  </STRONG> – Collaborate on shared content with your team; encourages people to \n  <FONT color=\"#00CCFF\">\n   <STRONG>\n    Upload a document\n   </STRONG>\n  </FONT>.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Post news\n  </STRONG> – Communicate with your team by sharing updates and announcements; helps \n  <FONT color=\"#00CCFF\">\n   <STRONG>\n    Create a news post\n   </STRONG>\n  </FONT> the first few times.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Invite team members\n  </STRONG> – Engage with your team by adding them to your site's group; makes it easier to see how to \n  <FONT color=\"#00CCFF\">\n   <STRONG>\n    Add members\n   </STRONG>\n  </FONT>.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Power your site with apps \n  </STRONG>– Promote team collaboration on shared content by adding a team email, calendar, notebook, task management tool, and more; integrates additional capabilities when you \n  <FONT color=\"#00CCFF\">\n   <STRONG>\n    Add apps to your site\n   </STRONG>\n  </FONT>. #groupify\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n These tips help your users customize and improve their team sites. Tips are useful for anyone learning more about SharePoint or setting up a new team site for the first time.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Note: the “Power your site with apps” card will appear only on classic SharePoint team site that have not yet connected to a new Office 365 Groups group. Once this update has run, that option will no longer appear for that team site and the additional “Invite team members” may then appear.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n For clarity, we also wanted to take a moment to highlight the other four top-right icons you will see above and to the right of your site – next to Next Steps:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  Notifications – people will see various alerts from across Microsoft 365 services based on their notification’s preferences.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Settings – this gives access to deeper level site settings, like Site contents, Site information, Site usage and more.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Help – this pulls in contextual “how to” information from support.office.com\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Your Office profile – where you can be you and adjust your account settings and Office profile.\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n Note: \"\n <STRONG>\n  Connect site to a new Office 365 group\n </STRONG>\" may still appear in upper-right gear icon. This is the same as the new “\n <STRONG>\n  Power your site with apps\n </STRONG>” Next steps card.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Learn more how to \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/dev/transform/modernize-connect-to-office365-group\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  connect your SharePoint team site to a new Office 365 group\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <A target=\"_blank\" name=\"scale\"></A>\n <FONT size=\"5\">\n  <STRONG>\n   At-scale, SharePoint admins plan and move multiple sites to modern experiences\n  </STRONG>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<P>\n Beyond individual site owners being able to connect to new Office 365 Groups from either the new Next steps action described above, it’s important to note that SharePoint admins can do this at scale using bulk operations across numerous sites deemed ready for modernization.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n You can perform a bulk operation (known as a group-connection) in which you connect an Office 365 group to a series of sites at one time. This option is preferred for enterprise customers because it enables you to control the configuration (public/private, site classification, alias name) – and save time doing it on behalf of people and sites that qualify and request it.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Below are the two main steps to plan and execute the move to the latest SharePoint and Office 365 Groups experiences at scale:\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  FIRST\n </STRONG> | Use the \n <STRONG>\n  Modernization Scanner tool\n </STRONG> to better understand classic SharePoint sites and the available capabilities to modernize them. The tool provides factual data about optimizing lists and libraries, connecting to Office 365 Groups, rebuilding classic publishing portals, workflow, blogs and more. Using the dashboards generated by the scanner you'll be able to better assess the readiness of your sites and plan moving forward and any suggested remediation guidance.\n</P> \n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorMark Kashman_2\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SP_Next-steps_020620_003_SP-modernization-scanner.jpg\" style=\"width: 389px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/169440iAC47707BF5A74A2A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"SP_Next-steps_020620_003_SP-modernization-scanner.jpg\" alt=\"Select the SharePoint Modernization Scanner option you want in the dropdown and then the checkboxes will show which components will be included in the scan. The &quot;Office 365 Group connection readiness&quot; component is the main component that will be included all scan modes.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Select the SharePoint Modernization Scanner option you want in the dropdown and then the checkboxes will show which components will be included in the scan. The \"Office 365 Group connection readiness\" component is the main component that will be included all scan modes.</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n Select the SharePoint Modernization Scanner option you want in the dropdown and then the checkboxes will show which components will be included in the scan. The \"Office 365 Group connection readiness\" component is the main component that will be included all scan modes.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  Note | The SharePoint Modernization Scanner only supports SharePoint in Microsoft 365. To scan SharePoint Server on-premises, use the&nbsp;\n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepointmigration/overview-of-the-sharepoint-migration-assessment-tool\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   SharePoint Migration Assessment Tool\n  </A>.\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n Learn how to \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/dev/transform/modernize-scanner\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  get started with the SharePoint modernization scanner\n </A>. And then \n <A href=\"https://github.com/SharePoint/sp-dev-modernization/blob/dev/Tools/SharePoint.Modernization/Releases/SharePoint.Modernization.Scanner.exe\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  download the SharePoint Modernization Scanner\n </A> and try it today.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  SECOND\n </STRONG> | Programmatically modernize your sites using a CSV files and bulk group-connect PowerShell script. After running the scanner and processing the results, you have identified which sites are ready to group-connect. The next step is to prepare a CSV file to drive the bulk group-connection process.\n</P> \n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorMark Kashman_3\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SP_Next-steps_020620_004_SP-modernization-scanner_sample-PowerShell_pt1.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/169441i7525E6331F360F6A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"SP_Next-steps_020620_004_SP-modernization-scanner_sample-PowerShell_pt1.jpg\" alt=\"Section of the sample PowerShell script to modernize SharePoint pages.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Section of the sample PowerShell script to modernize SharePoint pages.</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SP_Next-steps_020620_005_SP-modernization-scanner_sample-PowerShell_pt2.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/169442i0825B8081DC950FB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"SP_Next-steps_020620_005_SP-modernization-scanner_sample-PowerShell_pt2.jpg\" alt=\"Section of the sample PowerShell script to create a new Microsoft Teams team and associated it to the SharePoint site.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Section of the sample PowerShell script to create a new Microsoft Teams team and associated it to the SharePoint site.</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n As you move through the options of what you can do, note you’ll be able to:\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  Add a Microsoft Teams team to each SharePoint site\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Modernize all the pages within each site\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Clean up site branding\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Apply a tenant theme to each site\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Learn how to \n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SharePoint/modernization/guidance\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  connect new Office 365 groups to across multiple sites at once\n </A> (includes sample PowerShell script); this, too contains a best practices guide to managing SharePoint modernization projects.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <FONT size=\"5\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Wrapping it up…\n  </STRONG>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<P>\n We recently spoke to\n <STRONG>\n   Nicole Woon\n </STRONG> (\n <A href=\"https://twitter.com/NovelNicole\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Twitter\n </A> | \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/niwoon/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A>), a program manager at Microsoft. She helped update the above-mentioned “\n <STRONG>\n  Next Steps\n </STRONG>” experience for SharePoint sites. In the podcast episode, I interview Nicole about this new feature update and dig into the design, customer use and future action cards that help customers have a great first-run experience with SharePoint sites:\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/12944747/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n You, too, can learn from the person behind the modernization tool, Bert Jansen (\n <A href=\"https://twitter.com/O365Bert\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Twitter\n </A> | \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/bertjansen/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A>), as he shares how to get started transforming classic SharePoint sites to modern experiences using the admin patterns, practices and tools mentioned above:\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a6Ml0mAupwA\" align=\"center\" size=\"medium\" width=\"400\" height=\"300\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/a6Ml0mAupwA/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n We hope you enjoy not only the move to more modern experiences, but improved ways to support your growth and engagement throughout your organization.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n What is the next step? At Microsoft Ignite 2019, we announced that the Yammer Conversations web part for SharePoint Online would be updated with the new Yammer experience. Now, we are excited to announce that it is generally available, meaning that you get all the new Yammer experiences on your SharePoint pages, news articles, and SharePoint sites.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Add the power of community to your sites</H2>\n<P>The updated Yammer Conversations web parts integrates conversations from any Yammer community, topic, user, or home feed, so you can stay connected to the discussions happening across your organization and add social conversations while still in SharePoint. Starting today, it automatically replace the previous Yammer conversations web part without any action needed from site admins.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>What’s New</H2>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>The new from SharePoint.​ </LI>\n<LI>usage of<STRONG> rich text</STRONG> on messages created from SharePoint Online.​ <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Yammer continues to spotlight \n <STRONG>\n  Microsoft partners\n </STRONG>, the people and companies who deliver solutions and services to empower our customers to achieve more.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In our third partner episode, we talk with \n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/colin-truran-4364203/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Colin Truran\n  </A> \n </STRONG>(Principal strategist at Quest Software) and his customer, \n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/chris-reynolds-56878423/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Chris Reynolds\n  </A>\n </STRONG> (Head of Systems and Applications Development Services at Arden and GEM Commissioning Support Unit in the UK).\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n We talk with them about moving, managing and securing data in Office 365. Quest provides solutions to their customers, so they spend less time on IT and more time on business innovation. And with Chris Reynolds, we focused on how tech supports their notion of population health management and how their business ladders up into the broader National Health Service (NHS) in the United Kingdom. Plus, we learn why a Toad often pops up in the Quest Twitter feed. :)\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n OK, Partner (edition), on with the show…\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <IFRAME 89","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/microsoft-365-amp-sharepoint-pnp-weekly-episode-89/ba-p/1502751","description":"<P class=\"\"><span /></span></P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\">In this weekly discussion of latest news and topics around<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN class=\"brand\">Microsoft 365</SPAN>, hosts –<WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://twitter.com/vesajuvonen\" target=\"_blank\">Vesa Juvonen</A><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>(Microsoft),<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://twitter.com/waldekm\" target=\"_blank\">Waldek Mastykarz</A><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>(Rencore), are joined by&nbsp;<A href=\"https://twitter.com/pkbullock\" target=\"_blank\">Paul Bullock</A><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>–<WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>SharePoint Architect and MVP with CaPa Creative located in the UK.&nbsp; Paul is a major contributor to PnP modernization tooling effort which leads to this call’s discussion focus.&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>So why would you share your code as open-source?&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>When’s a good time to start contributing?&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>How do you get plugged into the PnP community?&nbsp;</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>This session is a great place to start.&nbsp; PnP is not just code, it’s structure, infrastructure, policy, adoption strategies, recognition, networking, the human-side of IT.&nbsp; Open-source is great way to learn from and work with people who are introverts, extroverts, people located near and far with various organization affiliations, customer projects and technical skills that share common passions and a relationship to the PnP community.&nbsp;&nbsp; Additionally, in this episode, 17 recently released articles from Microsoft and the PnP Community are highlighted.</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\">As always, if you need help on an issue, want to share a discovery, or just want to say: “<EM>Job well done</EM>”, please reach out to Vesa, to Waldek or to your PnP Community.</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\"><SPAN>This episode was recorded on Monday, June 29, 2020.</SPAN></P>\n<P Weekly – Episode 89</A></SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><SPAN>Did we miss your article? Episode 85","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/microsoft-365-amp-sharepoint-pnp-weekly-episode-85/ba-p/1419865","description":"<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"episode-85-promo.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/194710i78824EF52FCD0660/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"episode-85-promo.png\" alt=\"episode-85-promo.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>In this weekly discussion of latest news and topics around&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN class=\"brand\">Microsoft 365</SPAN><SPAN>, hosts –</SPAN><WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://twitter.com/vesajuvonen\" target=\"_blank\">Vesa Juvonen</A><SPAN>&nbsp;(Microsoft),&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://twitter.com/waldekm\" target=\"_blank\">Waldek Mastykarz</A><SPAN>&nbsp;(Rencore), are joined by&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://twitter.com/stephanbisser\" target=\"_blank\">Stefan Bisser</A><SPAN>&nbsp;–</SPAN><WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;MVP and the technical lead at&nbsp;</SPAN><STRONG>Solvion</STRONG><SPAN>, located at Austria. </SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>This episode’s conversation evolves around the Bot Framework work how it has evolved since past years. As there are new capabilities in the Bot Framework, more and more customers and partners are also starting to use this model. Microsoft Teams is certainly one of the biggest hosts for Bot Framework solutions, but the same code can be used in public web sites, SharePoint or in any other solution to surface conversational interface for end users. Discussion touched also many other topics.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>This episode was recorded on Monday, May 25, 2020.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blogs/microsoft-365-sharepoint-pnp-weekly-episode-85/\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noreferrer noreferrer\">Microsoft 365 &amp; SharePoint PnP Weekly – Episode 85</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>Did we miss your article? Please use <A href=\"https://twitter.com/search?q=%23pnpweekly\" target=\"_self\">#PnPWeekly hashtag</A> in the Twitter for letting us know the content which you have created.&nbsp;</SPAN></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 27 May 2020 08:28:30 +0000","feedId":13333,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/194710i78824EF52FCD0660/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"5e02d243d43488df21958f2441138bf0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn45@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-31-29-412_60333fc2ccdf4727.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":338035,"destBytes":47592,"author":"Vesa Juvonen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/194710i78824EF52FCD0660/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn45@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-31-29-412_60333fc2ccdf4727.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688819},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"Microsoft Ignite The Tour 2019/2020 guide to SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer and Stream sessions","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/microsoft-ignite-the-tour-2019-2020-guide-to-sharepoint-onedrive/ba-p/1000731","description":"<P>Our industry-leading conference is hitting the road—and coming to a city near you. You don’t want to miss the very latest in cloud technologies and developer tools with guest speakers, industry experts, and more. Get on the list today! This blog covers all the related sessions and content to learn more about SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer and Stream – aka, SOYS.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">“If learning is an act of exploration, then technology equips the explorer for the journey of a lifetime.”</FONT> <BR />– Anonymous.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If you were unable to attend Ignite in Orlando, FL last week, fear not. Now is your chance to soak up all the benefits of Ignite near your own back yard. Microsoft is bringing <STRONG><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/ignite-the-tour#cities\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Ignite The Tour</A></STRONG> to a city near you.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Ignite-The-Tour_SOYS-sessions_002.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/156961i4C97D806E05C2C5C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Ignite-The-Tour_SOYS-sessions_002.jpg\" alt=\"Dive into the SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer and Stream (SOYS) session at Microsoft Ignite The Tour.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Dive into the SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer and Stream (SOYS) session at Microsoft Ignite The Tour.</span></span></P>\n<P>In the SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer, Stream (SOYS) and related tech space, keep a look out for the \"<STRONG>Content collaboration, Communication, and Engagement in the Intelligent Workplace</STRONG>\" learning path that consists of the below&nbsp;<U>four</U> 45-minute sessions in every city listed further below in the next “schedule” section:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>\"<STRONG>Content collaboration and protection with SharePoint, OneDrive and Microsoft Teams\"</STRONG> [SOYS10]\n<UL>\n<LI><U>Abstract</U>: SharePoint connects the workplace and powers content collaboration. OneDrive connects you with all your files in Office 365. Teams is the hub for teamwork. Together, SharePoint, OneDrive and Teams are greater than the sum of their parts. Join us for an overview of how these products interact with each other and learn about latest integrations we are working on to bring the richness of SharePoint directly into Teams experiences and vice versa. We'll explore new innovations for sharing and working together with data using SharePoint lists, and no-code productivity solutions that streamline business processes. Finally, we’ll explore how to structure teams and projects with hub sites.</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n<LI>\"<STRONG>Connect the organization and engage people with SharePoint, Yammer and Microsoft Stream</STRONG>\" [SOYS20]\n<UL>\n<LI><U>Abstract</U>: Company leaders recognize the need to transform their workforce, and organizations where employees are truly engaged report improved employee retention, customer satisfaction, sales metrics, and overall profitability. Microsoft 365 delivers the modern workplace and solutions that help you engage employees across organizational boundaries, generations and geographies, so you can empower your people to achieve more. Learn how SharePoint, Yammer and Stream work together to empower leaders to connect with their organizations, to align people to common goals, and to drive cultural transformation. Dive into the latest innovations including live events, new Yammer experiences and integrations, the intelligent intranet featuring home sites.</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n<LI>\"<STRONG>The intelligent intranet: Transform communications and digital employee experiences</STRONG>\" [SOYS30]\n<UL>\n<LI><U>Abstract</U>: The intelligent intranet in Microsoft 365 connects the workplace to power collaboration, employee engagement, and knowledge management. In this demo-heavy session, explore the latest innovations to help you transform your intranet into a rich, mobile-ready employee experiences that are dynamic, personalized, social and actionable. The session will explore new innovations for sites and portals, showcase common intranet scenarios, and provide actionable guidance toward optimal intranet architecture and governance.</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n<LI>\"<STRONG>Harness collective knowledge with intelligent content services and Microsoft Search</STRONG>\" (includes #ProjectCortex) [SOYS40]\n<UL>\n<LI><U>Abstract</U>: Join us to learn about the most significant innovations ever unveiled for knowledge management and intelligent content services in Microsoft 365. Get the latest updates on Project Cortex, Microsoft Search and other experiences that connect you with knowledge, insights, expertise, answers and actions, within your everyday experiences across Microsoft 365.</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>+ <STRONG>Microsoft Intelligent Intranet Accelerator Workshop</STRONG> <FONT size=\"2\">(offered in 16 of the 30 Ignite The Tour cities)</FONT></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Join us for an exclusive and interactive half-day event, targeted toward IT Decision Makers and Implementors around the world, ready to make a change to their intranet. Participate in deep technical sessions and immersive hands-on workshops. And explore real-world applications you can implement today to connect, succeed, and engage – faster.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/events/intelligent-intranet-accelerator-workshop\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>, find a city near you and register for one of our FREE interactive workshops today.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As a primer for all things SOYS, we encourage you to view CVP Jeff Teper’s general session on-demand before attending The Tour, “<STRONG><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions/81522\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The latest innovations in SharePoint, OneDrive, and Office for content collaboration in Microsoft 365</A></STRONG>” – from Ignite 2019 in Orlando, FL.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H3>Upcoming 2019/2020 cities schedule nearest/best for you…</H3>\n<P><span Lists","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/make-a-list-and-check-it-twice-the-intrazone-podcast-all-about/ba-p/1400928","description":"<P>\n Microsoft Lists is your smart information tracking app in Microsoft 365. Your lists just got a whole lot smarter and so, too, shall you as you tune into this exciting episode.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Track information\n </STRONG>. \n <STRONG>\n  Organize work\n </STRONG>. \n <STRONG>\n  Get things done\n </STRONG>. \n <STRONG>\n  Listen to podcast\n </STRONG> \n <img class=\"lia-deferred-image lia-image-emoji\" src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/html/images/emoticons/cool_40x40.gif\" alt=\":cool:\" title=\":cool:\" />.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In this episode, Chris and I talk to \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/miceile-barrett-225664100/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Miceile Barrett\n  </STRONG>\n </A> and \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/lincoln-demaris-2950439/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Lincoln DeMaris\n  </STRONG>\n </A> – both from the Lists engineering team. Miceile and Lincoln share more about the innovation in development to bring Microsoft Lists to market – evolving SharePoint lists and beyond across Microsoft 365. They share more about how they approached both the new design and evolving from SharePoint lists. You'll hear insights about the new Lists home page, ready-made templates, rules, the coming mobile app, Microsoft Teams integration and more – plus give some fun, crazy examples of real customer lists in use today.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <IFRAME href=\"https://aka.ms/TheIntrazone-RSS\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   RSS\n  </A>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n + Listen to other Microsoft podcasts at \n <A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/podcasts-and-shows/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  aka.ms/microsoft/podcasts\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <span Kashman, senior product manager (SharePoint – Microsoft).</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Mark May 2020 15:10:00 +0000","feedId":13333,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/html/images/emoticons/cool_40x40.gif","linkMd5":"37643a912bc89539336851bd3f2e4d18","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn58@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-29-349_9e7fbc9190bab5ae.webp","destWidth":40,"destHeight":40,"sourceBytes":9210,"destBytes":9358,"author":"Mark Kashman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/html/images/emoticons/cool_40x40.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn58@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-29-349_9e7fbc9190bab5ae.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192895i6A4B981BEFDCAE09/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn97@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-40-736_9b09b9947abb41af.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179180i96112720B966E51C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn25@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-29-357_56c9616debbcf9dc.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179179iF0CF5BF31FBF3369/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn89@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-31-43-059_29e0a74f92cc2992.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688845},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"SharePoint Roadmap Pitstop: November 2019","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-november-2019/ba-p/1042518","description":"<P>This month’s SharePoint and related tech certainly doesn’t disappoint. You’ll find a whole host of eagerly awaited tech goodies, like SharePoint home sites, the new files experience in Microsoft Teams, Save for later and more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Consider this the all-inclusive recap plus the embedded <STRONG>Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop: November 2019</STRONG> podcast episode – the bonus monthly audible companion – both to help answer, \"What's rolling out now for SharePoint and related technologies into Microsoft 365?\"</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To answer that question, <A href=\"https://intrazone.libsyn.com/roadmap-pitstop_nov_2019_edit\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">listen</A> and scroll below (info, links and screenshots galore) to stay informed on what features and updates arrived this past month - plus a few teasers of what's to come:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/12242285/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247ad3/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In the podcast episode, I interview <STRONG><A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/dcpadur/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">DC Padur</A></STRONG> (<A href=\"https://twitter.com/DCPadur\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A>), senior program manager focusing on intranet solutions across Microsoft 365. And most recently he focuses on the new <STRONG>SharePoint home sites</STRONG>. We dig into the design, customer use and future growth of the Microsoft 365-powered intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-13_Nov.2019_001_DC-Padur_MSStudios.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159617iD9CC2EC8C41E102E/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"IZ-RP-13_Nov.2019_001_DC-Padur_MSStudios.jpg\" alt=\"DC “Divyachapan” Padur, senior program manager (SharePoint/Microsoft) [Intrazone guest]\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">DC “Divyachapan” Padur, senior program manager (SharePoint/Microsoft) [Intrazone guest]</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>All the features listed below began rolling out to Targeted Release customers in Office 365 as of November 2019 (possibly early December 2019).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Inform and engage with dynamic employee experiences</FONT></P>\n<P>Build your modern intranet on SharePoint in Office 365 and get the benefits of investing in business outcomes – reducing IT and development costs, increasing business speed and agility, and up-leveling the dynamic and welcoming nature of your intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SharePoint home sites</STRONG></P>\n<P>A home site is the top landing page for your organization’s intranet. It brings together news, events, embedded video and conversations, and other resources to deliver an engaging experience that reflects your organization's voice, priorities, and brand.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_1.jpeg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159610iC161F45C65B6AAC1/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_1.jpeg\" alt=\"A SharePoint home site gives your organization a dynamic, top-level landing page designed for web and mobile.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">A SharePoint home site gives your organization a dynamic, top-level landing page designed for web and mobile.</span></span></P>\n<P>You can designate any communication site to be the home site with a simple PowerShell cmdlet. By making a communication site the home site, it will be more discoverable from both the SharePoint start page and the SharePoint mobile app. In addition, it will serve as a source of authoritative news for your organization and be automatically be set up for organization-wide search.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Note: A link within home site navigation (which is editable; default reads “My SharePoint”) points to the new SharePoint start page that we mentioned in last month’s roadmap pitstop. This allows users to easily navigate between the organization-wide content on the home site and their personalized content on the start page.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/SharePoint/home-site\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>. Roadmap <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=26842\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 26842</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Save for later </STRONG></P>\n<P>This allows users to keep documents that interest them in an easily accessible list across Office 365. Clicking the bookmark \"Save for later\" icon makes it easy to get back to a document, no matter if it's in your OneDrive or in a shared library.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_2.jpeg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159609iEF33AB9FC5413BF5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_2.jpeg\" alt=\"Click the Save for later icon next to a file and it will appear in your Saved view within OneDrive for the web.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Click the Save for later icon next to a file and it will appear in your Saved view within OneDrive for the web.</span></span></P>\n<P>Documents saved for later are accessible from the <STRONG>Saved</STRONG> tab in OneDrive on the Web and show up on the SharePoint start page in the <STRONG>Saved for later</STRONG> column under the news and sites sections.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-OneDrive-Blog/OneDrive-announcements-SharePoint-Conference-2019/ba-p/616047\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>. Roadmap <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=49095\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 49095</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SharePoint and OneDrive support sensitivity labels</STRONG> (in preview)</P>\n<P>This uses Microsoft Information Protection-based encryption associated with a sensitivity label. The encrypted files are treated much like regular files and users can open and edit them in Office on the Web and get modern experiences like co-authoring.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159612iB071A95EAC22463F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_3.png\" alt=\"Applying a sensitivity label to a Word document from within Microsoft Word.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Applying a sensitivity label to a Word document from within Microsoft Word.</span></span></P>\n<P>SharePoint recognizes sensitivity labels applied to Word, Excel, and PowerPoint files in SharePoint and OneDrive and enforces the settings that correspond with each label. When you download a file from SharePoint or OneDrive, the sensitivity label travels with the file and the settings remain enforced.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>From an IT perspective, you govern these encrypted files with Data Loss Prevention (DLP) policies and eDiscovery - all the enforcement you would expect are available per your governance plan and design along with greater productivity flexibility for people who continue to work with the sensitive files.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/compliance/sensitivity-labels-sharepoint-onedrive-files\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>. Learn more about&nbsp;<A href=\"https://aka.ms/SPOLabels\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint and OneDrive sensitivity labels</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap ID:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;featureid=57311\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">57311</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Teamwork updates across SharePoint team sites, OneDrive and Microsoft Teams</FONT></P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 is designed to be a universal toolkit for teamwork – to give you the right tools for the right task, along with common services to help you seamlessly work across applications. SharePoint is the intelligent content service that powers teamwork – to better collaborate on proposals, projects, and campaigns throughout your organization – and is integrated with Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Yammer, Stream, Planner and much more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New Teams files experience </STRONG></P>\n<P>We continue to bring the power of SharePoint into Teams – news, pages, lists – and now, a new files experience in the Files tab for Teams channels. This includes the ability to sync files to your computer (PC or Mac), see rich previews across 320+ file types, create views and work with metadata, see document life-cycle signals, review on-hover file cards, pin files to the top, take actions like check in and check out, and much more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-13_Nov.2019_005_New-files-exp-Teams.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159618i8C902E2F464AF0D3/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-13_Nov.2019_005_New-files-exp-Teams.gif\" alt=\"The rich, new files experience now appears within Teams when working within the Files tab of a channel.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The rich, new files experience now appears within Teams when working within the Files tab of a channel.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap IDs: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=51234\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">51234</A> &amp; <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=30548\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">30548</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Related blog: \"<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-SharePoint-Blog/Rich-new-file-and-sharing-experiences-throughout-Microsoft-365/ba-p/960129\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Rich, new file and sharing experiences throughout Microsoft 365, now in Microsoft Teams</A>\" [10/30/19]</LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI>Hear our interview with the&nbsp;<EM>Microsoft Files</EM>&nbsp;team as they the design and development of consistent, powerful ‘File experience across Microsoft 365’ in The Intrazone “<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-SharePoint-Blog/SharePoint-Roadmap-Pitstop-May-2019/ba-p/661160\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Roadmap Pitstop: May 2019</A>” episode.</LI>\n<LI>Dig into the \"<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-SharePoint-Blog/4-topnotch-teamwork-tips-for-Microsoft-Teams-plus-SharePoint/ba-p/864155\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">4 topnotch teamwork tips for Microsoft Teams plus SharePoint</A>\" (blog + video)</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Power Apps for SharePoint libraries</STRONG></P>\n<P>Power Apps is already integrated into SharePoint lists, which provides the ability to create an app for a list directly from the SharePoint list experience. We are now enabling this same sort of capability in SharePoint libraries.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_4.png\" style=\"width: 998px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159613iD81B4D4A3157B88A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_4.png\" alt=\"Power Apps can be used to customize SharePoint list forms. This also shows a list configured with tile views on the list data.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Power Apps can be used to customize SharePoint list forms. This also shows a list configured with tile views on the list data.</span></span></P>\n<P>And as you start to work with lists and libraries outside of OneDrive and SharePoint, the Power Apps value continues. So, when you're working with files and lists as tabs in Microsoft Teams, the Power Apps customization you build shines through, too.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/powerapps/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>. Roadmap <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=57303\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 57303</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>File card - conversations </STRONG></P>\n<P>Visibility of all file activities is key, and we are continuously working to make it as seamless as possible. Whenever you hover over a file in OneDrive and SharePoint you will be able to see a wealth of information about your files at a glance.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We are continuing to improve visibility of file activities. When you view the on-hover card for files, a new pivot on conversations appears showing relevant emails, meetings, and Teams conversations. When someone sends an email, a Teams message, or a meeting invitation that references a file from SharePoint or OneDrive, that conversation will be displayed in the file card with a link to the conversation(s).&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_5.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159614i624CCE5A43B30D0A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_5.png\" alt=\"Learn about your files at a glace with Inside look, file views and conversations.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Learn about your files at a glace with Inside look, file views and conversations.</span></span></P>\n<P>The conversations displayed on the file card will only be visible to those users who took part in them. This means that you won’t see another person’s conversations that are not related to the file in question, and they won’t see yours.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=56183\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 56183</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Expand/Collapse button in lists</STRONG></P>\n<P>This is my favorite feature this month - and the smallest of the bunch. Similar to the expand buttons in Teams and OneNote - It's time to <STRONG>click out the clutter</STRONG> and focus.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>A new \"Expand\" button will appear in the toolbar inside lists and libraries. Users can click this button to make the contents of the list or library take up more of the screen by hiding the site's navigation. To make the site's navigation re-appear, users can click the corresponding \"Collapse\" button.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-13_Nov.2019_008_Expand-collapse_for-SP-Lists.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159619i7208D4E296F7368C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-13_Nov.2019_008_Expand-collapse_for-SP-Lists.gif\" alt=\"Click the new Expand/Collapse for SharePoint lists and libraries to remove site header and navigation elements from visibility and back again.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Click the new Expand/Collapse for SharePoint lists and libraries to remove site header and navigation elements from visibility and back again.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap ID:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;featureid=57302\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">57302</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Related technology</FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>The new Microsoft Project rolls out to customers worldwide</STRONG></P>\n<P>Project offers a redesigned user experience that is simple and intuitive. Teams can quickly add new members and set up tasks, and then easily switch between grids, boards, or timeline (Gantt) charts to track progress. And because Project is part of the Microsoft 365 family, project teams can save time and do more with built-in connections to familiar apps like Microsoft Teams and Office.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-13_Nov.2019_009_New-MSProject.gif\" style=\"width: 750px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159620iCDB3FA7590518478/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-13_Nov.2019_009_New-MSProject.gif\" alt=\"Project offers a redesigned user experience that is simple and intuitive.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Project offers a redesigned user experience that is simple and intuitive.</span></span></P>\n<P>We are pleased to announce the roll out of the new Project to our existing Project Online Professional and Project Online Premium customers. Designed to be visual, easy to use, and collaborative, you can manage your work flexibly - from ad hoc projects to complex initiatives. Started quickly, take control.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/blog/2019/10/29/new-microsoft-project-rolls-out-worldwide/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>. Roadmap ID: <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;featureid=54641\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">54641</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Fluid Framework public preview and private developer preview</STRONG></P>\n<P>In May 2019,&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/blog/2019/05/06/build-2019-people-centered-experiences-microsoft-365-productivity-cloud/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">we introduced the Fluid Framework</A>. We are now introducing a public preview for end-users and a private preview for developers.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ-RP-13_Nov.2019_010_FluidFramework.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159621iF1EC152CC580FD65/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ-RP-13_Nov.2019_010_FluidFramework.gif\" alt=\"The Fluid Framework enables content components to be used collaboratively across experiences.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The Fluid Framework enables content components to be used collaboratively across experiences.</span></span></P>\n<P>In the&nbsp;<STRONG>public preview</STRONG>, users will be able to use the preview experience to crowd-source meeting agendas, take notes, or simply keep track of your thoughts. Over time, Fluid Framework will work with chat in Teams, mail in Outlook, portals in SharePoint, notes in OneNote, and Office documents. Get started at&nbsp;<A href=\"https://fluidpreview.office.net/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://FluidPreview.office.net</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In the&nbsp;<STRONG>private developer preview</STRONG>, developers can begin leveraging the rich component model flexibility to adapt and extend these scenarios in their organizations. You can submit a request to join the preview at&nbsp;<A href=\"https://aka.ms/FluidDeveloperPreview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://aka.ms/FluidDeveloperPreview</A>.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;featureid=56781\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 56781</A>.</LI>\n<LI>You can manage access to the preview in your tenant by referring to:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://aka.ms/FluidPreviewKB\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Fluid Framework preview – access management </A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Request Files - OneDrive </STRONG></P>\n<P>We realized that there was a strong need for people to collect files from others, often from collaborators outside of their organization, without letting them have the visibility to the content of the folder.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This feature allows a requester to ask a recipient to place files into a specific folder that they manage. The folder must be in the requester’s OneDrive in Microsoft 365. To request files, select the folder you want the recipient to use and click&nbsp;<STRONG>Request Files</STRONG>. Add a description of the files you’re requesting, click&nbsp;<STRONG>Next</STRONG>. Type the email of the person from whom you are requesting files or copy the link.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><VIDEO style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" autoplay=\"autoplay\" loop=\"loop\" muted=\"\" controls=\"controls\" width=\"95%\" height=\"auto\">\n<SOURCE src=\"https://techcommunity.azureedge.net/videos/OneDrive/requestfiles.mp4\" type=\"video/mp4\"></SOURCE></VIDEO></P>\n<P><FONT color=\"#999999\"><FONT face=\"arial,helvetica,sans-serif\" size=\"2\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Request files from peers within and outside the organization.&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>\n<P>There are multiple use cases where this feature can be extremely valuable – consider \"Request for Proposal\" (RFP) scenario where you need to collect bids from others, or a marketing professional accumulating quotes from various vendors for a campaign, a teacher collecting assignments , a manager reaching out for feedback from his team members or a financial rep or recruiter gathering documents from their clients- just to name a few.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=27020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 27020</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/create-a-file-request-f54aa7f8-2589-4421-b351-d415fc3b83af?storagetype=stage\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">How to create a file request</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Teams - Private Channels have their own SharePoint site collection document library</STRONG></P>\n<P>Each private channel has its own SharePoint site collection optimized for file sharing and fast provisioning. The separate site collection is to ensure access to private channel files is restricted to only members of the private channel compared to the team site where team owners have access to all the assets within the site collection.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_6.png\" style=\"width: 680px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159615i0D34777C75DE7DB6/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_6.png\" alt=\"A lock icon indicates a private channel in Microsoft Teams. Only members of private channels can see and participate in private channels that they are added to, and work with the corresponding private files.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">A lock icon indicates a private channel in Microsoft Teams. Only members of private channels can see and participate in private channels that they are added to, and work with the corresponding private files.</span></span></P>\n<P>A lock icon indicates a private channel in Microsoft Teams. Only members of private channels can see and participate in private channels that they are added to, and work with the corresponding private files.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>A private channel site collection syncs data classification and inherits guest access permissions from the site collection of the parent team. Membership to the site collection owner and member groups are kept in sync with the membership of the private channel within Teams. Any changes to the membership of Owner or Member groups in SharePoint Online will be reverted to private channel membership within four hours automatically.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?rtc=1%26filters=&amp;searchterms=50588\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 50588</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/private-channels\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">December 2019 teasers</FONT></P>\n<P>Psst, still here? Still scrolling the page looking for the rolled out goodness? If so, here’s a few teasers of what’s to come to production next month…</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Teaser #1: <STRONG>Audience targeting in SharePoint Online organizational news</STRONG> [Roadmap ID:&nbsp;<U><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?rtc=1&amp;filters=&amp;searchterms=30695\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">30695</A></U>]</LI>\n<LI>Teaser #2: <STRONG>Multiple updates to the SharePoint admin center</STRONG> [Roadmap&nbsp;IDs&nbsp;<U><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;featureid=57314\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">57314</A></U>,&nbsp;<U><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;featureid=57309\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">57309</A></U>]</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>… shhh, tell everyone.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Helpful, ongoing change management resources</FONT></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>\"<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/office365/admin/manage/stay-on-top-of-updates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Stay on top of Office 365 changes</A>\"</LI>\n<LI>\"<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/office365/admin/manage/message-center\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Message center in Office 365</A>\"</LI>\n<UL>\n<LI>Install the <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=627216\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 admin app</A>; view Message Center posts and stay current with push notifications.</LI>\n</UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365 public roadmap</A><SPAN> + pre-filtered URL for </SPAN><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?ms.url=roadmap&amp;rtc=1&amp;filters=Rolling%20Out%2CLaunched%2CIn%20Development%2CYammer%2CSharePoint%2CMicrosoft%20Stream%2COneDrive%20for%20Business\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer and Stream roadmap items</A><SPAN>.</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>SharePoint</STRONG> <A href=\"https://www.facebook.com/MSSharePoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facebook</A> | <A href=\"https://twitter.com/SharePoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A> | <A href=\"http://office.com/sharepoint/community\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Community Blog</A> | <A href=\"https://sharepoint.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>OneDrive</STRONG> <A href=\"https://www.facebook.com/OneDrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facebook</A> | <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/onedrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A> | <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SharePoint/blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">OneDrive Community Blog</A> | <A href=\"https://onedrive.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI>Follow me to catch <STRONG>news and interesting SharePoint things</STRONG>: <A href=\"https://twitter.com/mkashman\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@mkashman</A>; 48_8d1430d41019b7c2.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159621iF1EC152CC580FD65/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn1@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-31-49-246_1b79911690c7e36a.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159615i0D34777C75DE7DB6/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn57@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-43-943_ffd3734eaeabbf5d.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159616i4C403789638A5E8C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn53@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-31-39-436_ce6ba44c5fefa6fb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688849},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 [keynote]\n</H2> \n<P>\n Microsoft 365 empowers individuals, teams, and organizations to be creative, collaborative, and effective with an integrated suite of experiences that are simple, superior, smart, and secure. Jeff Teper shares the latest innovations and updates for content collaboration, employee engagement and communications, and knowledge management. Learn how the experiences in Microsoft 365—including SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer, Stream, and Office—integrate to power collaboration across devices, on the web, in desktop and mobile apps, and in the hub for teamwork, Microsoft Teams.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Presented by \n <STRONG>\n  Jeff Teper\n </STRONG> [\n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeffteper/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A> | \n <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/JeffTeper\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Twitter\n </A>], \n <STRONG>\n  Omar Shahine\n </STRONG> [\n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/omarshahine/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A> | \n <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/OmarShahine\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Twitter\n </A>], \n <STRONG>\n  Navjot Virk\n </STRONG> [\n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/navjot-virk-922729123/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A> | \n <A to top]\n  </A>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<H1>\n &nbsp;\n</H1> \n<H2>\n &nbsp;\n</H2> \n<H2>\n OneDrive powers intelligent file experiences across Microsoft 365\n</H2> \n<P>\n OneDrive is the intelligent files app for Microsoft 365. In this session we will cover upcoming innovations and explore functionalities that empower you to access, share and collaborate on all your files from anywhere while protecting your work.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Presented by \n <STRONG>\n  Randy Wong\n </STRONG> [\n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/randywong/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A> | \n <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/randybwong_\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Twitter\n </A>].\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/y_y_fkoZiRo\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/y_y_fkoZiRo/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO>\n</P> \n<P>\n Learn more about OneDrive in Microsoft 365: \n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/OneDrive/blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  https://aka.ms/OneDrive/blog\n </A> &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <A target=\"_blank\" name=\"external-file\"></A>\n <FONT size=\"2\">\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/on-demand-training-sessions-for-sharepoint-onedrive-teams-yammer/ba-p/1502851#top\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   [Back to top]\n  </A>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<H1>\n &nbsp;\n</H1> \n<H2>\n &nbsp;\n</H2> \n<H2>\n Collaboration &amp; external file sharing across Microsoft 365\n</H2> \n<P>\n Microsoft 365 provides a rich set of solutions for collaborating with users both inside and outside of your organization. Learn best practices for configuring external sharing and educating users on how to best leverage Teams, SharePoint, and OneDrive for collaborating with others.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Presented by \n <STRONG>\n  Ankita Kirti\n </STRONG> [\n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ankita-kirti-2101253a/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A> | \n <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/Ankita_Kirti21\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Twitter\n </A>].\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/uEJeMt31DQg\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/uEJeMt31DQg/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO>\n</P> \n<P>\n Learn more:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  External file sharing in Microsoft 365: \n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  OneDrive: \n  <A href=\"https://aka.ms/OneDrive/blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   https://aka.ms/OneDrive/blog\n  </A>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n <A target=\"_blank\" name=\"lists\"></A>\n <FONT size=\"2\">\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/on-demand-training-sessions-for-sharepoint-onedrive-teams-yammer/ba-p/1502851#top\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   [Back to top]\n  </A>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<H1>\n &nbsp;\n</H1> \n<H2>\n &nbsp;\n</H2> \n<H2>\n Microsoft Lists - Share and track information with across Microsoft 365\n</H2> \n<P>\n Get an early look at Microsoft Lists - your smart information tracking app in Microsoft 365.
