Lots of demos highlighting Lists home, mobile, conditional formatting, fast quick edit, ready-made templates, new views, alerts, flows and more – work tracking with built-in security and compliance.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Presented by \n <STRONG>\n  Lincoln DeMaris\n </STRONG> [\n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/lincoln-demaris-2950439/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A> | \n <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/Lincolnator\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Twitter\n </A>].\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/p64k2dWY__s\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/p64k2dWY__s/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO>\n</P> \n<P>\n Learn more:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  Microsoft Lists: \n  <A href=\"https://aka.ms/MSLists\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   https://aka.ms/MSLists\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Watch the full product demo video with Miceile Barrett: \n  <A href=\"https://aka.ms/MSLists/demo-video\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   https://aka.ms/MSLists/demo-video\n  </A>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n <A target=\"_blank\" name=\"lists-power\"></A>\n <FONT size=\"2\">\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/on-demand-training-sessions-for-sharepoint-onedrive-teams-yammer/ba-p/1502851#top\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   [Back to top]\n  </A>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<H1>\n &nbsp;\n</H1> \n<H2>\n &nbsp;\n</H2> \n<H2>\n Design productivity apps with SharePoint lists and libraries, Power Apps, and Power Automate\n</H2> \n<P>\n No-code and low-code apps have been essential in SharePoint for a long time. Additional tolls from the Power Platform - Power Apps and Power Automate - provide additional power and capability to build productivity using SharePoint lists as the data source. We also discuss the patterns to help transform customer solutions that remain on-premises and/or in legacy tool sets like InfoPath, SharePoint Designer or Access Web Apps.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Presented by \n <STRONG>\n  Chakkaradeep \"Chaks\" Chandran\n </STRONG> [\n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/chakkaradeep/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A> | \n <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/chakkaradeep\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Twitter\n </A>].\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/83Hxay_bgtw\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/83Hxay_bgtw/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO>\n</P> \n<P>\n Learn more how to \n <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/office/create-a-power-app-for-a-list-in-sharepoint-online-9338b2d2-67ac-4b81-8e67-97da27e5e9ab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  create a Power App for a list in SharePoint for Microsoft 365\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n <A target=\"_blank\" name=\"cortex\"></A>\n <FONT size=\"2\">\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/on-demand-training-sessions-for-sharepoint-onedrive-teams-yammer/ba-p/1502851#top\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   [Back to top]\n  </A>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<H1>\n &nbsp;\n</H1> \n<H2>\n &nbsp;\n</H2> \n<H2>\n Knowledge and Project Cortex – the Microsoft 365 Vision\n</H2> \n<P>\n In a world of rapid change, harnessing knowledge empowers people to act quickly, and organizations to be more resilient. Join us for this discussion as we help break through the analysis paralysis and learn from the best practices of numerous customers that have already started the journey.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Presented by \n <STRONG>\n  Melissa Torres\n </STRONG> [\n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/melissa-torres-177b0814/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A> | \n <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/MotherOfHubs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Twitter\n </A>].\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/8jPzjNlf3bM\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/8jPzjNlf3bM/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO>\n</P> \n<P>\n Learn more about the \n <A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/resources/build-modern-intranet-on-sharepoint-office-365/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Microsoft 365 intelligent intranet\n </A> and how to \n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/spsitedesigns\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  use SharePoint site designs and site scripting in Microsoft 365\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n <A target=\"_blank\" name=\"migration\"></A>\n <FONT size=\"2\">\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/on-demand-training-sessions-for-sharepoint-onedrive-teams-yammer/ba-p/1502851#top\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   [Back to top]\n  </A>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<H1>\n &nbsp;\n</H1> \n<H2>\n &nbsp;\n</H2> \n<H2>\n Migration to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Microsoft Teams in Microsoft 365, free and easy\n</H2> \n<P>\n Regardless of your organization's size, data scale or information complexity, you can migrate documents and sites into SharePoint in Office 365 successfully. Come learn about new capabilities available in the SharePoint Migration Tool (aka.ms/SPMT) in addition to performance and reliability investments to best assess, plan and implement your migration. Learn how to migrate file shares, doc libraries, and SharePoint Server 2013 sites and more using the SharePoint Migration Tool and new capabilities to simplify large file share migrations through SharePoint Admin Center.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Presented by \n <STRONG>\n  Hani Loza \n </STRONG>[\n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/haniloza/\" target=\"_blank\" </A>].\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/Tf3Yp2megmA\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" to top]\n  </A>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<H1>\n &nbsp;\n</H1> \n<H2>\n &nbsp;\n</H2> \n<H2>\n SharePoint developer overview\n</H2> \n<P>\n Discover how every experience can become more collaborative and engaging with the Microsoft 365 platform – starting with SharePoint. SharePoint serves as the center of collaboration – where content is stored and communicated across teams, departments, and the whole organization. See the latest development advancements and new capabilities for SharePoint. You’ll take away new ideas for building next-generation collaboration applications and get the essential roadmap for custom apps in your organization.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Presented by \n <STRONG>\n  Luca Bandinelli\n </STRONG> [\n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/luca-bandinelli-37b209/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A>].\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/sbcFwUklGGU\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/sbcFwUklGGU/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO>\n</P> \n<P>\n Learn more about the \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/dev/spfx/sharepoint-framework-overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  SharePoint Framework\n </A> (SPFx).\n</P> \n<P>\n <A target=\"_blank\" name=\"pnp\"></A>\n <FONT size=\"2\">\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/on-demand-training-sessions-for-sharepoint-onedrive-teams-yammer/ba-p/1502851#top\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   [Back to top]\n  </A>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<H1>\n &nbsp;\n</H1> \n<H2>\n &nbsp;\n</H2> \n<H2>\n Jumpstart your projects with community projects from Patterns and Practices (PnP)\n</H2> \n<P>\n Across SharePoint and Microsoft 365, an extremely active developer community has come together with SharePoint engineering and have released numerous valuable reusable components and controls, which will simplify design, implementation, and management of Microsoft 365 and on-premises deployments. Join this session to hear the latest updates around the different guidance, samples, and reusable assets built by the community for the community.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Presented by \n <STRONG>\n  Vesa Juvonen\n </STRONG> [\n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/vesajuvonen/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A> | \n <A href=\"https://twitter.com/vesajuvonen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Twitter\n </A>].\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/3a1LUUbW8NE\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/3a1LUUbW8NE/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO>\n</P> \n<P>\n Learn more:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://aka.ms/m365pnp\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Collection of tools and guidance\n  </A> (extend Microsoft 365; best practices)\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://aka.ms/m365-community-docs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Existing set of documentation\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://lookbook.microsoft.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Microsoft Look Book\n  </A>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n <A target=\"_blank\" name=\"security\"></A>\n <FONT size=\"2\">\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/on-demand-training-sessions-for-sharepoint-onedrive-teams-yammer/ba-p/1502851#top\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   [Back to top]\n  </A>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<H1>\n &nbsp;\n</H1> \n<H2>\n &nbsp;\n</H2> \n<H2>\n Security and compliance in SharePoint and OneDrive\n</H2> \n<P>\n Safeguard your devices, personal information, and files from being compromised. This session explores the core tenets of platform security, secure access and sharing, information governance, and compliance across SharePoint, Microsoft OneDrive, and Microsoft 365.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Presented by \n <STRONG>\n  Sesha Mani\n </STRONG> [\n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/seshamani/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  LinkedIn\n </A> | \n <A href=\"https://twitter.com/SeshaManiS\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Twitter\n </A>].\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/uCDOtPgP7Gs\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/uCDOtPgP7Gs/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO>\n</P> \n<P>\n Learn more about \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/compliance/plan-for-security-and-compliance\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  security and compliance in Microsoft 365\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n <FONT size=\"2\">\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/on-demand-training-sessions-for-sharepoint-onedrive-teams-yammer/ba-p/1502851#top\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   [Back to top]\n  </A>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<P>\n Well, if you've made it this far then your mind is full. And now, the tech shall follow.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Thanks for learning with us :),\n</P> \n<P>\n Mark\n</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 14 Jul 2020 22:47:53 +0000","feedId":13333,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"e081002c251cdbf62bdb65d5fe6ea830","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Mark Kashman","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688840},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"IA Value | Packaging and templatizing SharePoint sites, content, and structure","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/ia-value-packaging-and-templatizing-sharepoint-sites-content-and/ba-p/1521945","description":"<P>[Co-authored by&nbsp;<LI-USER uid=\"149\"></LI-USER>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<LI-USER uid=\"96\"></LI-USER>&nbsp;with guidance from&nbsp;<LI-USER uid=\"5852\"></LI-USER>]</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Having a solid information architecture (IA) is an important prerequisite for realizing a well-maintained and well-performing intranet. Good IA helps people find what they need and accomplish the tasks they want to complete – in a way that makes sense to them. A great IA helps improve user adoption, satisfaction, and productivity, reduce IT cost, reduce information overload, and minimize governance compliance and bad information risk.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Great IA takes good planning. It requires knowledge of the domain or content, understanding the user and user experiences, and awareness of approaches and best practices in Microsoft SharePoint. An important best practice is providing a consistent experience for everyone.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IA-Value_001_top-diagram.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/205306i4E491AD65E4EB835/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IA-Value_001_top-diagram.jpg\" alt=\"SharePoint powers your entire intelligent intranet and the intranet architecture (IA) is vital. The above diagram references logical site groupings and adherence to design consistency throughout.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">SharePoint powers your entire intelligent intranet and the intranet architecture (IA) is vital. The above diagram references logical site groupings and adherence to design consistency throughout.</span></span></P>\n<P>Many people complain that going from site to site across their organization’s intranet feels disjointed. Each site looks different from the other with similar types of information scattered in different places. While it’s great to allow site owners flexibility, without some basic design principles and guidelines that can be applied consistently, the impact is costly and time consuming – for both site owners and visitors.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The best way to ensure a positive experience for site owners and visitors is to establish design patterns for your intranet sites and use site designs and templates to ensure that the patterns are applied consistently on all sites.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Below, we will dive into the following areas + resources throughout:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Ensure consistency across all sites throughout your intranet scripting</STRONG></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Organizing with hubs that can organize themselves</STRONG></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Utilizing Microsoft Teams templates</STRONG></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Manage who can create Microsoft 365 Groups</STRONG></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>On to the details…</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Ensure consistency across all sites throughout your intranet scripting</H1>\n<P>When people in your organization create new SharePoint sites, you want to ensure a level of consistency across all sites or sets of sites. For example, you may need consistent:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Branding, theming for look and feel</LI>\n<LI>Library or list configurations to help people achieve more and ensure metadata alignment</LI>\n<LI>Functionality by configuring settings, features, extensions, and solutions</LI>\n<LI>You may also have detailed site provisioning scripts, such as using example designs from the <A href=\"https://lookbook.microsoft.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Look Book</A>, that can be applied each time a new site is created.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IA-Value_002_apply-site-design.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/205307iA135D552D3FF2600/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IA-Value_002_apply-site-design.gif\" alt=\"Applying a new site design to a SharePoint site.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Applying a new site design to a SharePoint site.</span></span></P>\n<P>All help make your intranet more governable, consistent, predictable, and more usable on day one – for each project, team, event; a more automated, intranet-as-a-service – at scale.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Let’s breakdown how it is done…</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Planning your site designs</STRONG></P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Audience targeting site designs (for sites and hubs)</LI>\n<LI>Setting a single default design for your tenant</LI>\n<LI>Applying to existing sites, tackling updates after the initial setup</LI>\n<LI>Extending their power via PnP and reference <A href=\"https://lookbook.microsoft.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Look Book</A> examples</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>When people in your organization create new SharePoint sites, you often need to ensure some level of consistency. For example, you may need proper branding and theming applied to each new site. Site designs are like a template. They can be used each time a new site is created to apply a consistent set of actions. They can also be applied to existing modern sites (group-connected team sites and communication sites). Most actions typically affect the site itself, such as setting the theme or creating lists. And a site design can also include other actions, such as recording the new site URL to a log or sending a notification.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IA-Value_003_site-design-progress.jpg\" style=\"width: 825px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/205309i28B946F69188276E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IA-Value_003_site-design-progress.jpg\" alt=\"When the actions in the scripts are completed, SharePoint displays detailed results of those actions in a progress pane.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">When the actions in the scripts are completed, SharePoint displays detailed results of those actions in a progress pane.</span></span></P>\n<P>Learn more about how to <A href=\"https://aka.ms/spsitedesigns\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">design and use SharePoint site designs and site scripts</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Organizing with hubs that can organize themselves</H1>\n<P>SharePoint hubs connect and organize sites based on preferred organizational attributes. You can associate both existing sites and enable new site creation from within hubs themselves. And associated sites can be a mix of team sites and/or communication sites.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Once connected, hubs determine the connected sites’ theming, navigation, search, news, and content rollup, and visitor permissions. And to take this even further, you can use site designs to further customize (adapt) each connected site to programmatically assert content and site customization for desired outcomes.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The combination helps ensure consistency across projects, departments, divisions, regions, as you organize and save time throughout your teams – throughout your intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Here are a few examples:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Ensuring a consistent approach for project sites – and facilitating management of a portfolio of client-specific projects. </STRONG>A company has a business unit that does projects for a variety of customers. There are multiple projects for each customer. There is a client manager for each customer who needs an easy way to access and roll up content across all the projects for the customers whose portfolios they manager. The business unit wants a way to ensure that each project is executed in a similar way, leveraging resources from the Project Management Office (PMO). The architecture decision is to create a hub for each customer – and use the hub site to store shared assets (such as deliverable templates and customer contact information) for the customer portfolio. To ensure that all project sites are created consistently, they use a site design for project team sites. Each time a new project is created from the customer hub, a script is run to apply the design template, ensuring that both look and feel as well as shared metadata is applied consistently in all project sites. The key outcome is that all project sites share a common structure and when team members work on more than one project, they can easily find and share the information they need. Moreover, the client relationship manager for each client can use the hub “roll ups” for easy visibility into the status of key deliverables across all projects in the portfolio.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Sharing consistent metadata and home page design. </STRONG>The global legal team for a large organization wants to ensure that all local legal sites follow a consistent design and share common metadata for legal documents. A site design is created that incorporates a home page layout for all legal sites, a standard set of pages, and a document library with shared metadata attributes. The script is run for all new legal sites that associate to the Global Legal hub but also for local legal sites that are linked rather than associated to the Global Legal hub. In this example, local legal teams have the option of associating to a geographic hub rather than Global Legal if the sites are created in local language. Shared metadata values are stored as managed metadata so that when there are updates to values, all the legal sites are immediately updated. When a new column is required, the site script is re-run to ensure that all sites are updated with the new column. This approach empowers local legal teams to focus on content rather than structure as the create their legal sites. It also ensures that search consistently finds critical assets no matter where they are located with the use of shared metadata for all legal sites.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Creating a common look and feel for intranet sites.</STRONG> While many organizations leverage more than one hub for different geographies, functions, or portfolios, some smaller organizations start with one hub for the intranet. To ensure that each intranet site starts with a consistent look and feel, sites are created with a site design that ensures, as an example, that the Site Owner is always displayed in the lower left hand corner of the home page and frequently needed links are always in a narrow column on the right towards the top of the home page. By ensuring that each site follows a consistent pattern, visitors know that they can always easily find someone to help them (by scrolling to the bottom of the page) and that the site owner has carefully curated links to the most frequently needed items and applications on the right side of the home page. This ensures that visitors can quickly execute their top tasks on each site. However, since the pages follow patterns aligned to user expectations, visitors also know that they will be able to browse and search for content to help them find what they need and get back to work.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>Planning your hub sites </STRONG></P>\n<P>SharePoint hubs provide an important building block for your intranet. They are the \"connective tissue\" you use when organizing families of team sites and communication sites together.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>One of the key principles of modern intranets based on Microsoft SharePoint is that each unit of work should get a separate site collection to optimally manage governance and growth over time. Each communication site and Microsoft 365 group-connected team site is created as a site collection that can have its own permissions. A hub (commonly created from a communication site) should also be considered its own unit of work that brings together numerous other sites.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>All organizations need intranets that make it easy to align experiences with the way you work and that can adapt to the inevitable changes in the way you work. This is a key benefit provided by SharePoint hubs; they model relationships as links, rather than hierarchy or ownership, so that you can adapt to the changes in the way you work in a dynamic, changing world.</P>\n<P>Learn more about <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/planning-hub-sites\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">planning your SharePoint hub sites</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Setting up a hub site design</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IA-Value_004_hub-applies-site-design.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/205310iCE2508D52629A3CE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IA-Value_004_hub-applies-site-design.gif\" alt=\"Sites can inherit the hubs site design when they are initially associated to the hub.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Sites can inherit the hubs site design when they are initially associated to the hub.</span></span></STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Easy for people to create sites from hub</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IA-Value_005_sample-hub-web-mobile.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/205312i99D069A424694F20/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IA-Value_005_sample-hub-web-mobile.jpg\" alt=\"The Contoso Travel HR communication shown here as a part of the HR hub site, Web view on the left, within the SharePoint mobile app on the right.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The Contoso Travel HR communication shown here as a part of the HR hub site, Web view on the left, within the SharePoint mobile app on the right.</span></span></STRONG></P>\n<P>You can automate tasks such as creating, removing, or controlling permissions for hubs. You can also control a site’s properties when it is becomes a part of an established hub – its theme, list and library structures, content, permissions, etc..</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Learn more about <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/office/set-up-your-sharepoint-hub-site-e2daed64-658c-4462-aeaf-7d1a92eba098\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">setting up your hub sites</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Utilizing Microsoft Teams templates</H1>\n<P>Teams templates are pre-built definitions of a team's structure designed around a business need or project. You can use Teams templates to quickly create rich collaboration spaces with channels for different topics and preinstall apps to pull in mission-critical content and services. Teams templates provide a predefined team structure that can help you easily create consistent teams across your organization.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IA-Value_006_Teams-templates.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/205313i75A395D7117B2E8D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IA-Value_006_Teams-templates.jpg\" alt=\"Use Teams templates for people to save time and adhere to predefined team structure.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Use Teams templates for people to save time and adhere to predefined team structure.</span></span></P>\n<P>Learn more about how to <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/get-started-with-teams-templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">get started using Teams templates</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Manage who can create Microsoft 365 Groups</H1>\n<P>AKA, manage who can create sites, teams, plans, and more. Creating Microsoft 365 Groups is meant to be easy for collaboration agility. Depending on your business, however, you might want to control who can create groups. You can restrict Microsoft 365 Groups creation to the members of a particular security group in Azure Active Directory (AAD). In turn, this equates to whom can create Teams teams, SharePoint sites, Planner plans, etc. It is easy for admins to establish and manage who can and cannot create Microsoft 365 Groups using Windows PowerShell.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IA-Value_007_M365-Groups.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/205314i5F86F7DD5E5CA2DF/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IA-Value_007_M365-Groups.jpg\" alt=\"Admins manage who can and cannot create Microsoft 365 Groups.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Admins manage who can and cannot create Microsoft 365 Groups.</span></span></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/admin/create-groups/office-365-groups\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A> and get started today.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Last thoughts</H1>\n<P>One of the most important goals for well-used intranets is to share and leverage organizational knowledge. Traditional intranets are typically not much more than a collection of <EM>sites</EM>. Modern intranets provide a collection of <EM>experiences</EM> that align to business outcome goals and initiatives. Creating great experiences for users means that you need to focus on the content and task stories that the visitor needs to accomplish – not just the content and stories that the site owner wants to tell. Establishing a consistent (and flexible) pattern for sites helps site owners of each individual site optimize their information architecture to create the best visitor experience. Stories that can be told, read, and understood.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Site designs and site scripts allow you to quickly and consistently create sites that incorporate your organization’s preferred design patterns and governance. This allows site owners to focus on quality content instead of page layout and ensures that site visitors can quickly find what they need. Hubs extend the ability to create optimal experiences by allowing you to create families of related sites that work in concert to improve user experiences with shared navigation, scoped search, consistent designs and connected content.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Package and templatize to optimize and balance. The happiest of sites and site owners are those that spend time creating content – furthering the business – not fumbling through site structure. And with known structure, IT can better support, meet “customer” expectation, and maintain a realm of policy and predictability.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Resources</H1>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/intelligentintranet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Intelligent intranet resource center</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://lookbook.microsoft.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Look Book</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/spsitedesigns\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint site design and site script overview</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/dev/features/hub-site/hub-site-overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint hub site overview</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/information-architecture-modern-experience\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Information architecture in modern SharePoint</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/get-started-with-teams-templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Get started with Teams templates</A>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/get-started-with-retail-teams-templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Get started with Retail Teams templates</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/expand-teams-across-your-org/healthcare/healthcare-templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Get started with Teams templates for Healthcare organizations</A></LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/teamwork-governance/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Plan for governance to transform teamwork with Microsoft 365</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/admin/create-groups/plan-for-groups-governance?view=o365-worldwide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Plan for governance in Office 365 Groups</A></LI>\n<LI>“<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/designing-your-intranet-the-intrazone-podcast/ba-p/1153032\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Designing your intranet</A>\" an interview with Melissa Torres and Susan Hanley on <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TheIntrazone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Intrazone</A>.</LI>\n<LI>“<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/on-demand-training-sessions-for-sharepoint-onedrive-teams-yammer/ba-p/1502851#intranet-arch\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Architecting your intranet</A>” on-demand webinar with Melissa Torres</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Thanks, <A href=\"https://susanhanley.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><STRONG>Susan Hanley</STRONG></A> – Microsoft MVP and IA / KM expert and<A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/mark-kashman/\" target=\"_self\"><STRONG> Mark Kashman</STRONG></A> – Our goal is to help our customers move to the cloud with confidence.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Today, we’re pleased to announce Mover is now available to Microsoft 365 customers worldwide. Since&nbsp;<A href=\"https://blogs.microsoft.com/blog/2019/10/21/microsoft-acquires-mover-to-simplify-and-speed-file-migration-to-microsoft-365/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft announced the acquisition of Mover</A>, our migration specialists have been working hard to bring the migration service, including admin-led and self-service offerings, to more customers as demand to move content to the cloud continues to grow.</P>\n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorMark Kashman_0\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Globe_plus_MS-Mover_logos_header-graphic.jpg\" style=\"width: 976px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/172293iFAB86054C0A67B8A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Globe_plus_MS-Mover_logos_header-graphic.jpg\" alt=\"Globe_plus_MS-Mover_logos_header-graphic.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://aka.ms/mover\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mover</A> helps make it easier than ever for customers to migrate files to Microsoft 365 – for free.&nbsp;Start your cloud migrations today.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">More about Mover</FONT></P>\n<P>Mover supports migration from over a dozen cloud service providers – including Box, Dropbox, Egnyte, and Google Drive – into OneDrive and SharePoint, enabling seamless file collaboration across Microsoft 365 apps and services, including the Office apps and Microsoft Teams. The Mover team also brings deep expertise and migration technology, which advances Microsoft’s commitment to providing organizations of all sizes with the right tools, people and partners to successfully migrate to the Microsoft Cloud.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" Juvonen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162177i86B6A4A5F31C7F8A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn9@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-32-852_8854dece277a1ad2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688837},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"Updates to SharePoint default site themes: Coming June 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/updates-to-sharepoint-default-site-themes-coming-june-2020/ba-p/1387867","description":"<P>Over the last year, SharePoint has embraced the new Microsoft Office icons that were announced in late 2018.&nbsp; A large part of this change is the transition of the SharePoint identity from blue to teal, signaling a shift in the identifying color scheme. In order to best embrace this shift, we are now working to complete an update from blue to teal across the product more broadly. Updating the SharePoint default theme from blue to teal is the final step to adopting the new SharePoint identity.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>With this update, you will see classic and modern SharePoint communication sites and team sites (new and existing) update to the teal theme if they have not been customized. A site is considered customized when a custom theme has been selected in the Change the look panel or customizations have been made for classic. This will not impact your sites in any way beyond changing colors from blue to teal as seen in the images below.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>How will this impact you?</STRONG></P>\n<P>All new sites from the time of change to teal will be created with teal as the default theme color. This change will happen for any communication site, regardless of modern or classic and for classic team sites. Any modern team site that is group connected will still be created in the existing color selection associated to the M365 group.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This update will not impact custom themes, settings, or the content and structure of sites. This update will only change the theme of new and existing sites that have not been customized.&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Current blue theme on a communication site:</STRONG></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"BlueThemedSPSite.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/193756i83C350541204D201/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"BlueThemedSPSite.png\" alt=\"BlueThemedSPSite.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>New Teal theme on a communication site:</STRONG></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"TealThemedSPSite.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191866iE8A8CFF68617FD7F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"TealThemedSPSite.png\" alt=\"SharePoint Communication Site - Teal Theme\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">SharePoint Communication Site - Teal Theme</span></span></P>\n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorCathy Dew_1\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<P><STRONG>Do I need to do anything?</STRONG></P>\n<P>This update is automatic, and no action is required by admins or users.</P>\n<P>If you decide to keep the blue theme - or just want to change the theme - site owners can <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Change-the-look-of-your-SharePoint-site-06bbadc3-6b04-4a60-9d14-894f6a170818\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">edit the theme</A> in the Change the look panel. This change can be made at any time, and each site will require a manual change.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To automate this process, create a site design that is configured to apply a custom theme. Site designs are a reusable script that will allow site owners and creators to easily apply your organization’s preferred default theme in site settings. <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepoint/dev/declarative-customization/site-design-overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about SharePoint site design scripts</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Below is the sample code of the blue theme if this theme is preferred:</P>\n<P><SPAN>Blue standard theme JSON code:</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<LI-CODE lang=\"powershell\">{\n\n&nbsp; \"themePrimary\": \"#0078d4\",\n\n&nbsp; \"themeLighterAlt\": \"#eff6fc\",\n\n&nbsp; \"themeLighter\": \"#deecf9\",\n\n&nbsp; \"themeLight\": \"#c7e0f4\",\n\n&nbsp; \"themeTertiary\": \"#71afe5\",\n\n&nbsp; \"black\": \"#000000\",\n\n&nbsp; \"white\": \"#ffffff\"\n\n}</LI-CODE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>If you do nothing?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Starting in June, sites that have not been customized will switch from blue to teal and does not require any action from you. &nbsp;New sites you create will default to the teal theme until you change it either through the Change the look panel or by using a custom Site Design.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This change will not impact any custom themes or settings you have currently installed and applied within your tenant. We do not have an opt-out option for administrators.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>What site types and states will be impacted:</STRONG></P>\n<TABLE>\n<TBODY>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"225\">\n<P>Site Kashman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191364i562F8984C02479D4/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn9@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-31-29-656_96a6449c13a09df9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688845},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"Migration updates – Migration Manager general availability and SPMT adds Teams support","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/migration-updates-migration-manager-general-availability-and/ba-p/1419251","description":"<P>Microsoft focuses on providing a seamless move to Microsoft 365 with as much expertise and tooling we and our ecosystem can offer – across the globe. Our goal is to help move to the cloud with confidence.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We are pleased to share <STRONG>Migration Manager</STRONG> – part of the SharePoint admin center - has completed rollout to Microsoft 365, including commercial and government cloud customers. We, too, have updated the <STRONG>SharePoint Migration Tool</STRONG> (SPMT) – adding support for migrating content to Microsoft Teams. Our migration specialists have been working hard to bring the migration service, including admin-led and self-service offerings, to more customers as demand to move content to the cloud continues to grow.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"MigrationUpdate_001_Top-graphic.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/194595iD7E90EBA548A3E7F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"MigrationUpdate_001_Top-graphic.jpg\" alt=\"Microsoft offers a diverse migration tool and services portfolio along with a strong partner ecosystem – collectively the broadest set of offerings to assist your migration into Microsoft 365.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft offers a diverse migration tool and services portfolio along with a strong partner ecosystem – collectively the broadest set of offerings to assist your migration into Microsoft 365.</span></span></P>\n<P>Let’s dive into the details…</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Migrate on-premises content with Migration Manager in the SharePoint admin center</H2>\n<P>Migration Manager is now generally available. It is a key part of the SharePoint admin center, to help orchestrate and simplify management of large-scale migrations. Admins can add and manage multiple migration agents to centrally orchestrate all migration activities.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"MigrationUpdate_002_MM-scale-across-clients.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/194596i211F75BF6B0F6956/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"MigrationUpdate_002_MM-scale-across-clients.jpg\" alt=\"SharePoint admin center - Migration manager, showing scale across clients.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">SharePoint admin center - Migration manager, showing scale across clients.</span></span></P>\n<P>Migration Manager lets you migrate your on-premises file share content to Microsoft 365. Through a simple interface within the SharePoint admin center, admins can manage thousands of migration tasks across multiple machines.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"MigrationUpdate_003_MM-scale-across-tasks.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/194597iD665853C76E4BD87/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"MigrationUpdate_003_MM-scale-across-tasks.jpg\" alt=\"SharePoint admin center - Migration manager, showing scale across tasks; one task details.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">SharePoint admin center - Migration manager, showing scale across tasks; one task details.</span></span></P>\n<P>The new task view in the SharePoint admin center provides one location to create and monitor progress. For each task, there is a task detail pane to download summary reports and change settings for individual tasks – all centrally managed within the SharePoint admin experience.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Since initial phases of roll out, Migration Manager has made performance improvements and achieved further accessibility compliance. In addition, you can now:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Specify a document library and a folder for your migration destination</LI>\n<LI>Paste a destination URL (SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams); includes automatic scanning.</LI>\n<LI>Add an increased number of tasks to your migration</LI>\n<LI>Sort and search tasks</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Note: This product is intended for global and SharePoint administrators of commercial and government cloud Microsoft 365 (Office 365) customers.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Simplify large file share migrations – <A href=\"https://aka.ms/MigrationManager\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">learn more about Migration Manager</A> (improved documentation and troubleshooting guide).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) now supports migrating content directly to Microsoft Teams</H2>\n<P>The SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) is a simple and fast solution to help you migrate content from on-premises SharePoint Server sites and file shares to SharePoint, OneDrive, and now Microsoft Teams in Microsoft 365. It is designed to help you bring your information to the cloud and take advantage of the latest collaboration, intelligence, and security solutions within Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"MigrationUpdate_004_SPMT.jpg\" style=\"width: 848px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/194598iF465C0B10393C13B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"MigrationUpdate_004_SPMT.jpg\" alt=\"Welcome to the SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) – migrate file shares or Sharepoint Server sites to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams – all in Microsoft 365.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Welcome to the SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) – migrate file shares or Sharepoint Server sites to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams – all in Microsoft 365.</span></span></P>\n<P>Using the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://aka.ms/spmt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Migration Tool</A>, you can quickly bring your most important content to Microsoft Teams to create a more open, digital environment.&nbsp;The tool makes it easy to select Teams that you are an owner of, to then set them as the destination(s) for the migration. The tool will also let you select what specific channel you want the content to go into.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"MigrationUpdate_005_SPMT-wizard.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/194599i23FAAD0DBAE5EF6B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"MigrationUpdate_005_SPMT-wizard.jpg\" alt=\"Login to SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT), select where you want to move content to, review and start migrating to Microsoft 365 today.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Login to SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT), select where you want to move content to, review and start migrating to Microsoft 365 today.</span></span></P>\n<P>Since each team in Microsoft Teams has a team site in SharePoint Online, the SharePoint Migration Tool provides a quick and simple solution to bringing your files to Microsoft Teams in Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>Recent and additional SPMT updates:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>SharePoint Server 2016 support (public preview)</STRONG> | You can now have SharePoint Server 2016 as the source environment to move content into Microsoft 365.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Simpler OneDrive migration using user account</STRONG> | Simply enter the email address of the user that you want to migrate content into or continue using the URL.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Smart URL handling to reduce SharePoint migration complexity</STRONG> | We have improved the tool to make it easier to copy and paste a SharePoint URL. You no longer need to truncate the URL to paste it in to the tool.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>One-click reporting for issues and to provide feedback</STRONG></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Download the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://spmtreleasescus.blob.core.windows.net/betainstall/default.htm\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Migration Tool (public preview)</A>&nbsp;today - supporting migration from SharePoint Server 2010, SharePoint Server 2013, SharePoint Server 2016 (public preview) and network or local file shares.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Learn more about&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/sharepointmigration/what-is-supported-spmt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">what features the SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT) supports</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Want to learn more? Join us for the “Migrating content into Microsoft 365 AMA” within the Microsoft Tech Community (Wed. June 17<SUP>th</SUP>, 9:00 am)</H2>\n<P>This will be a 1-hour Ask Microsoft Anything (AMA) within the Microsoft Tech Community. An AMA is like an “Ask Me Anything (AMA)” on Reddit, providing the opportunity for the community to ask questions and have a discussion with a panel of Microsoft experts taking questions about the SharePoint admin center Migration Manager, SharePoint Migration Tool (SPMT; content from on-premises, Mover (cloud-to-cloud), FastTrack, and our 3<SUP>rd</SUP>-party migration ecosystem.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><U>What</U>: <STRONG>Migrating content into Microsoft 365 AMA</STRONG></LI>\n<LI><U>When</U>: <FONT color=\"#FF0000\">[Rescheduled]</FONT> Wednesday, <STRONG>June 17<SUP>th</SUP></STRONG>, 2020 from 9:00 – 10:00 AM PT</LI>\n<LI><U>Where</U>: <A href=\"http://aka.ms/MigratingContentIntoMicrosoft365AMA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Migrating Content into Microsoft 365 AMA</A> space within the Microsoft Tech Community site</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>This AMA is to answer your questions about the products, tools, and services. We, too, will share details around the above announcements. And as always, we appreciate your input on what you want to see next – aka, what is missing to make your migrations smooth and successful.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Use more of what SharePoint and Microsoft 365 offer, and let us know what you think</H2>\n<P>In addition to the above updates now rolling out to Microsoft 365, we encourage you to learn more about all migration offerings. Mover supports numerous cloud-to-cloud migration scenarios alongside our the SharePoint Migration Tool (<A href=\"https://aka.ms/SPMT\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SPMT</A>) which targets migrating content from on-premises SharePoint sites and file shares to Microsoft 365, <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/fasttrack/microsoft-365\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">FastTrack planning</A> and onboarding, and a strong migration partner ecosystem – collectively the broadest set of offerings to assist your migration into Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Related migration resources:</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://mover.io/guides/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mover migration planning guides</A></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Microsoft Ignite 2019 session:</STRONG> “<A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions/81518\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Migration to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Microsoft Teams in Microsoft 365, free and easy</A>” <STRONG>[</STRONG><STRONG>BRK3006</STRONG><STRONG>]</STRONG></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/SPMT\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Migration Tool</A> (SPMT)</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MigrationManager\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Migration Manager</A>&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>\"<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-SharePoint-Blog/Move-with-Mover-Migration-a-bonus-Microsoft-Ignite-2019-episode/ba-p/988040\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Move with Mover migration</A>\" – The Intrazone podcast episode discussion with the migration engineering leads about all migration offerings (blog + embedded episode audio)</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Our goal is to empower you and every person on your team to achieve, and move, more. Let us know what you need next. We are always open to feedback via&nbsp;<A href=\"https://sharepoint.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A>&nbsp;and continued dialog in the&nbsp;<A href=\"http://office.com/sharepoint/community\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint community</A>&nbsp;within the Microsoft Tech Community —and we always have an eye on tweets to&nbsp;<A href=\"http://twitter.com/sharepoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@SharePoint</A>. Let us know.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Thanks, Mark Kashman, senior product manager (SharePoint/Microsoft)</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 09 Jun 2020 22:17:11 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"The Intrazone, partner edition: “Fujitsu” [innovative scanning solutions]","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/the-intrazone-partner-edition-fujitsu-innovative-scanning/ba-p/1582247","description":"<P>\n The Intrazone continues to spotlight \n <STRONG>\n  Microsoft partners\n </STRONG>, the people and companies who deliver solutions and services to empower our customers to achieve more.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In our fifth partner episode, we talk with \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeffwillinger/\" target=\"_self\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Jeff Willinger\n  </STRONG>\n </A> (Digital Workplace Innovator and Microsoft MVP (Fujitsu)) and his customer, \n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/pschweiss/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Pete Schweiss\n  </A>\n </STRONG> (Data and Support Specialist | Boys Hope Girls Hope (BHGH)). BHGH is a not-for-profit helping academically capable and motivated children-in-need to meet their full potential. Fujitsu delivers innovative scanning solutions and services to streamline operations and overcome critical business productivity challenges.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n We talk with them about how the Fujitsu solution helps BHGH digitize thousands of paper documents to minimize both physical space requirements and improve both usability and searchability. They, too, shared their planning and considerations for Project Cortex, to further minimize indexing and metadata management to further remove humans from the tagging and sorting process. The real goal is to provide more time spent creating opportunities and education through college – to develop future “graduate stories of hope.”\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n OK, Partner (edition), on with the show…\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <IFRAME classify]","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/the-intrazone-partner-edition-colligo-manage-capture-and/ba-p/1304450","description":"<P>\n The Intrazone continues to spotlight \n <STRONG>\n  Microsoft partners\n </STRONG>, the people and companies who deliver solutions and services to empower our customers to achieve more.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In our fourth partner episode, we talk with \n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/rolandreddekop/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Roland Reddekop\n  </A> \n </STRONG>(Presales Engineer | Colligo) and his customers, \n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jean-francois-thibeault-122b3624/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Jean-Francois Thibeault\n  </A>\n </STRONG> (VP | Ovivo) and \n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/michel-guenette-499b5210/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Michel Guenette\n  </A>\n </STRONG> (VP of Technology | Ovivo) – both from Ovivo – a global provider of equipment, technology and systems producing the purest water and treating the most challenging wastewater in the industry. Colligo helps organizations to simplify knowledge management and compliance and get the most from their SharePoint investment.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n We talk with them about how the Colligo solution helps Ovivo achieve effective knowledge transfer between and across projects (content and people). Their traditional methods orphaned a lot of documents and emails. Colligo helped them centralize where content was stored while making it easier for people to tag and place that content from their preferred tool – Outlook; bridging Exchange into SharePoint.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n OK, Partner (edition), on with the show…\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <IFRAME WWBD. AKA “What would Bob do?” – a common question I ask myself often. And often the answer lies in \n <A href=\"https://www.bob1german.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Bob’s blog\n </A>, where this episode sprouts its roots. We invite you to \n <EM>\n  figure it out with Bob\n </EM> – Bob German that is.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/bgerman/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Bob German\n  </A>\n </STRONG> is a Cloud developer advocate at Microsoft and a friend of the community who consistently puts complex concepts into simple, meaningful terms. He also is a contributor of samples and ideas via \n <A href=\"https://pnp.github.io/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  GitHub / PnP\n </A>. Using a few of his recent blog posts as a guide, we cover the evolution of SharePoint as a modern development platform, alongside the approach to brand and customize SharePoint – to develop once and deploying into SharePoint and Microsoft Teams. You’ll gain clarity and numerous tips and tricks along the way.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Listen to podcast below\n </STRONG>.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15626303/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TheIntrazone-iTunes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Subscribe to The Intrazone podcast\n  </STRONG>\n </A>\n <STRONG>\n  ! \n </STRONG>\n <STRONG>\n  <A href=\"http://intrazone.mpsn.libsynpro.com/figuring-it-out-with-bob\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   And listen to episode 55 now\n  </A>\n </STRONG> + show links and more below.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"BobGerman_profile-pic.jpg\" style=\"width: 360px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/212958i4126B15C9F7C125E/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"BobGerman_profile-pic.jpg\" alt=\"Intrazone guest Bob German (Cloud developer advocate, focused on Teams and Microsoft Graph development - show about the SharePoint intelligent intranet (aka.ms/TheIntrazone)\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The Intrazone, a show about the SharePoint intelligent intranet (aka.ms/TheIntrazone)</span></span>\n</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 18 Aug 2020 15:00:00
