Kashman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/212958i4126B15C9F7C125E/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn94@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-31-29-773_180ba030c6941a80.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179180i96112720B966E51C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn25@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-29-357_56c9616debbcf9dc.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171727iF505166B58BEFBBF/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn10@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-31-42-249_36edcb65c8188f6d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688811},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"SharePoint Roadmap Pitstop: January 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-january-2020/ba-p/1139511","description":"<P>How are those New Year’s resolutions coming along? We hope well. And we want to let you know that the SharePoint team has been resolving left and right -&nbsp; a little page version history here, a little image resizing there, with a nice bit of custom search results page enablement. This month, the SharePoint Roadmap Pitstop is filled with a lot of goodness for everyone. Resolve, resolve, resolve.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Consider this the all-inclusive recap plus the embedded <STRONG>Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop: January 2020</STRONG> podcast episode – the bonus monthly audible companion – both to help answer, \"What's rolling out now for SharePoint and related technologies into Microsoft 365?\"</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To answer that question, <A href=\"http://intrazone.mpsn.libsynpro.com/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-january-2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">listen</A> and scroll below (info, links and screenshots galore) to stay informed on what features and updates arrived this past month - plus a few <SPAN style=\"text-decoration: line-through;\">teasers</SPAN> resolutions of what's to come:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/12944747/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In the podcast episode, I interview <STRONG>Nicole Woon</STRONG> (<A href=\"https://twitter.com/NovelNicole\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A> | <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/niwoon/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">LinkedIn</A>), a program manager at Microsoft. Recently, she helped update the “<STRONG>Next Steps</STRONG>” experience for SharePoint site; the panel of guidance you get when you click the megaphone icon at the top of the site near<STRONG> Help</STRONG>. We dig into the design, customer use and future action cards that help customers have a great first-run experience with SharePoint sites. Plus, we talk about her involvement in <A href=\"https://swe.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Society of Women Engineers</A> (SWE; <A href=\"https://twitter.com/SWETalk\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@SWETalk</A> &amp; <A href=\"https://soundcloud.com/swepodcasts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SWE podcast) </A>and how it helped jump start her Microsoft career.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_0.jpeg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168042i028A0F8706277A60/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_0.jpeg\" alt=\"Nicole Woon, program manager (SharePoint/Microsoft) [Intrazone guest]\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Nicole Woon, program manager (SharePoint/Microsoft) [Intrazone guest]</span></span></P>\n<P>All the features listed below began rolling out to Targeted Release customers in Office 365 as of January 2020 (possibly early February 2020).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Inform and engage with dynamic employee experiences</H1>\n<P>Build your modern intranet on SharePoint in Office 365 and get the benefits of investing in business outcomes – reducing IT and development costs, increasing business speed and agility, and up-leveling the dynamic and welcoming nature of your intranet.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SharePoint page version history</STRONG></P>\n<P>This feature will allow people who are able to edit SharePoint pages to access the version history by clicking into \"page details.\"</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Once in, they would have the option to:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Highlight changes on the page between the current and previous version</LI>\n<LI>Delete older versions</LI>\n<LI>And restore from older versions.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" style=\"width: 600px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168041iFD2D86D1158B0D1A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" alt=\"View SharePoint page version history within &quot;Page details&quot; to highlight differences and revert and/or delete if desired.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">View SharePoint page version history within \"Page details\" to highlight differences and revert and/or delete if desired.</span></span></P>\n<P>I like to think of this one as \"Back to the future\" without the DeLorean. Great Scott! That's a nice 1.21 GIGAWATTS jolt to your pages!!!!</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?rtc=1&amp;searchterms=57813\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 57813</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/management-and-lifecycle-of-a-sharepoint-modern-page-3410a04c-3ca4-4a4c-b867-33ab5c8bdcf3#bkmk_version\" target=\"_self\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Custom search results pages for SharePoint Sites</STRONG></P>\n<P>This feature gives tenant admins, or SharePoint site owners who have specialized search needs, the ability to build a custom search results page. You would build the custom page using open-source search web parts from the SharePoint Patterns and Practices community or any custom web parts developed using the SharePoint Framework (SPFx).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_2.png\" style=\"width: 600px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168040iC5A75A3076F4CBD0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_2.png\" alt=\"Build and design your own custom search results pages for SharePoint sites.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Build and design your own custom search results pages for SharePoint sites.</span></span></P>\n<P>A few notes:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Only the modern navigation bar search box can display a custom search results page.</LI>\n<LI>SharePoint site owners will be able customize a search results page on modern sites like group-connected team sites and communication sites.</LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions/85238\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=32738\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 32738</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Stream FYI: \"Office 365 Video retirement\"</STRONG></P>\n<P>Good news: Office 365 Video customers in most regions are now able to migrate their video content to Microsoft Stream using the administration migration tool.&nbsp;Microsoft Stream builds on the best of Office 365 Video adding intelligence and deeper integration throughout Office 365, like SharePoint, Yammer, Teams, Office apps and more. Behind the scenes, we’ve been busy improving the platform in preparation for Office 365 Video migrations.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>There is good documentation to <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/stream/migrate-from-office-365\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn how to begin your migration</A>&nbsp;today! And to <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-stream-blog/office-365-video-retirement-amp-migration-timelines/ba-p/1072819\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about the details of the Office 365 Video retirement plan</A> in full.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Image resizing in the Image web part</STRONG></P>\n<P>We are introducing the ability to resize an image in the modern SharePoint experience. The Image web part lets an editor insert an image on a page, whether from their SharePoint site, uploaded from their computer, or from an external web location. Once the image is chosen, you can resize it in the context of the other content of the page.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_3.png\" style=\"width: 742px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168045i480CFCE98ADE17EA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_3.png\" alt=\"Resize an photo within the SharePoint Image web part; it retains the ratio of your choice across various screen sizes and resolutions.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Resize an photo within the SharePoint Image web part; it retains the ratio of your choice across various screen sizes and resolutions.</span></span></P>\n<P>A quick note: the image will still resize automatically with responsive flow across various screen and device size and resolution in the same ratio for how you resize it.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/use-the-image-web-part-a63b335b-ad0a-4954-a65d-33c6af68beb2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?rtc=1%26filters=&amp;searchterms=57812\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID:&nbsp;57812</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Teamwork updates across SharePoint team sites, OneDrive and Microsoft Teams</H1>\n<P>Microsoft 365 is designed to be a universal toolkit for teamwork – to give you the right tools for the right task, along with common services to help you seamlessly work across applications. SharePoint is the intelligent content service that powers teamwork – to better collaborate on proposals, projects, and campaigns throughout your organization – and is integrated with Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Yammer, Stream, Planner and much more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SharePoint team sites 'Next steps' panel</STRONG></P>\n<P>As you’ll hear Nicole explain in this month’s SharePoint Roadmap Pitstop: January 2020 edition (podcast), we're expanding the in-product help that appears at the top-right of your SharePoint team sites – to make people’s first-run experiences with SharePoint sites that much easier and actionable.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Just click on the megaphone icon to see the tips from the Office 365 suite header at the top of the team site.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SP_Next-steps_020620_001_Next-steps-panel-pre-groupify.jpg\" style=\"width: 204px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/169477i110973187FA6E01C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"SP_Next-steps_020620_001_Next-steps-panel-pre-groupify.jpg\" alt=\"Click on the megaphone icon in the upper right corner of a SharePoint site to bring up the &quot;Next steps&quot; panel for guidance on your first-run experience.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Click on the megaphone icon in the upper right corner of a SharePoint site to bring up the \"Next steps\" panel for guidance on your first-run experience.</span></span></P>\n<P>The four tips your users might see today are: upload files, add members, post news, and add additional Office 365 Group apps. All to help you move forward as a team and work out-loud and with confidence and awareness on how everything works in and around your SharePoint site interaction.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-next-steps-moves-people-to-the-latest-collaboration/ba-p/1156066\" target=\"_self\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?rtc=2&amp;filters=&amp;searchterms=46832\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 46832</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Email notifications for comments and @mentions in Word, PowerPoint, and Excel</STRONG></P>\n<P>Currently, when a user comments on a document, presentation, or spreadsheet and @mentions someone, that person would receive an email with a link to that comment. Clicking on the link would then bring the person to the comment within the document itself.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>With this update, when the person gets an email from an @mention or a reply to their comment, the email would now show both the comment thread and the surrounding document context without requiring the person to open the document - it all happens in the mail client, including the ability to reply to the comment without needing to open the document.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_5.png\" style=\"width: 600px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168044iD338A59139D922C5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_5.png\" alt=\"Get notifications in email when someone comments or @mentions you. Add your own comment in context from within the email itself.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Get notifications in email when someone comments or @mentions you. Add your own comment in context from within the email itself.</span></span></P>\n<P>Quick note to admins: This feature is <U>on</U> by default and can be adjusted via PowerShell.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>I've been using this within the Outlook Progressive Web App (PWA) experience and will attest to both the ease of doing these actions and the simple edict that it improves my engagement when addressing questions and comments associated to documents just due to it being easy and in the context of the email triage mode I'm in. No context switching, much more streamlined… engaged.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Roadmap&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=51538\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 51538</A>.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/use-mention-in-comments-to-tag-someone-for-feedback-644bf689-31a0-4977-a4fb-afe01820c1fd\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New article to highlight: \"<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/enterprise/teams-sharepoint-online-sites-highly-regulated-data\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint sites for highly regulated data</A>\"</STRONG></P>\n<P>This article provides guidance for users of Microsoft 365 E3 and/or E5 that offer cloud-based services so that you can create, store, secure, and manage your highly regulated data stored in files. It covers the collective value across compliant storage, access control, file labeling, DLP, and encryption. The last portion of the article presents three phases: 1) Design, 2) Configure, and 3) Adoption. Certainly worth a read if you have and manage highly regulated data.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Related technology</H1>\n<P><STRONG>New features coming to the Office 365 app launcher and Office.com</STRONG></P>\n<P>A lot of what people see and can do in Office 365 starts in the app launcher. Once in the app launcher, individuals can manage pinned applications. Related to this is when they go to Office.com, they would see the most recently accessed applications. However, until now, the apps shown in the Office 365 app launcher and on the Office.com home page may currently not be the same.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>With this change, users will see the same set of applications on Office.com that they see in the Office 365 app launcher.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_6.png\" style=\"width: 600px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168046iEC8EED526030FD47/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_6.png\" alt=\"Manage app visibility for people when they visit Office.com and open the Office 365 app launcher.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Manage app visibility for people when they visit Office.com and open the Office 365 app launcher.</span></span></P>\n<P>By default, both will display all <U>launched</U> apps. This will help the consistency of mental muscle memory of launching apps throughout the suite experience, including your favorite app: SharePoint, right?</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions/81559\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Roadmap&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=59667\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ID: 59667</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Windows 7 End of Support and Office 365 ProPlus </STRONG>[MC192504]</P>\n<P>As&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/4057281/windows-7-support-will-end-on-january-14-2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">announced</A>&nbsp;previously, Windows 7 is now out of support as of January 14, 2020. Because&nbsp;Office 365 is governed by the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/help/30881/modern-lifecycle-policy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Modern Lifecycle Policy</A>, customers are required to stay current as per the servicing and&nbsp;<A href=\"https://products.office.com/office-system-requirements\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">system requirements</A>&nbsp;for the product or service. This includes using Office 365 ProPlus on a Windows operating system that is currently in support.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Using Office 365 ProPlus on older, unsupported operating systems may cause performance and reliability issues over time. If your organization is using Office 365 ProPlus on devices running Windows 7, we strongly recommend your organization move those devices to&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/windows/end-of-windows-7-support?rtc=1#office-ContentAreaHeadingTemplate-s9f0ou1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Windows 10</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We recommend that organizations migrate to Windows 10 or a supported operating system in order to continue receiving new feature updates to Office 365 ProPlus.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>A note on this closely related to The Intrazone: you can use OneDrive's <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/back-up-your-documents-pictures-and-desktop-folders-with-onedrive-d61a7930-a6fb-4b95-b28a-6552e77c3057\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">“known folder move” (KFM)</A> feature to help back and move files into Microsoft 365 as a step in your transition to Windows 10.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For more information, here is a key <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/deployoffice/windows-7-support\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">support article</A>&nbsp;for Windows 7-to-10 and OneDrive's known folder move, plus a helpful&nbsp;<A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=2086115\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">FAQ</A> page.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>February 2020 <SPAN style=\"text-decoration: line-through;\">teasers</SPAN> resolutions</H1>\n<P>Psst, still here? Still scrolling the page looking for the rolled out goodness? If so, here’s a few teasers of what’s to come to production next month…</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Teaser #1: <STRONG>Global reader experience for the SharePoint admin center</STRONG> [Roadmap ID:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;featureid=59984\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">59984</A>]</LI>\n<LI>Teaser #2: <STRONG>SharePoint brings Integrations with Power Automate and Power Apps to GCC Tenants</STRONG> [Roadmap&nbsp;ID&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;featureid=33770\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">33770</A>]</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>… shhh, tell everyone.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Helpful, ongoing change management resources</H1>\n<UL>\n<LI>\"<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/office365/admin/manage/stay-on-top-of-updates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Stay on top of Office 365 changes</A>\"</LI>\n<LI>\"<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/office365/admin/manage/message-center\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Message center in Office 365</A>\"</LI>\n<UL>\n<LI>Install the <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=627216\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 admin app</A>; view Message Center posts and stay current with push notifications.</LI>\n</UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365 public roadmap</A><SPAN> + pre-filtered URL for </SPAN><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?ms.url=roadmap&amp;rtc=1&amp;filters=Rolling%20Out%2CLaunched%2CIn%20Development%2CYammer%2CSharePoint%2CMicrosoft%20Stream%2COneDrive%20for%20Business\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer and Stream roadmap items</A><SPAN>.</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>SharePoint</STRONG> <A href=\"https://www.facebook.com/MSSharePoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facebook</A> | <A href=\"https://twitter.com/SharePoint\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A> | <A href=\"http://office.com/sharepoint/community\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint Community Blog</A> | <A href=\"https://sharepoint.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>OneDrive</STRONG> <A href=\"https://www.facebook.com/OneDrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facebook</A> | <A href=\"https://www.twitter.com/onedrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</A> | <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SharePoint/blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">OneDrive Community Blog</A> | <A href=\"https://onedrive.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI>Follow me to catch <STRONG>news and interesting SharePoint things</STRONG>: <A href=\"https://twitter.com/mkashman\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@mkashman</A>; pre-warning of occasional bad puns, too.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Thanks for tuning in and/or reading this episode/blog of the <STRONG>Intrazone Roadmap Pitstop – January 2020 </STRONG>(<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-january-2020/ba-p/1139511\" target=\"_self\">blog</A>/<A href=\"http://intrazone.mpsn.libsynpro.com/sharepoint-roadmap-pitstop-january-2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">podcast</A>). rich set of solutions for collaborating with users both inside and outside of your organization (such as partners, vendors, clients, or customers). In this episode, we cover various levels of “extranet” to discover best practices when using and configuring Microsoft Teams, SharePoint and OneDrive for external collaboration.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n As our SharePoint PnP community friends David Warner II and Vesa Juvonen say, “Sharing is caring.” And if sharing is caring, external sharing is \n <U>\n  extra\n </U> caring. Yes, you can have it both ways.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n And we've another special episode intro guest (from my biased-host perspective): my dad, Howard Kashman. Christian talks through many solutions that allow for collaboration with customers, partners, and virtual teams that stretch inside and outside of your organization, with a focus on which tools work the best in different scenarios – across SharePoint, Teams, Yammer, OneDrive, Stream, and more. &nbsp;&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\">Topics raised during this session:&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"\">&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Customers’ shifting priorities, Microsoft’s shifting product capabilities, and Partner monetization opportunities.&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>Discussion on purpose-built apps vs delivering experiences</LI>\n<LI>Teams vs SharePoint extensibility</LI>\n<LI>Value-add vs branded UI and strategies for Customer migration to cloud and for staying up-to-date on latest technologies.&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>Fundamental approach –<WBR /><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>lead with Teams and add SharePoint for news and Intranet.&nbsp;&nbsp;</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>In this episode, 19 recently released articles from Microsoft and the PnP Community are highlighted.</P>\n<P Managed Metadata Service (MMS) delivers centralized management of taxonomy (hierarchies of tags and terms) and content types. Today, MMS is used to provide a unified set of terms to apply to content in Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As we prepare for the general release of Project Cortex later in 2020, our first step is to update the MMS in SharePoint.&nbsp; In April 2020, we’ll start to release the following enhancements to Targeted Release:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>A modern term management system in the&nbsp;SharePoint admin center.&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>A modern content type gallery in the&nbsp;SharePoint admin center, to create and manage content types in the content type hub.&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>An update to the tagging and filtering interface for MMS columns in lists and libraries.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Importantly, these features will require no migration or change to the data—terms or content types—in your existing MMS, but will unlock new capabilities for admins and information workers.</P>\n<P>.</P>\n<H2>Managing taxonomies in the SharePoint admin center</H2>\n<P>You’ll find the <STRONG>new term manager</STRONG> in the <STRONG>Content services</STRONG> section of the SharePoint admin center, providing modern, integrated controls for the creation and management of organizational taxonomies and glossaries. &nbsp;&nbsp;You’ll be able to work with your preexisting global term sets and create new sets without reconfiguring your existing MMS Taxonomy.&nbsp; We’ve also <STRONG>increased the number of terms supported at a tenant level from 200,000 to 1,000,000</STRONG>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"TS01.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182008i5394FF65F9F9D563/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"TS01.png\" alt=\"Figure 1 - Modern taxonomy management\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 1 - Modern taxonomy management</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Content type gallery</H2>\n<P>You can now manage content types in the new<STRONG> content type gallery</STRONG> in the SharePoint admin center.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>What’s a <STRONG>content type</STRONG>?&nbsp; Content types create a hierarchy of information categories that you can use to define templates, metadata and document processing rules.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The content type list allows you to group on different columns and save custom views. The content type gallery also streamlines the process of adding, removing or changing custom columns.&nbsp; The new gallery provides a centralized view over content types originally established in the original site-based content type hubs.</P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;<span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"CGAnimated.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img types\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 3 - Managing content types</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In SharePoint lists and libraries, an team available live to answer questions on MMS during the <A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/project-cortex-microsoft-365/project-cortex-office-hours/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Project Cortex Office Hours</A> call on May 20, 2020.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>After the initial release of modern MMS experiences, we’ll be updating the site-based admin experiences to The templates bring together news, events, highlighted content, quick links and more. Each has been designed with a specific scope and audience for our Education customers: &nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://lookbook.microsoft.com/details/44dc3585-9140-4183-81fc-bdb057f71ac1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">School home page</A>: a central, institution-wide landing experience for students and staff with the latest school happenings and important resources.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://lookbook.microsoft.com/details/eb5d4741-e2f4-44f1-954b-e7d598585c63\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Staff home page</A>: a dashboard for staff members with time-saving links, documents, and calls-to-action. This template is designed to be used with a <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/create-a-staff-team-in-microsoft-teams-314ac9d5-36a9-408e-8ae4-7ef20e9f1ddf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Staff team</A> or a <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/create-a-plc-team-in-microsoft-teams-ad803fa2-c967-41b4-ae37-0bf60f17fa00\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Professional Learning Community (PLC) team</A> in Microsoft Teams for Education.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://lookbook.microsoft.com/details/f70a722f-e20a-4f0e-a0e7-ed75b3c9a74a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Class home page</A>: a dashboard for a class with resources, updates, and learning content. This template is designed to be used with a <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/create-a-class-team-in-microsoft-teams-fae422eb-58b7-4431-9ff2-a4b9b6ae7c5b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Class team</A> in Microsoft Teams for Education.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>While planning and designing the templates, we listened to school leaders and educators all over the world. Armed with this feedback, we went to work to provide rich, effective site templates that help students and staff stay connected and up-to-date on school life and class work. Plus, the sites look great on any device by default, so students and educators can use them on desktop, tablet and mobile.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Look Book view tech community post.JPG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209446i74170E08C8E0CD73/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Look Book view tech community post.JPG\" alt=\"A brand new Schools category in the Microsoft look book, where you can find site templates for our Education customers\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">A brand new Schools category in the Microsoft look book, where you can find site templates for our Education customers</span></span></P>\n<P><BR />To help you get started quickly, we've provided&nbsp;<A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2137908\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">step-by-step guidance</A>&nbsp;on how to customize the templates to suit your needs, and how you can bring your home pages into Microsoft Teams for Education.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P>Staying engaged and on top of key information is critical for students and educators, especially when faced with the new challenges of hybrid learning. These site templates provide a straightforward path for everyone in your school community to access what they need. Here’s how each of these templates can benefit your school:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">School home page</FONT></P>\n<P>Dress it up in school spirit with your school colors, logo, motto, and values - this is the internal landing experience for your school. School leaders share schoolwide news, events, and resources, making it the single place where teachers and students can stay up-to-date on the latest happenings that affect their teaching and learning.&nbsp;<BR /><BR /><A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2135285\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about more about the School home page template and how to make it your own.</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"School V2 tech community.JPG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209460i0FFF3E8019C7B8B0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"School V2 tech community.JPG\" alt=\"School home page template\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">School home page template</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Staff home page</FONT></P>\n<P>Use this template as a dashboard for staff members - whether it’s schoolwide, a department working groups, or a PLC. This is where highlighted documents, tool links, and essential event info lives together, organized.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P>Bonus: This page can be added alongside your team meetings and discussions in Microsoft Teams. Pin it as a tab to your Staff or PLC team so staff members always knows where to get their updates.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2135531\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about the Staff home page template and how to customize it just for you.</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Staff V2 tech community.JPG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209462iD2A87DA0504943BF/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Staff V2 tech community.JPG\" alt=\"Staff home page template\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Staff home page template</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Class home page<BR /></FONT></P>\n<P>This template serves as a central dashboard for a class.&nbsp;Welcome students, highlight key information and learning resources, and get students what they need. You can even add your contact info and an introduction.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The Class home page template is intended to be used with a Class team in Microsoft Teams. Students get the combined functionality of the Class home page along with assignments and online meetings, without ever leaving Teams.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><BR /><A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2135532\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about all the elements in the Class home page template and how you can customize them.</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Class V2 tech community.JPG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209464i538C8C0629D9F8C1/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Class V2 tech community.JPG\" alt=\"Class home page template\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Class home page template</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Summary of what’s included with each template:</FONT></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Home page layout and sample content.</LI>\n<LI>Branding elements, including a site theme.&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>Documentation to help you get started and make your sites your own.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"5\">FAQ</FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>1. What permissions do I need to add&nbsp;</STRONG><STRONG>the templates from the Microsoft Look Book site?</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>School home page: You need to have the permissions to create new SharePoint sites in your organization.&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>Staff home page: You need to be an Owner of the Staff team or Professional Learning Community (PLC) team where you want to add this site template, or be a Global admin.</LI>\n<LI>Class home page: You need to be an Owner of the Class team where you want to add this site template, or be a Global admin. All teachers of a Class team are Owners by default.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>2. How do I bring the sites into Microsoft Teams for Education? </STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>School home page: You can add the home page as a Website tab in teams of your choosing. <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2137510\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn how.</A></LI>\n<LI>Staff team: You can add the home page as a SharePoint tab in the associated Staff or Professional Learning Community (PLC) team. <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2137033\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn how.</A></LI>\n<LI>Class team: You can add the home page as a SharePoint tab in the associated Class team. <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2137034\" target=\"_self\">Learn how</A>.&nbsp; <BR /><STRONG><BR /></STRONG></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG><STRONG>3. Can you show me an example of how these site templates can be customized?</STRONG><BR /></STRONG></P>\n<P>Yes. Here’s an example showing each of the three site templates customized for a higher education institution just by changing the theme, text, images, page layout, and linked content. With SharePoint, it is easily edit, add, move, or remove elements of the page to suit your needs. Try it today.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Bellows V2 tech community.JPG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209466iB458B4EB67D87300/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Bellows V2 tech community.JPG\" alt=\"Example of how the templates can be customized\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Example of how the templates can be customized</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Related reads and resources</FONT></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A brought a ton of news, announcement and best practices from Microsoft for team collaboration and employee engagement. And now, it’s all readying to fly across the pond to Prague for the \n <A href=\"https://www.sharepointeurope.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  <STRONG>\n   European SharePoint Conference 2019\n  </STRONG>\n </A> (ESPC; Dec.2-5, 2019). ESPC is a premiere event to learn, connect and network with local and international experts – to highlight what’s new and to erase any confusion specific to your business in Europe.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_0.jpeg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157595i54F6B9464B1BEDFD/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_0.jpeg\" alt=\"A busy Expo Hall during ESPC 2018.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">A busy Expo Hall during ESPC 2018.</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n The conference has a host of wonderful speakers and activities – including a keynote from Jeff Teper (CVP – SharePoint, OneDrive and Office), and speakers both Microsoft and MVP experts from around the world. All are equipped with the latest information, demos, PowerPoint slides and tips to get you up-to-speed on Microsoft 365 – including SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer, Stream and Teams… and of course, that’s not all – the event covers Azure, Windows and more – with a blended focus across business users, developers and IT.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Below, you’ll find:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   SharePoint, OneDrive, Yammer and Teams keynote and breakout sessions delivered by Microsoft\n  </STRONG>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Additional activities throughout ESPC 2019 + key resources\n  </STRONG>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n This blog highlights the main Microsoft-led sessions focused on Microsoft 365 alongside all the great content and activities throughout the entire event. The breadth of ESPC19 offerings spans \n <A href=\"https://www.sharepointeurope.com/espc19-keynotes/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  six keynotes\n </A>, \n <A href=\"https://www.sharepointeurope.com/conference/schedule/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  150+ sessions from 100-400 level\n </A>, 11 workshops (on the first day) and more.\n</P> \n<P>\n Driving O365 Adoption\n  </A>” by Karuana Gatimu\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  10:15-11:15 “\n  <A href=\"https://www.sharepointeurope.com/events/office-365-and-sharepoint-pnp-our-community-rocks/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Office 365 and SharePoint PnP – Our community rocks!\n  </A>” by Vesa Juvonen\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  10:15-11:15 “\n  <A href=\"https://www.sharepointeurope.com/events/file-sharing-internally-externally-with-microsoft-365/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   File sharing internally &amp; externally with Microsoft 365\n  </A>” by Rafael Lopez-Uricoechea\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  11:45-12:45 “\n  <A href=\"https://www.sharepointeurope.com/events/the-future-of-yammer-share-knowledge-engage-leaders-and-build-communities-in-microsoft-365/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   The future of Yammer: Share knowledge, engage leaders, and build communities in Microsoft 365\n  </A>” by Dan Holme and Mike Holste\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  14:00-15:00 “\n  <A href=\"https://www.sharepointeurope.com/events/microsoft-stream-transform-communication-and-learning-with-intelligent-video/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Microsoft Stream: Transform communication and learning with intelligent video\n  </A>” by Christina Torok\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  14:00-15:00 “\n  <A href=\"https://www.sharepointeurope.com/events/whats-new-and-next-for-microsoft-teams-meetings/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   What's New and Next for Microsoft Teams Meetings\n  </A>” by Karuana Gatimu\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  15:15-16:15 “\n  <A href=\"https://www.sharepointeurope.com/events/diversity-and-inclusion-mentoring/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Diversity and Inclusion - Mentoring Workshop\n  </A>” by Karuana Gatimu and Heather Newman\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <A href=\"https://www.sharepointeurope.com/pricing\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  <STRONG>\n   Register today!\n  </STRONG>\n </A>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <FONT size=\"5\">\n  Additional activities throughout ESPC 2019\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sharepointeurope.com%2Fconference%2Fsponsors%2F&amp;data=02%7C01%7CMark.Kashman%40microsoft.com%7C85db92edbdeb4fac30fd08d767c8b71c%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637091985185398636&amp;sdata=ciHFq1TanIVUIld%2Fw43zhr6%2FN1Rau%2FoypHzI5XmHNJs%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   ESPC19 EXPO\n  </A> featuring 65+ companies and community area.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sharepointeurope.com%2Fdiversity-and-inclusion-workshops%2F&amp;data=02%7C01%7CMark.Kashman%40microsoft.com%7C85db92edbdeb4fac30fd08d767c8b71c%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637091985185388632&amp;sdata=xigZUByf1B61mB0xCYIenBbdoluYrPNcoh1MhtloaZw%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   D&amp;I Workshops\n  </A> with Karuana Gatimu and Heather Newman\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sharepointeurope.com%2Fevents%2Fwomen-in-tech-lunch-personal-brand-storytelling-learn-to-tell-the-story-that-makes-you-uniquely-you%2F%3Fmc_cid%3D2a4b0191a3%26mc_eid%3D973cbea95a&amp;data=02%7C01%7CMark.Kashman%40microsoft.com%7C85db92edbdeb4fac30fd08d767c8b71c%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637091985185388632&amp;sdata=ENMotwhtcdoPG96Bu2MG9RUP1wPCSTGU72SclNWWp6U%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Women in Tech Lunch\n  </A> with Miri Rodriguez\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   ESPC19 Party \n  </A>| \n  <STRONG>\n   SaSaZu Nightclub\n  </STRONG> on Wednesday, Dec. 4\n  <SUP>\n   th\n  </SUP> \n  <UL> \n   <LI>\n    Note: the \n    <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sharepointeurope.com%2F2019-community-awards%2F&amp;data=02%7C01%7CMark.Kashman%40microsoft.com%7C85db92edbdeb4fac30fd08d767c8b71c%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637091985185378625&amp;sdata=7DMJUW8ikHTN0Gnq%2FrZAQ1x7%2FyFkN%2FrPWBHH32T99LE%3D&amp;reserved=0\" href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sharepointeurope.com%2Fmicrosoft-at-espc19%2F%23sessions&amp;data=02%7C01%7CMark.Kashman%40microsoft.com%7C85db92edbdeb4fac30fd08d767c8b71c%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637091985185388632&amp;sdata=xf4w6doTn7xPCahf34z7muglZVvbsUt544MGfZ1gnb4%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   All Microsoft sessions at ESPC19\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sharepointeurope.com%2Fconference%2Fschedule%2F&amp;data=02%7C01%7CMark.Kashman%40microsoft.com%7C85db92edbdeb4fac30fd08d767c8b71c%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637091985185398636&amp;sdata=xBOzK6PbiQbIGhT0CTzWyhW1pvieD7iUIAnZI%2BcH5BA%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   ESPC19 Sessions\n  </A> – all\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Follow all the ESPC 2019 action on Twitter: \n  <A href=\"https://twitter.com/hashtag/ESPC19\" last year's ESPC 2018.</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n Thanks, Mark Kashman, senior product manager – Microsoft\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <A href=\"https://www.sharepointeurope.com/pricing\" title=\"clipboard_image_3.png\" alt=\"clipboard_image_3.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 19 Nov 2019 19:44:04 Kashman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157595i54F6B9464B1BEDFD/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn70@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-29-551_440eb5a3ebf29cd0.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157596i0D637BF4D94E5364/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn17@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-31-37-971_ac495a74310b4ee1.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157597iB49EDEFD03A7009D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-31-43-048_d86c3f2af3b45167.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157598i21B2BB6D5A2CEF86/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn6@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-31-40-767_1118defda101b69d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688843},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"“Bobble and grow” 🎙 a bonus episode of The Intrazone","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/bobble-and-grow-a-bonus-episode-of-the-intrazone/ba-p/1167335","description":"<P>\n This week, we’ve got a special bonus episode of The Intrazone. You’ll hear “\n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SharePointSwoop\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  SharePoint Swoop\n </A>” – the intranet makeover show featuring \n <A href=\"https://www.funko.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Funko Inc.\n </A> – in a condensed audible format with new narration for context. In addition to the show, scroll below to read a new, written interview with \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/imslc/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Scott Christensen\n </A> – SharePoint lead at Funko. He shares more about the current state at Funko - the expanded use of SharePoint, Power Apps and their approach to self-service for users with governance firmly in place.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Swoop showcases both Funko’s IT and business journey to the cloud with expert help from Swooperstars and Microsoft MVPs: \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/susanhanley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Sue Hanley\n </A>, \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/sharepointguru/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Laura Rogers\n </A> and \n <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/bniaulin/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Benjamin Niaulin\n </A>; so grateful always to their contribution of Swoop and the community collective.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n It’s fun, they’re engaging, and you’ll learn a ton about real-world use and adoption of Microsoft 365.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n OK, time to hear Funko “\n <A href=\"http://intrazone.mpsn.libsynpro.com/bobble-and-grow-with-funko\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Bobble and grow\n </A>”!\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <IFRAME src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/13104341/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/247bc1/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" style=\"border: none;\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" oallowfullscreen=\"\" msallowfullscreen=\"\"></IFRAME>\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ_Swoop_Bobble-and-grow_001_Swoop-stills-blend.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/170490i6354AFBB27FC3384/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ_Swoop_Bobble-and-grow_001_Swoop-stills-blend.jpg\" alt=\"IZ_Swoop_Bobble-and-grow_001_Swoop-stills-blend.jpg\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n <FONT size=\"5\">\n  <SPAN>\n   <STRONG>\n    Written interview with Scott Christensen, SharePoint lead at Funko&nbsp;\n   </STRONG>\n  </SPAN>\n  <SPAN>\n   <STRONG>\n    &nbsp;\n   </STRONG>\n  </SPAN>\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   <U>\n    Mark Kashman\n   </U>\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   : First, let’s start with who you are and what your role is at Funko? Also, why do they call you SharePoint Hulk?&nbsp;\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <U>\n   Scott Christensen\n  </U>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  :&nbsp;Since the recording of the Swoop show, I'm proud to convey that Funko retained my services as a full-time employee of Funko as the Senior SharePoint engineer.&nbsp; I’m now a member of the Infrastructure arm of our IT organization and provide one-stop shopping for all things Office 365/SharePoint for Funko. More so, the ‘Credible Hulk’, I’ve chosen the Hulk as my favorite hero because of his strength and never-ending resolve – to me SharePoint is the Hulk of Office 365 – the backbone of the Office 365 platform. We’re all collectors here at Funko of something, and you’ll find SharePoint mints, SharePoint 2003 cards, a Site Server autographed box, SharePoint socks, and of course the SharePoint Monkey flying among my Hulk Pop/toy collection.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorMark Kashman_1\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IZ_Swoop_Bobble-and-grow_002_Scott-hulkified-desk.jpg\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/170480iF568D915EE05D73A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IZ_Swoop_Bobble-and-grow_002_Scott-hulkified-desk.jpg\" alt=\"As you can see by how he adorns his desk, Scott Christensen is one 'credible Hulk' surrounded by all sorts of strong, green inspiration.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">As you can see by how he adorns his desk, Scott Christensen is one 'credible Hulk' surrounded by all sorts of strong, green inspiration.</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   <U>\n    Mark\n   </U>\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   : First, congrats on being hired as a full-time employee at Funko; I knew that was in your future. Now, as you’ve grown in your career… how has your intranet grown since SharePoint Swoop roughly two years ago?&nbsp;\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <U>\n   Scott\n  </U>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  : Just after recording the Swoop web series, we continued build out of our department/teams’ sites and began realizing the full extent of the additional services we could begin to provide Funko. After launching our intranet, our number of SharePoint sites grew with the business, and we now hover around 120 sites; permissions managed via Office 365 Groups. We enjoy branding our sites with Funko Pop banners in various themes we have licensed – the modernization of the SharePoint user experience makes this possible and much easier than the former classic SharePoint sites.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  With our intranet now company-wide, we began building SharePoint list solutions to solve business needs - immediately wanting to brand SharePoint list forms as we now have for our Funko sites.&nbsp; To accomplish this, we utilized the ‘Customized Forms’ features via PowerApps to hide fields, add logos/branding, and to put helpful instructions directly into intake forms. As we matured these solutions, we introduced more sophistication using full PowerApps, Power BI Dashboards, and Microsoft Flow solutions to bring more and more SharePoint list-based solutions to life.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  We also architected and deployed our extranet entry point we call ‘Area51’ that securely allows Funko employees to share files and folders safely with our white-listed&nbsp;vendors and partner communities. This fundamentally changed the way Funko shares digital information with partners, and further steps are necessary here, and can be taken, as the organization prepares for further security and compliance.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   &nbsp;\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   <U>\n    Mark\n   </U>\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   : That’s a lot. I can see how you might start thinking about ways to optimize your time and adherence to governance as you grow. How do you approach self-serving under the guidelines you and IT set as policy?&nbsp;\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <U>\n   Scott\n  </U>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  : I will admit that I'm not a fan of self-service site creation as policy, however that doesn’t come at the expense of our users - I just like to build the sites. We build tailored sites of all types for our people, and train them to maintain the sites themselves with appropriate documentation, support, and governance oversight. Funko has created a community of site owners that partner with me directly to fully enable the site owner to manage their sites. Our Funko employees are becoming more self-serving in that they have the entire Office 365 suite of apps all designed together to help them work seamlessly together regardless of platform or location. More recently, people are building ‘public’ communications sites to expose content to the broader Funko community, confidently beyond their core team and ‘private’ team sites.&nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   &nbsp;\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   <U>\n    Mark\n   </U>\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   : In Swoop, we saw you create a&nbsp;\n   <EM>\n    Truck Transfer\n   </EM>&nbsp;app with Laura Rogers. Since then, what other PowerApps-based solutions have you created?&nbsp;\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <U>\n   Scott\n  </U>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  : We enjoyed working with the MVPs of the Swoop show – and for PowerApps, that was Laura Rogers. At conclusion of filming, Funko IT was already looking at requirements for a tracking application that could support our Warehouse beyond the Transfer Truck capabilities. Those conversations lead to us talking with Laura’s husband Chris Rogers – who had built a fancy grid-based control for PowerApps that we utilized as a calendaring solution for the Funko Warehouse shipments coming and going from our Everett based warehouses.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  Over a six-month project, we worked with Chris (\n </SPAN>\n <A href=\"https://www.iwmentor.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  IW Mentor\n </A>\n <SPAN>\n  ) to develop a full Logistics Calendar solution for Funko. The solution consists of everything living in one site collection that includes, SharePoint lists, the PowerApps app, site content to expose the solution, training FAQs and related content, and an Issues list to track issues, bugs, and feature requests for the solution.\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   <U>\n    Mark\n   </U>\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   : So glad to hear you kept connected to Laura, and her husband, Chris. Among all the above, or something you’ve not yet shared, what is the thing you are most proud of that you’re promoting in your digital workplace expansion?&nbsp;\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <U>\n   Scott\n  </U>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  : I have always been a ‘Jack-of-all-trades'...SharePoint requires this to some degree, but I’m becoming a platform Hulk myself even though I'm officially a ‘non-coder’. Coming from decades where designing, building, and customizing SharePoint formerly required larger teams of people and a significant hardware investment...I could not be prouder of the impact now achievable with a much smaller team (me):&nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <SPAN>\n   Migrated from SharePoint 2013 (behind the firewall) to Office 365 SharePoint Online&nbsp;\n  </SPAN>\n  <SPAN>\n   &nbsp;\n  </SPAN>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <SPAN>\n   Designed and deployed the company intranet&nbsp;\n  </SPAN>\n  <SPAN>\n   &nbsp;\n  </SPAN>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <SPAN>\n   Provisioned team/comm sites, established training for site owners&nbsp;\n  </SPAN>\n  <SPAN>\n   &nbsp;\n  </SPAN>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <SPAN>\n   Secured/deployed the company extranet, and established governance processes for managing external Sharing, domain whitelisting, and training users.\n  </SPAN>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;&nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   <U>\n    Mark\n   </U>\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   : Last question… what’s next for you and Funko?&nbsp;\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <U>\n   Scott\n  </U>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  : I am excited to continue redefining the IT solution landscape for Funko. We are scaling up here, and big things are possible when you have&nbsp;\n  <EM>\n   Hulkish\n  </EM>&nbsp;determination, passion for the Office 365 platform, and a growing list of teams and business processes that need be accessible on any device.&nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   &nbsp;\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   <U>\n    Mark\n   </U>\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   : Thanks for taking time to share more of what you are accomplishing at Funko, expanding your use of Office 365. And for being&nbsp;The&nbsp;(credible) SharePoint Hulk!&nbsp;\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <U>\n   Scott\n  </U>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  : Thank you for the opportunity to work with you again, Mark (and the Microsoft SharePoint team)!\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorMark Kashman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/170490i6354AFBB27FC3384/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn42@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-31-32-114_6b054de31876537e.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/170480iF568D915EE05D73A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn46@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-43-359_de0c6060b80611f3.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/170485i698DB3AB3A4BEAFA/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn9@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-44-005_6dc5857e2f64f366.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/170491i2FAFB8C7AF7B7C19/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn61@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-31-42-403_41c3f96a367e4fae.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/170489i6EE7329B8820E433/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn41@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-31-41-337_a50633407befdeab.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688832},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"SharePoint Development Community (PnP) – January 2020 update","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/sharepoint-development-community-pnp-january-2020-update/ba-p/1106949","description":"<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"pnp-jan-2020-promo.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/165264i34D328D4DAF66634/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"pnp-jan-2020-promo.png\" alt=\"pnp-jan-2020-promo.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Latest monthly summary of SharePoint Development guidance for SharePoint Online and on-premises is now available from the SharePoint Dev Blog. Check the latest news, samples and other guidance from this summary.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/blogs/sharepoint-development-community-pnp-january-2020-update/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer noreferrer noreferrer noreferrer\">SharePoint Dev Ecosystem / SharePoint PnP - January 2020 update</A>&nbsp;- at SP Dev Blog</LI>\n</UL>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 14 Jan 2020 10:29:01 +0000","feedId":13333,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/165264i34D328D4DAF66634/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"c59e2e794a2b43a24130dad5c0623d10","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn49@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-31-29-818_1d23fe1e0f4dd65f.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":289592,"destBytes":60012,"author":"Vesa Juvonen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/165264i34D328D4DAF66634/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn49@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-31-29-818_1d23fe1e0f4dd65f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598322688838},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:31:28","title":"Create a list from Microsoft Excel","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/create-a-list-from-microsoft-excel/ba-p/1422192","description":"<P>Every month, tens of millions of people turn to SharePoint lists to track and manage critical business and team data. Lists enable organizations and teams to store and visualize rows of data to share and collaborate on scenarios like inventory management, status reporting, deal milestones and more. They are easy to use, secure, with high capacity up to 30 million items in a single list.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Today, we’re pleased to announce <EM>lists from Excel</EM> is now rolled out worldwide to customers in Microsoft 365. This is a new way to create a list, saving you time while putting the data in a location that opens new scenarios.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Let’s dive into the details…</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Lists from Excel</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>To create a list from Excel, you can select a table from the Excel files in the SharePoint site, or from your device.&nbsp;You can change the field type of the column if needed, and all your table data will be copied to the new list.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"001_HERO_SharePoint-list-from-Excel.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/194890i74717619CC40BE29/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"001_HERO_SharePoint-list-from-Excel.gif\" alt=\"When you create a list from Microsoft Excel, you map table data to a new list – adjusting column types before you click Create.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">When you create a list from Microsoft Excel, you map table data to a new list – adjusting column types before you click Create.</span></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>A quick step-by-step ‘how to’</STRONG></P>\n<OL>\n<LI>From within your SharePoint site, click the upper-right gear icon and select <STRONG>Site contents</STRONG><FONT color=\"#0000FF\">*</FONT></LI>\n<LI>At the top of the Site contents page, Click <STRONG>New</STRONG> &gt; <STRONG>List</STRONG></LI>\n<LI>Click the <STRONG>From Excel</STRONG> tab</LI>\n<LI>Enter a name for your new list</LI>\n<LI>Click <STRONG>Upload file</STRONG> to select from your local device or pick from files already in Microsoft 365</LI>\n<LI>Update the column type headers; for example, change \"Number\" to <STRONG>Date and time</STRONG>; choice fields work, too, automatically aggregating unique values.</LI>\n<LI>Click <STRONG>Create </STRONG>to import the Excel table data and create a new SharePoint list</LI>\n</OL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"002_Create-list-Excel_import.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/194891i816BF1BA2A63B604/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"002_Create-list-Excel_import.jpg\" alt=\"Adjust the SharePoint column types before you import the Excel table data into Microsoft 365.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Adjust the SharePoint column types before you import the Excel table data into Microsoft 365.</span></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Your Excel data is now intact; your SharePoint list ready to extend in numerous ways:</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Further assign and adjust data types to columns in your list</LI>\n<LI>Enhance visuals by designing list row and column formatting</LI>\n<LI>Use conditional formatting rules to make the list data intuitive and helpful</LI>\n<LI>Set reminders on list items</LI>\n<LI>Build productivity apps with Power Automate (custom flows) and Power Apps (custom forms); your list becomes the foundational data source.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"003_Create-list-Excel_format.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/194892iC2D790B77D41B656/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"003_Create-list-Excel_format.jpg\" alt=\"Further refine your list with conditional formatting on rows and columns.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Further refine your list with conditional formatting on rows and columns.</span></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Note</STRONG>: You can analyze SharePoint list items from a view of the list to Excel – to work with the data in a spreadsheet; simply click <STRONG>Export to Excel</STRONG>. Note: Excel creates an Excel table with a one-way data connection based on a web query file. To bring a fresh copy of the SharePoint list to Excel, select <STRONG>Refresh All</STRONG> on the <STRONG>Data</STRONG> tab from within Excel. Changes made to the Excel table will not be sent to the SharePoint list. Learn more how to <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/Export-to-Excel-from-SharePoint-bfb2ea48-6118-4fa9-abb6-cced9424e5d9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">export to Excel from SharePoint</A>.</P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>In Summary </STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>It is easier than ever to get started with SharePoint lists – using Excel as shown above or based on <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/create-sharepoint-lists-from-other-lists/ba-p/533395\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">existing lists</A>. No matter how you start, it’s then easy to further configure lists by using views, filters, rules and reminders to increase the usefulness of your data – especially as data changes or is missing.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>You can further customize lists, too. It is possible to further extend with native integrations leveraging Power Apps and Power Automate. And when your forms and workflows get more complex or pull from multiple sources lean on the Power Platform tools directly available from your list.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Note</STRONG> | We recently announced <A href=\"https://aka.ms/MSLists/blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Lists</A> and how it is an evolution of SharePoint lists. For the <EM>list from Excel</EM> announcement above, we want to emphasize that you will be able to create a list from Microsoft Excel today and in the future when Microsoft Lists begins to roll out and broaden the lists story.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Learn more about how to <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/Create-a-list-in-SharePoint-0D397414-D95F-41EB-ADDD-5E6EFF41B083\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">create a list from Microsoft Excel</A>&nbsp;and see it in action, via demo video:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/uKtN8Mq6Wdw\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/uKtN8Mq6Wdw/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>... or in this&nbsp;<A href=\"https://demobuilderwebcpptxz.blob.core.windows.net/sharepoint-lists-create-list-from-excel/startdemo.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SharePoint list: \"Create list from Excel\"</A> click-thru demo.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Additional resources:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/create-a-list-in-sharepoint-0d397414-d95f-41eb-addd-5e6eff41b083\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Create a SharePoint list from scratch</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/create-a-new-sharepoint-list-based-on-the-columns-in-another-list-49666e8c-8c48-414f-8e5e-dc0e232acd27\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Create a new SharePoint list based on the columns in another list</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/create-a-column-in-a-sharepoint-list-or-library-2b0361ae-1bd3-41a3-8329-269e5f81cfa2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Create a column in a SharePoint list</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/create-change-or-delete-a-view-of-a-list-or-library-27ae65b8-bc5b-4949-b29b-4ee87144a9c9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Create, change, or delete a view for a SharePoint list</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/customize-list-form\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Configure a SharePoint list form by using Power Apps</A></LI>\n<LI>Sample flow | <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/sharepoint-scenario-approval-flow\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Extend SharePoint lists by creating a Power Automate flow to manage project approvals</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/sharepoint-bizapps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Productivity apps Resource Center</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Thanks, Mark Kashman, senior product manager - Microsoft&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT color=\"#0000FF\">*</FONT><STRONG><U>Frequently Asked Question</U></STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Q: When will I see the new list creation user interface from a team site home page (New &gt; List) drop-down menu?</STRONG></P>\n<P>A: We are planning to include the New &gt; List entry point from a site home page early Summer 2020. Until then, you can accomplish the above actions from the site’s Site Contents page, accessed from the upper-right gear icon menu.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sun, 14 Jun 2020
